Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Remigio e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 3 filhos ainda pequenos.Entrou para o programa de credito em 2005. Na altura vendia apenas roupa. Mas porque o negocio foi cresceendo, iniciou tambem a venda de loica.Ele trabalha juntamente com a sua mulher.Os filhos ainda nao vao a escola.Mas segundo ele logo que tiverem idade para tal, ele nao tera problemas em pagar a escola dos seus filhos.Com os rendimentos pensa no futuro construir uma casa propria porque a que tem agora e alugada.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Regina Jaime

texts.pt:
Regina is not married but lives with her 5 children and their father. She joined the credit program in 2006. She is now in the 6th cycle. The business is doing well and she wants to add to her inventory frozen chicken. Her children are in school. If the business continues to do well Regina wants to improve her home

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina e solteira e mae de 5 filhos.Vive maritalmente com o pai dos seus filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006.Agora esta no quinto ciclo. O negocio corre-lhe bem, por isso quer introduzir tambem a venda de frango congelado.Os seus filhos estao a estudar e ela comparticipa nas despesas da escola e ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. Se os negocios continuarem a correr bem ela pensa reabilitar a sua casa.

loans.use: Increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
E. Yagub is 30 years old. He is single. He was born in Sumgayit city and lives there. Sumgayit is situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic.

Yagub lives with his parents. They are very old. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

He started his business in 1998. He began his business with $300. He started selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, etc.

In 2004, Yagub borrowed $400 from Normicro, expanded his business and increased the selection of shoes. Now, he needs a $800 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other shoes and goods to increase his business and to improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income.

loans.use: To further develop his business, buy other shoes and goods

loans.name: Carolina Jorge

texts.pt:
Carolina works at a hospital as a janitor. She is the single mother of 4 children who are all in school. Her salary has been reduced so she joined the credit program. This is her first loan. She plans on investing this loan in her business. In the future she wants to improve her home. Carolina lives in Majancaze, a rural area.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina trabalha num hospital como servente.Ela e mae solteira e tem 4 filhos. Porque o salario dela e baixo ela entrou para o programa de credito do fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher. este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar.Ela pretende usar o valor para investir no seu negocio. Os filhos de carolina estudam. Se o negocio correr bem como ela pretende no futuro construir uma casa melhorada..Ela vive em Manjacaze,que e a Sede do distrito com o mesmo nome.E uma zona 100% rural.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin A. is 26 years old. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Agdam region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

He started his business in 2001, when he purchased a small variety of handbags. The work is interesting, but the salary is not enough to cover all of his family expenses.

In 2005, Elchin borrowed US$ 400 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased different sorts of handbags for women. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. It has hurt Elchin’s business, too. He wants to overcome this obstacle.

He needs a $700 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other handbags and expand the size of his shop to increase his business and to improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income.

loans.use: To buy handbags and expand the size of his shop to increase his business

loans.name: Dandy

texts.es:
Dandy lives on Puertas Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area in the city of La Paz. He works as a driver and has a car that requires general maintenance.

He supports his wife and small child with the money he earns as a driver.

The credit he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of spare parts and a motor for his vehicle.

This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation done qualified him for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Dandy vive en la calle Puertas, de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, de La ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica al transporte ya que cuenta con un automóvil el cual requiere de de un mantenimiento general.

Su familia actualmente consta de su esposa y un hijo pequeño, a los cuales mantiene con sus ingresos de transporte.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de repuestos y un motor para su vehiculo.

Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a motor for a vehicle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on N.2 Street in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. She sells hamburgers from her kiosk in the evening. The money is earned with the help of her family, as her husband and three children, ages 20,18 and 14 help with preparing the hamburgers.

The credit she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for her business.

This is her first credit with Impro. The evaluation done qualified her for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle n. 2 de la zona de Alto Lima de la Ciudad de El Alto . Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en su kiosco en horas de la tarde. Los ingresos que obtiene ayudan en la manutención de su familia, la cual consta de su esposo quien le ayuda en la preparación de las hamburguesas y tres hijos de 20, 18, 14 años de edad.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos para su negocio.

Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Capital for business

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
Viviano is a farmer and producer of cow’s milk, which he sells in his community to wholesale markets.

He lives in the Huayhuasi Community in Rio Abajo located two hours from the city of La Paz.

The credit will be used to purchase a high-end breed of cattle in order to increase milk production and, in turn, increase his income.

This is his first credit with Impro; the evaluation carried out demonstrated a steady stream of income and qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviano es agricultor y productor de leche de vaca, la cual pone a la venta en su comunidad, a comercializadores mayoristas.

Vive en la Comunidad de Huayhuasi sector rio Abajo ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche y asi mejorar sus ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada muestra un flujo de caja aceptable y lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a farmer, she produces cow milk and sell it to wholesalers in her community. She’s a single woman who lives in the community of Huayhuasi in the Río Abajo area, two hours away from the city of La Paz. She’ll use the loan to purchase a dairy cow of an improved breed to increase the production and rise her incomes. It’s the first credit with Impro and according to the evaluation she qualifys for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes es agricultora y productora de leche de vaca, la cual vende en su comunidad, a comercializadores mayoristas. Ella es soltera y vive en la Comunidad de Huayhuasi sector Rio Abajo ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is a farmer and milkmaid, she sells cow milk to her community and to bulk merchants. She lives with her husband who is a construction worker in the community. She has 4 sons, 11, 9, 7, and 2 years old. Roxana lives in the community of Huayhuasi in the Rio sector. It is two hours away from La Paz. She will use the loan to buy a better cow so she can scale up her milk production and get more income. This is the first credit with Impro and in her evaluation she shows enough income to cover the loan and her family needs. She qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Roxana es agricultora y productora de leche de vaca, la cual es vendida en su comunidad, a comercializadores mayoristas. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil en la comunidad; tiene 4 hijos de 11,9,7 y 2 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Huayhuasi sector Rio Abajo ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir tanto el préstamo como las necesidades de la familia. Esto la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de vaca lechera

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Mr. Timoteo A. lives in his own house in the Rio Seco neighborhood of the city El Alto with his wife and three daughters. Mr. Timoteo works as a chauffer for a private home and his wife does embroidery in a clothing shop at the city La Paz. With their savings they have built the structure and some dividing walls in their two-story home, which is partially finished and they currently live in the first floor. They will use the loan to finish the construction of the second floor. This is the first time Mr. Timoteo asks for a loan and in the socio-economical analysis done to him he qualifies favorably and is a candidate for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

El señor Timoteo A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijas; el señor Timoteo trabaja como chofer en un domicilio particular y su esposa realiza tejidos para una tienda de ropa en la ciudad de La Paz. Con sus ahorros construyeron la estructura y los muros divisorios en su vivienda que consta de dos plantas, de las cuales esta terminada parcialmente la planta baja en la que actualmente viven El crédito solicitado será utilizado para la construcción en obra fina de la planta alta. Esta es la primera vez que el señor Timoteo solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Terminado de habitaciones en casa

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
Mrs. Aline A. lives in the house of her parents located in Villa Pavón, on the east side of the city of La Paz with her husband and her four month old daughter. Doña Aline works as a secretary at a medical practice and her husband works at a veterinary clinic in La Paz. At the present they are living provisionally in a small room lent to them by her parents.

The loan will be used to finish three rooms on the second floor which are already under construction, (brick walls and wooden beams with "calamina" roofing).

This is the first time they have asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analisis shows a favorable qualification for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

La señora Aline A. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Pavón ladera este de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija de cuatro meses de edad; la señora Aline A. trabaja como secretaria en un consultorio y el esposo trabaja en una veterinaria de la ciudad de La Paz Actualmente ocupan una habitación que fue cedida por sus padres de dimensiones pequeñas y en la que están provisionalmente. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de tres habitaciones en planta alta. Es una construcción que se encuentra en obra gruesa (muros de ladrillo y envigado de madera con techo de calamina). Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of three rooms

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Robin

texts.es:
Robin is a 47 years old man who lives in Manuel Ergueta street, in the area of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz with his wife and children. He’s the owner of a taxi that is the source of incomes that maintains his family. The credit he asks for would be used to pay for his daughter’s studys who is in her last year of college. Robin is a client of Impro since 2003 and his record qualifys him as a good customer giving him access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Robin tiene 47 años de edad y vive en la calle Manuel Ergueta de la zona de alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos. Robin es dueño de un taxi y genera sus ingresos con el mismo con los cuales mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de su hija la cual está en último curso en la Universidad. Robin es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003 y su antecedente histórico con Impro lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito

loans.use: College tuition

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en:
Salimata Kamagaté is so professional, indeed. When we met her in the market of Treichville, in the southern region of Abidjan, she welcomed us with a big smile. She has a long experience, dating from 1980, in selling utensils and tubers; a business like a heritage from her ancestors.

Today Salimata is 40 and hopes that Kiva.org lenders will help her by lending to her, after months of very short-term funding. She is confident in herself: her experience is going to make the difference as far as profits are concerned.

Salimata is married and is mother of a kid attending school .They all live together in Marcory and Salimata goes every morning to Treichville market, which is about 5 miles from Marcory. She needs the loan to purchase goods in bulk and to pay school expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: Salimata Kamagate will use the loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses for her daughter

loans.name: Nancy Yudy

texts.es:
Nancy is an artistic and enterprising woman. She makes beautiful embroidery works, an art that she learnt from a cousin. Today, she embroiders not only skirts but also traditional attires for folk dancers. Nancy has repeat customers. Her daily work has allowed her to support her family.

Now, Nancy is determined to improve the quality and variety of her handicraft. She wants to raise her products to a higher level. She would like to exhibit them in a more suitable place, where she could keep direct contact with her customers, something that Nancy enjoys and values highly.

To accomplish this project, she needs to buy more materials. Nancy is asking for a loan of US$ 100, she believes this much is all she needs to invest, because it would grow by reinvesting it. Your help to Nancy will allow her to keep making her beautiful handiwork.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es una mujer emprendedora que cada día gracias al talento D. sus manos maravillosas realiza finos trabajos D. bordado esta labor la aprendió D. su prima y ahora no sólo borda fustanes sino también diversas prendas D. vestir folklóricas deacuerdo a los pedidos que le plantean sus clientes mes a mes.Gracias a su desempeño diario a podido satisfacer eficientemente las necesidades D. su hogar y en su afán D. superación desea incrementar la calidad y variedad D. sus bordados para dejar D. realizarlo D. manera artesanal y empezar a desarrollar su labor a gran escala contando para su exposición y comercialización con un local adecuado, para ella es muy agradable estar en continuo contacto con las personas y a razón D. esto sus expectativas futuras.Para emprender este sueño desea comprar más insumos para su trabajo y solicita un préstamo D. 100 dólares. D. esta manera poco a poco irá incrementando su capital D. inversión e irá cristalizando sus anhelos. Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Inés siga bordando con su talento y amor los sueños D. su familia.

loans.use: Buying material for embroidery

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Doña Yolanda is a brave and hard-working woman who learned knitting and embroidery on her own 38 years ago by watching others. She has been doing these manual activities from her home, even more so since her husband's death 14 years ago. Since that time, she alone has supported her five children and finds in them strength and motivation.

Year after year, Yolanda has searched for ways to increase her income, and this had led her to develop her culinary skills; she now offers these services on a seasonal basis. Her wish is to continue supporting her children and increase the family's quality of life, so she is requesting this loan of $200 to purchase raw materials and supplies for her knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yolanda es una mujer valiente y esforzada, hace 38 años aprendió a tejer y bordar sola, gracias a su habilidad visual; desD. siempre desarrolló estos trabajos manuales en las instalaciones D. su hogar y se acentúa aún más tras fallecer su esposo hace 14 años. DesD. entonces mantiene a sus 5 hijos, y encuentra en ellos su fuerza y motivación diaria. Año tras año, Yolanda ha buscado muchas formas D. generar ingresos adicionales y esto hizo que adquiera habilidades para la cocina ya que en ciertas temporadas ofrece sus servicios.Anhela seguir apoyando a sus hijos y por eso solicita un préstamo D. 200 dólares para comprar insumos con los que seguirá tejiendo prendas para incrementar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Señora Elena L. lives is her own house in the area of Llojeta located in the west part of the city of La Paz. She lives here with her husband and two sons. Señora Elena is a seamstress. She works from home making decorative pillows and duvets. Her husband drives minibuses around the city which is a trade union in the city of La Paz.

The loan she is requesting will be used towards the purchasing of more raw material such as threads and fabrics because she doesn't have enough capital and material, and since she sells her products to retailers in the city as they are getting ready for the end of the year sales. This is the fifth time that she has solicited for a loan. She is an IMPRO customer since 2004, and she has paid all her loans in full. Her credit background makes her a great candidate for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena L. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su dos hijos; la señora Elena trabaja como costurera en el pequeño taller en su domicilio, confeccionando almohadones y edredones, y su esposo es chofer empleado en un sindicato de microbuses de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado al incremento de capital para compra de materias primas como ser hilo y telas, ya que para la época de fin de año las comerciantes que le compran al por mayor le hicieron pedidos de sus productos que no podrá cumplir ya que cuenta con poco capital y material. Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan un préstamo. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 y todos sus préstamos los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente. El análisis socioeconómico actualizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: to purchase more materials

payments.comment: Early pay off. Elena is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Señor Rómulo A. lives in is own home in Pasankeri located west of the city of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and 3 daughters. Señor Rómulo works in a steel construction company, and his wife works from home making rugs which she sells to retailers in the city.

They have currently built 5 rooms with loans that they've received from our institution and out of their own savings. They have finished two of the rooms in which they are currently occupying.

The loan they're requesting will be used towards finishing up the construction for the other 3 rooms.

This is the 6th time they have solicited a loan from IMPRO. They have been our customers since 1999. Their credit history makes them good candidates.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rómulo A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijas; el señor Rómulo trabaja como constructor en una microempresa del rubro en nuestra ciudad y su esposa es artesana en su domicilio confeccionando alfombras que entrega a una microempresa de la ciudad de La Paz Actualmente construyeron cinco habitaciones que son parte del proyecto de su vivienda y que fueron construidas con créditos en nuestra institución y ahorros propios, de los cuales están concluidas dos, las que están siendo ocupadas por la familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la construcción en obra fina de las tres habitaciones restantes. Para vuestro conocimiento “Obra fina” significa el terminado completo de la habitación lista para vivir. Esta es la sexta vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO; es cliente de nuestra institución desde el año 1999. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To finish construction of 3 rooms

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Señor Eduardo F. owns his home located in 8 de Diciembre in the west part of the city of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and three children. Eduardo works as a welder repairing vehichles that have been in accidents. His wife works as a maid in a private residence.

They currently live in a small room on the land they own which is very small and they use as a bedroom/kitchen/dining room. They built it with the small amount of savings they had and they could only afford to buy construction material such as bricks and cement in small quantities to built a small room.

They will use the loan to build another room which will help this family live in better conditions. This is their fist time soliciting a loan and their credit background makes them good candidates.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eduardo F. vive en casa propia en la zona de 8 de Diciembre ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Eduardo trabaja como chapista realizando reparaciones y reconstrucciones de vehículos chocados. Y su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica en un domicilio particular. Actualmente ocupan una habitación en el terreno que tienen, la cual funciona como dormitorio cocina y comedor al mismo tiempo ya que con sus Ahorros pudieron solamente construir la estructura y muros de ladrillo en una habitación nueva. El crédito solicitado será destinado al techado y la construcción en obra fina de la nueva habitación que mejorará las condiciones de vida de la familia. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: to build a room

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Señor Raúl Q. owns a house located in the area of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. He lives there with his wife and three children. He works in a steel construction company. He currently has built the bottom level and the foundation for the 2nd level of his home.

The loan amount he's requesting will be used to build 3 bedrooms in the second level.

This is his first time requesting for a loan, and his past credit history make him a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Raúl Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Raúl trabaja como constructor en una microempresa del rubro en nuestra ciudad. Actualmente tienen construida la planta baja y la losa de hormigón en el segundo nivel de su casa. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de tres habitaciones en obra gruesa sobre la losa del segundo nivel. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construccion

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kouao Chaye

texts.en:
Kouao N. Chaye is a fruit and bananas seller at the Treichville market, in the south of Abidjan. She was born in 1971 and lives in cohabitation with an usher. Together they have a baby boy; they live a little far away from the market.

Kouao N. started her business very young. When she was about 11, she used to help her mum at the market after school. She finally loved doing these activities and decided to stop school and set up her own business.

Kouao N. said that it is important for her to be financially autonomous from her common-law husband. She would like to expand her business activity with the loan by purchasing goods in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Victoria Lorenza

texts.es:
Victoria is a young mother who emigrated from a small rural area to the city along with her husband in order to create a better future. As the fruit of their love Victoria and her husband have two children, a five year-old son and a two year-old daughter. Currently Victoria raises chickens and guinea pigs in facilities in her home in the hope of contributing to the full satisfaction of the family’s needs. For this reason she works very hard every day in order to reap the benefits of her labor. Her husband is a professor, but the salary he receives is insufficient. As a result, Victoria’s dream is to be able to open a small store in the future in order to continue watching over the well-being of her small children. For that reason she wants to increase her number of animals with the goal of augmenting her income with the sale of the animals once they reach maturity. Let’s support a strained young mother so that she can continue sheltering in her heart many plans for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es una joven madre que emigró de un pueblito de la zona rural a la ciudad junto a su esposo para forjarse un futuro mejor, fruto de ese amor tiene dos hijos, un niño de 5 años y una pequeña de 2 años. Actualmente cría pollos y cuyes en las instalaciones de su hogar con el afán de contribuir para la satisfacción plena de sus necesidades por esta razón cada día se esfuerza mucho para el buen desempeño de su labor.Su esposo es profesor, pero el sueldo que recibe es insuficiente. Por eso su anhelo es poder abrir en un futuro una pequeña tienda para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus pequeños.Por este motivo desea incrementar el número de animalitos con el propósito de acrecentar sus ingresos con la venta de los mismos cuando alcancen plena madurez.Apoyemos a una joven madre esforzada para que siga cobijando en su corazón muchos planes de superación.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize, sugar, and additional stock, and to renovate her retail shop to prevent leaks

loans.name: Mensa Alcántara

texts.en: Mensa is a 52-year-old widow, with three children (two boys and a girl). Her children are studying and working at Santo Domingo, the capital. Mensa wants to renew the business she started ten years ago, and was obliged to close last year for health reasons. She will sell natural medicines in her house, and sometimes will take them to the customers upon request. Withe the requested loan she will purchase the NATURE SUNSHINE company´s products, since these are well known and very much in demand by a large part of the population.

loans.use: To wholesale purchase natural medicines in order to renew her business which was closed for health reasons.

loans.name: Melania Reyes

texts.en: Melania, aged 34, married and mother of two daughters, sells shoes for women and children. Generally, the business operates in the morning next to a public place. She started this business three years ago. Currently, she has a small local shop which she acquired with her husband´s help. She is requesting a loan to remodel the shop, and have it ready for December. This will help her sell the shoes more easily, since the customers will be able to go to her shop in the afternoon and evening too. This way, she will increase her income and improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: To remodel a new local shop she acquired and wholesale purchase shoes to resell in her community.

loans.name: Teresa Jesusa

texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother who lives alone with her 8 year old son, whom she's supporting and educating on her own. She started her business selling oranges and mandarines from the farm out of her patio. Little by little she increased the number of products she offered for sale and her business grew quickly, as it was the only small general store in the vicinity.

As her business expanded, she faced the challenge of securing her small store. She needs to urgently buy lumber and boards to secure her store and work more efficiently. She's requesting a loan of $200 to build an adequate commercial space that will enable her to improve her and her son's quality of life. Let's help Francisca reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es madre soltera, vive con su único hijo de 8 años al que está educando y manteniendo con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella empezó en el patio de su casa sólo vendiendo naranjas y mandarinas que traía de la chacra, y poco a poco empezó a incrementar la oferta de productos de primera necesidad creciendo en forma rápida debido a que era la única bodega en las inmediaciones de su localidad, conforme fue creciendo se le presentó el problema de movilizar sus productos diariamente, debido a que no cuenta con la infraestructura necesaria para brindar seguridad a su pequeña bodeguita.Con suma urgencia necesita la compra de maderas y tablas para poder trabajar más segura y tranquila..Francisca solicita la suma de 200 dólares en calidad de préstamo con un compromiso de pago de seis meses que le permitirá construir un espacio de ventas a fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeño hijo. Ayudemos a continuar el esfuerzo de Francisca.

loans.use: To buy lumber to improve her commercial space

loans.name: Máxima Pérez

texts.en: Máxima, is 27 years old, with two daughters and a boy. Her husband is a topographer and is working in Yamasá . Máxima and her husband have to work a lot to provide their children with a good education. She earns some money, selling clothes, curtains, tablecloths, and so forth. Currently she has a well established clientele, which continues to grow. The requested loan is to purchase more clothes to sell during the holiday season. This will increase this entrepreneur´s sales volume and will allow her to help her husband face the housing issues. Máxima also wants to set aside money to go back to her languages classes at the University at Santo Domingo next year.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her business to increase her income, and set aside money to go back to the university.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle D. is 34 years old. She has 2 children and lives in cohabitation with a house electrician in Yopougon in the south of Abidjan. For years, Giselle D. has been selling grilled pork in the Yopougon Selmer Market. She is actually the main provider for her family. Her common-law husband's business activities have been badly affected by the crisis in the house building sector in Cote d'Ivoire.

Now Giselle takes care of the school expenses of her children as well as the home expenses. She will use the loan to pay the school expenses of her children and purchase some goods to sustain her revenue resource.

loans.use: to purchase goods and pay school expenses

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a mother of five children, three of whom are of school age and two who are still toddlers. She has recently had to assume sole responsibility for her children's support due to the devastating loss of her husband. She started her business selling a few products from her doorstep and even though she didn't have any financial support , she has never given up or faltered.

She works every day from the early morning hours and struggles with the lack of reliable electricity that plagues her neighborhood. For that reason, she is in urgent need of purchasing a cooler where she can store her perishable products. She is asking to borrow $200 for this purpose, which will allow her to remain in business and help her continue supporting her family. She has committed to repaying the loan over a period of 6 months and is eternally grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth es madre de 5 hijos, tres en edad escolar y dos de ellos aún son muy pequeños, hace poco tuvo que hacer frente a la carga familiar sola, debido a la irreparable pérdida de su esposo; el negocio lo inició por idea propia en la puerta de su casa con pocos productos. A pesar de que no contaba con un respaldo económico para crecer rápidamente nunca dió marcha atrás y ha ido trabajando todos los días desde muy temprano y combatiendo la carencia del fluido eléctrico en la zona donde vive.Es por eso que se encuentra en la necesidad urgente de comprar una caja térmica para tener los productos bien conservados para su venta. Necesita la suma de 200 dólares para seguir trabajando y luchando por la educación y bienestar de sus hijos, se compromete a devolver lo solicitado en un plazo de seis meses, quedando eternamente agradecida por el apoyo que le puedan brindar.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk sales business

loans.name: Abis Suyapa

texts.en:
For 2 years, Abis Suyapa A. has provided photocopying services and office supplies to businesses. She is able to support her family and pay the school fees for her children with what she earns from this business.
She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more photocopying supplies, paper, pencils, markers, and other office supplies so she can provide better services for her clients.

loans.use: Purchase photocopying and office supplies

loans.name: Eusebia Narciza

texts.en: Eusebia, aged 42, married and mother of three children, is a very diligent woman. Her children are studying in the community, and her husband works as a print media journalist. Eusebia needs a loan in order to restart her business activities. Before, she was selling skin care and hair products, as well as cosmetic products. She had to stop that activity for one year under a doctor´s advice. Now that she has recovered her health, she will open her business again. She plans to fix her old showcase and buy a new one to put the merchandise she has already purchased. Eusebia says that having her business back will make her feel independent and useful in her community.

loans.use: To purchase skin care and hair repair products, as well to buy a new showcase in order to open her business again.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en: My name is Arcadia and I have had my small business for two years. I need to buy merchandise so that I can provide a better service to my clients who are my neighbors and people that live close by. With this business I plan on helping my husband with our monthly expenses and also buy my medicines.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, pasta, rice, ,beans soda,waters, cereals, etc

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana moved to Pucallpa with her husband and son a long time ago, looking to improve their financial situation. They started out selling ribbons and other textile items in the local markets and on the streets but didn't achieve much success. They later began collecting and reselling scrap metal, for which purpose they acquired a tricycle. This has allowed them to operate their business from the early morning hours until evening without rest as they travel around their city.

As their business grew, it required that they repurpose a patio in their home to store the scrap metal. Thanks to their sustained effort, their lives have improved. They would like to expand and improve their storage space to be able to buy more scrap metal for resale, which will increase their earnings and help them continue to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana vino a radicar a Pucallpa con su esposo e hijo hace mucho tiempo, buscando mejorar su situación económica, empezaron a vender primero todo lo que era pasamanería en el mercado en forma ambulatoria sin el éxito esperado, la idea sobre la recolección y venta de metales surgió de su esposo y para realizar esta labor decidieron contar con un triciclo. Así es como vienen realizando este trabajo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta horas de la tarde, sin descanso recorriendo la ciudad entera; a medida que fue pasando el tiempo tuvieron que acondicionar un pequeño depósito en el patio trasero de su casa, sus vidas gracias al esfuerzo de su desempeño han cobrado buenas expectativas.Con el afán de seguir incrementando su calidad de vida necesita ampliar su pequeño almacén y seguir comprando más metales para acrecentar sus ganancias.Hagamos que esta familia siga reciclando en casa muchos deseos de superación.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Santa Ysabel

texts.en: Santa, 47 years old, mother of five children, is a very diligent and dynamic woman. In order to provide her children with a good education, she has been in turn a cook, house cleaner, and saleswoman. Ten years ago, she started her own business. In the morning, she sells fresh chicken parts and vegetables at the public market. At night, she makes empanadas, fried chicken, and sells drinks in her house. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of live chickens and some goods like flour, spices, and meat. She also wants to fix her house´s roof. This way, customers will have no problem when it rains. Given this loan, this entrepreneur will also better face her family's financial issues.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and some goods like flour, spices and other goods.  She´ll also fix the roof of her house.

loans.name: Isabel Madec

texts.en: Isabel, 42 years old, is married, with six children. Her husband is working on the dustcarts, picking up the rubbish, and doesn't earn sufficient money as to provide a good education and food for the family. To face that situation, Isabel plans to start a small business, selling men's clothes from this holiday season onwards. She has already been a saleswoman, and has a lot of experience. She'll wholesale purchase the clothes in Santo Domingo, the capital, and sell them from her house. Given this loan, Isabel will 'en gran manera' help her husband support their family financially and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To wholesale purchase clothes to start a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana and her husband have two kids, and the family lives in a small place. Diana and her husband work together in the little workshop they set up after long years of hard work. They wake up very early every day to deliver orders on time, and to repair footwear and take more orders. Diana’s husband learnt the art of making footwear in the past, and now they have the tools of the trade to do a good job.

There is no electricity available to them in the area where they live, but Diana and her husband can make the repairs since they use a mechanical machine. But they lack enough supplies for their job. They need material to make and repair footwear, and care for their clientele.

Diana is asking for US$ 175, that she will repay within 6 months. With your help she may keep her shop running and be able to provide for her family. Your generosity will make possible for her to improve her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es madre de 2 niños y comparte las instalaciones de su pequeña morada con su esposo y sus dos únicos retoños. Ambos trabajan en el pequeño taller que pusieron fruto de muchos años de esfuerzo; se levantan muy temprano para entregar los pedidos con anticipación y seguir trabajando en la reparación y elaboración de algunos pedidos, ya que el esposo aprendió el arte fabricarlos y para su buen desempeño han adquirido las herramientas necesarias para un exitoso desempeño. A pesar de no contar con el servicio de energía eléctrica su trabajo se realiza sin ningún problema debido a que la maquinaria con la que cuentan es manual de esa manera no les afecta en nada la ausencia del servicio en la zona, la única preocupación que tienen en estos momentos es la adquisición de materiales para la reparación y fabricación de los calzados con los que podrán seguir prestando sus servicios a sus clientes y público en general sin ningún percance. La solicitud de Diana es por la suma de 175 dólares con un compromiso de devolución en un plazo no mayor a seis meses, nuestra ayuda le permitirá seguir creciendo en su taller y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.Hagamos posible la consolidación de este pequeño espacio de fabricación con nuestra generosa ayuda.

loans.use: Buying materials to make and repair footwear

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.en: Yaquelin, aged 39, mother of two daughters and a son, sells skin care and hair repair products, as well as cosmetic products. Her children go to the public school of the community; and the elder go to the university in Santo Domingo. This entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like shampoo, rinse, hair treatment, gel for hair, and products for nails. Currently, these products are running low in her business. Increasing her income will help Yaquelin continue providing a good education and food for her three children, and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, rinse, hair treatment, and other hair care products for her business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
For 2 years, Lorenza C. has had a small business selling purses, sunglasses, caps, and other items in the street markets in the city where she lives. She has many customers because she sells her items for good prices.

She has many orders for goods, and she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more items. She supports herself and her children with the money she earns in this business.

loans.use: Purchase purses, wallets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Rosa Abad

texts.en: This 51-year-old woman, mother of seven children, is a very hard-working and positive person. Rosa lives in Don Juan, a pretty remote community of Yamasá. Her husband works for a little company that makes blocks. She owns a colmadito, a very small grocery store. She sells basic goods like rice, vegetable oil, floor, spaghetti, juice, bread and so forth. She started her business two years ago in order to deal with the family's financial issues. She also sells charcoal (obtained by heating wood), since in her community not all the people have sufficient means to use gas. Women in Don Juan use the charcoal to soften up peas, because peas take a long time to be well-cooked and that consumes a lot of gas. The entrepreneur requests a loan to wholesale purchase the goods she usually sells in her business, as she is short of supply. Given this loan, she'll be able to help her husband support the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goods like rice, floor, spaghetti, juice, vegetable oil, etc. to increase inventory.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
For 5 years, Virginia O. F. has had a small home business selling clothes for children and adults. She is in a very busy location near the center of the city and many people pass by on their way to work.

This business helps her husband with family expenses and supporting their children. She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Purchase children's and adults' clothing to sell

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
Berta is a go-ahead woman, and relentless. She is the mother of 4 children whom she loves deeply. They are the driving force that makes her strive, along with her husband, for a better life. They have a locksmith’s shop they set up in home. Berta and her husband have devoted many years to their business. She had to learn the tools of the trade, made it fast, and made it well. In time, her kids also learnt it. And they have helped to make it grow. So, all members of the family work together, but they need more machines to keep productivity up. They want to get more clients, so the kids could go to technical school.

Berta is asking for a loan of $US 175, to get a compressor to be used for finishing the pieces made in the shop. Your help may give them the extra push their business needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta es mujer emprendedora y muy luchadora, madre de 4 hijos los cuales son su adoración y motor que la impulsa para seguir trabajando con su esposo en el taller de cerrajería que tienen ubicado en las instalaciones de su hogar al que le han dedicado años de trabajo. Bajo este contexto ella ha tenido que aprender el oficio de un cerrajero y se viene desempeñado muy bien en esta labor, el conocimiento de este trabajo también lo adquirieron con el tiempo sus hijos y en la medida de sus posibilidades contribuyen con el exitoso desempeño del taller de sus padres. A pesar de tener un gran número de mano de obra se ven en la necesidad de comprar maquinarias para ayudar a agilizar su producción y así obtener mayor número de clientes, a fin de que sus hijos puedan retomar sus respectivos estudios en la escuela técnica de su ciudad. Hoy Berta solicita la suma de 175 dólares para adquirir una máquina comprensora con los que podrá darles excelentes acabados a cada una de las piezas que fabrican en el taller. Con tu colaboración podremos hacer que logre tener una maquinita para que el progreso de sus hijos se haga realidad en poco tiempo.

loans.use: Buying a compressor to be used in the shop

loans.name: Dunia Maria

texts.en:
Dunia Maria H. has had a small business selling used American clothes from her home for 8 years. She has a good business selling women's and men's clothing.

She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more clothes to sell. She would like to open another store near her house during the busy Christmas season. Dunia Maria H. is a single mother with three children, and she must work to support her children and pay school fees.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cafe business.

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
The worst plight of a mother is to see her kids sick. And this is what happened to Mrs. Teófila R.. She is the mother of 7 children, and has devoted her life to work her plot of land cultivating broad beans. She had worked every day, from dawn to dust, with her husband to make their land productive. But something happened that made things harder. Her 23 year old daughter needed a surgical intervention for appendicitis, after which she had to remain in the hospital for 6 months.

This emergency and its outcome was very painful and expensive for Teófila’s family. Her husband had to look for another job to try to make up for all the expenses, so he became a driver. Now Teófila has to work double to do the job her husband used to do with her.

The family can get back on track if they manage to get a loan of US$ 175 to buy the seed needed to cultivate broad beans and potatoes. That investment would return enough profits for them to get back on their feet. You could help Teófila and her family to move on.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Hay momentos en que una madre sufre por sus hijos y esto suele pasar con mayor frecuencia cuando sus hijos están muy enfermos.Esta es la historia de doña Teófila R. mujer y madre de 7 hijos dedicada a la chacra y siembra de habas, como todo agricultor ella ha sabido luchar madrugada a madrugada junto a su esposo para realizar una exitosa producción de sus tierras. Hasta un momento de sus vidas todo marchaba muy bien en su hogar hasta que la vida la puso en una situación muy dura. Su hija de 23 años tuvo que ser operada con suma urgencia de apendicitis y permaneció internada bajo tratamiento durante 6 meses en la ciudad capital de su país.Este hecho fue muy doloroso y también costoso para la familia de Teófila y para sobreponerse de los gastos, su esposo tuvo que hacer labores extras y es así que empezó a trabajar como chofer dentro de su comunidad y ella tuvo que laborar el doble en su chacra porque había que suplir la ausencia de su esposo. Ahora dicha familia puede volver a recuperarse de esos momentos con un préstamo de 175 dólares para invertirlos en la siembra de habas y papas con el fin de obtener en la próxima cosecha un gran porcentaje de ganancias. Sabemos que con tu ayuda la familia de Teófila podrá salir adelante .

loans.use: To buy broad beans seed and seed potatos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Ixi Hohana

texts.en:
For 5 years, Ixi R. has had a small business selling clothes, shoes, decorative pictures, and other items. With the profits from this business, she helps her brothers support the family. She also attends night school, and has to pay school fees.

She is requesting this loan of $250 to purchase the supplies to fill the orders she has for Christmas.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and other items to fill Christmas orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  items that are in style and affordable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell to her salon clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her home and to buy more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more ice cream products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more avocados for sale

loans.name: Marcelina Ana

texts.es:
Marcelina is an elderly woman who has suffered greatly in life due to the death of her husband who left her a widow with 6 children. She had to care for and educate them, which she did with great strength thanks to a knowledge of planting and harvesting acquired alongsiD. her husband. Today her children have their own families and now Marcelina lives in a humble aboD. in the company of her oldest daughter who decided to move home with Marcelina due to the physical and psychological violence that she was suffering from in her former home. Marcelina did not hesitate to support her daughter so that she could distance herself from a merciless husband. In spite of all of the difficulties that Marcelina has had to face, she has always been able to count on the support of her oldest son who helped her get ahead with the only job that she was able to do and could dedicate herself to efficiently. In short order Marcelina has reinitiated activity on her small farm, but because she no longer has the strength of her youth and requires assistance for the work, this time it is her daughter who will help her continue her labor. She also needs fertilizer and manure in order to improve her products. She is asking for a sum of $175 in order to acquire those items. We believe that you could help her continue to plant seeds of hope in the heart of her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina es una mujer D. avanzada edad que ha sufrido mucho en L. vida a raíz D. L. muerte D. su esposo quién L. dejó viuda y con 6 hijos a los cuales tuvo que cuidar y educar con mucho esfuerzo gracias al conocimiento D. siembra y cosecha que había adquirido junto a su esposo.Hoy sus hijos tienen sus propias familias y ahora habita su humilD. morada en compañía D. su hija mayor que decidió mudarse con elL. a raíz D. L. violencia física y psicológica que sufría en su antiguo hogar, motivo por el cual Marcelina no dudo en apoyar a su hija para que se alejara D. su despiadado esposo. Pese a todos los apuros que tuvieron que pasar siempre contó con el apoyo D. su hijo mayor quién lo ayudó a seguir adelante con el único oficio que pueD. hacer y al que pueD. dedicarse eficientemente. En poco tiempo reinició su actividad en L. chacra pero como ya no tiene L. fuerza D. su juventud y requiere ayuda para trabajar y esta vez es su hija quién L. ayudará a continuar con su labor. También requiere fertilizantes y abono para mejorar sus productos y solicita L. suma D. 175 dólares para adquirirlos. Tenemos L. convicción D. que usted podrá ayudarL. para que siga sembrando esperanzas en el corazón D. su hija.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Pabla

texts.en:
Pabla Kings, known as Paublita in her neighborhood, has a grocery store or pulperia in Honduras. She sells a wide variety of items in the pluperia.

She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more items to sell, for example, rice, soap, flour, sugar, candy, bread, and churros. She wants to increase her sales so she can better meet her financial responsibilities.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her payphone business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her kale business.

loans.name: Elva Nancy

texts.es:
Elva is a woman that has kept her business, and made it grow, through hard work and devotion. For many years, she has put the same kind of effort into supporting her kids. Elva wants them to fulfil their dreams. Her family has a great deal of expenses, and that makes Elva, and her husband M., work without stop but enthusiastically.

They have increased their inventory slowly through the years. Their customers’ orders have made the business grow little by little. To face this challenge Elva is asking for US$ 200 loan. She will use this money to buy more goods to sell. And maybe, in the long run and working hard, she would get a plot of land. There she would build a little house and set up her store. Then she won’t have to pay the excessive rent she pays now.

Your generous support can help her accomplish this shortly.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva, es una dama que ha podido hacer crecer su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, el mismo esfuerzo que le ha dedicado durante muchos años a su actividad también se lo ha brindado a sus hijos a fin de que cada uno pueda perseguir sus sueños.A pesar del inmenso número de gastos que tiene con sus hijos no deja de trabajar en compañía de su esposo. Y poco a poco durante mucho tiempo ha ido incrementando sus productos deacuerdo a las necesidades de sus vecinos que cada día le genran nuevos pedidos. Frente a esta gran oportunidad de negocio Elva solicita la suma de 200 dólares para comprar más productos e implementar su centro de ventas con novedosos artículos que le ayudarán a satisfacer sus necesidades y poder más adelante obtener uno de sus anhelos, adquirir un terreno y construir una casita a la que trasladará su bodeguita para dejar de pagar las grandes sumas de dinero que le demanda el alquiler en la que actualmente se desempeña. Con tu generoso apoyo podrá cristalizar sus anhelos en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Buying more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her onion business

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.en:
Martha Maria T. has had a small business for 3 years selling soda water and juice from her home. The city of San Lorenzo is very hot, and so she has very good sales.

She is asking for this loan of $150 to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She plans to use the profits from her business to help with her family's monthly expenses.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy and re-sell cereals and yams

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Rosa Isabel is 38 years old. She only completed her studies until the end of primary school. She lives in Caserio De Simon Bolivar in the district of Usquil in the Otuzco providence, within the community of La Libertad. She has 2 younger children that depend on her.

At a young age she learned how to plant, harvest, and sell potatoes, barley, broad beans and other grains from her parents. She didn’t continue school because there were no nearby high schools within her community. Also, she couldn’t go to another community to study because her parents depended on her to help them by working. She got married at age 16 and her needs increased. Her father helped her by lending her a small amount of money to start her business. With this loan she bought potatoes and grains in bulk. She then began working independently.

She needed more money to grow her business and accepted the invitation of her neighbor to increase her income by joining a community finance group. With her first loan of $96 dollars she bought potatoes, barley and other grains. Little by little her business started growing. Presently she distributes her products weekly in the main markets of Trujillo. Thanks to this business she was able to buy land and cultivate her own produce to sell. From the most recent loan she was able to buy potatoes by bulk and dry them to sell dried ground potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa Isabel tiene 38 años de edad y solo estudió hasta primaria completa, vive en el Caserío de Simón Bolivar en el distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que depende de ella. Desde muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la siembra, cosecha y venta de papa, cebada, habas y otros cereales. No pudo seguir estudiado porque en su comunidad no había colegio del nivel secundaria y no podía ir más lejos porque no había quien ayude a sus padres. Se casó a los 16 años y sus necesidades se incrementaron, su papá le prestó una pequeña cantidad de dinero para que empezara su negocio, compró papa y cereales en pequeña cantidad y empezó a trabajar en forma independiente. Necesitaba mayor capital para incrementar su negocio y acepta la invitación de una vecina para ingresar al Banco Comunal “Estrella Resplandeciente”. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 ($96 aprox.) compró mayor cantidad de papa, olluco, cebada, habas y otros cereales, y poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo. En la actualidad distribuye semanalmente estos productos en los principales mercados de Trujillo. Gracias a este negocio pudo comprar tierras de cultivo donde siembra estos productos. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 ($.500.00 aprox.) pagaderos en 4 cuotas, comprará papas al por mayor para dejarlo secar y vender papa seca molida

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Señora Elsa is 51 years old and has 5 children. At the moment only one of her kids is in school. He is in Junior High School, and another one of her children helps with the business. She lives in Pisocoyacu, in the Hualla province, and in the community of San Martin, and she is a member of the community bank ”Piscoyacu”.

She is a baker, who has her own bakery and there she sells sweets, sandwiches and she makes decorations to sell. She decided to start her business with her husband. Her husband was the one who initiated the business; they started the business because they realized it was a profitable business that they could work at everyday and it would help improve the economic situation for her and her family.

The loan that she just received from Manuela Ramos for 3,000 Soles (approximately $ 1,000) with a payment plan consisting of six payments. She will invest the loan in the purchase of large sacks of flour, oil by the gallon and yeast by the kilogram, salt and more ingredients for the making of bread and sweets. She needs to invest more money in her business to be able to satisfy the needs of her large clientele in the population Piscoyacu and Saposoa.

Her recent goal is to grow her business, and to buy an electric mixer so that she can hire more people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa tiene 51 años y tiene 5 hijos, actualmente solo uno D. ellos es estudiante D. educación secundaria, y otro D. ellos colabora en el negocio. Vive en la localidad D. Piscoyacu, provincia del Huallaga, departamento D. San Martín, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Piscoyacu”. Se dedica a la producción D. panes, tiene una panadería donD. también venD. dulces, tortas y hace decoraciones. Decidió iniciar su negocio junto a su esposo, ya que al principio fue iniciativa D. él y lo hicieron porque vieron que era un negocio rentable, D. todos los días y que así también mejorarían su situación económica y la D. su familia. El crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00 aprox.) pagadero en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra D. harina en sacos, aceite en galones, levadura por kilogramos, sal y otros insumos más para la producción D. panes y dulces, para poder satisfacer la necesidad D. su amplia clientela D. la población D. Piscoyacu y Saposoa. Su meta más cercana es agrandar el negocio, comprándose una máquina mezcladora y así dar trabajo a más personas.

loans.use: Buy flour, oil, and yeast.

loans.name: Glenda Nohemy

texts.en:
Glenda Nohemy N. A. has been making and selling food from her home for 5 years. Sales are greatest on the weekends because she sells Wendish sea soup and Mexican tacos.

Her three daughters help with the cooking. She is requesting this loan of $150 to purchase more ingredients so she can make more food to sell. She plans to use the profit from sales to pay school expense for her daughters so they can have a better future.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and ingredients for making food to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Eliandrina

texts.es:
Señora Esperanza is 47 years old. She completed her studies in junior high school. She lives in the district of Otuzco of the Otuzco Province and the community of La Libertad. She only has one son and she supports him with her earnings. Several years ago she began raising pigs in a little town outside of Otuzco.

She is one of the founding members of the Banco Comunal “La Ermita” (a community finance group). She received approximately $96 dollars from her first loan. With the loan she bought a baby bull but it didn’t go so well for her because the food for her animal was too costly. So she decided to dedicate herself only to raising and selling of other animals. She sold pigs, chickens, hens, and ducks. She raised all of these animals in the corral of her house.

With another recent loan from Manuel Ramos for 300 Soles (approximately $100) that was repaid in 4 payments Señora Esperanza purchased chicken and feed for the birds so they could fatten-up and be sold for festival The Virgen de La Puerta. This festival is celebrated in her community in the month of December.

Señora Ezperanza is the president of a soup kitchen for poor children and elderly persons in her neighborhood. She dreams of the soup kitchen having its own new and improved place to operate in the future. Also, she would like to have a little store again. She had one before, but she lost it when all of her products were stolen.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny and Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

La señora Esperanza tiene 47 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa, vive en el distrito de Otuzco de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene solo un hijo que depende de ella. Hace varios años que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en un caserío alejado de Otuzco. Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “La Ermita”, con su primer crédito que recibió de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $96) compró un torillo pero no le fue muy bien porque el alimento de esos animales es muy costoso así que decidió dedicarse sólo a la crianza y venta de chanchos, gallinas, pollos y patos, estos últimos si los cría en un corral en su casa. Con su reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 (US$ 100 aprox.) pagaderos en 4 cuotas, comprará pollos y alimento para aves las cuales engordará para vender en la fiesta de la Virgen de la Puerta que se celebra en su localidad en el mes de diciembre. La señora Esperanza es Presidenta del Comedor Popular “La Ermita” el cual atiende con menú a diferente niños y ancianos de bajos recursos de su barrio. Sueña con conseguir un local propio para el comedor para lo que ya inició gestiones con la Municipalidad Provincial de Otuzco y además quiere volver a tener su bodega la cual tuvo hace unos años pero que perdió cuando le robaron todos sus productos.

loans.use: Buy chickens and bird feed.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia Rosa is 49 years old and has three children. Her husband helps her find customers and one of her children helps her make the crafts. She lives in the neighborhood of Saposa in the Huallaga province of the San Martín state. She belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank.

She sews purses and tapestries. She also designs and makes earrings and other handcrafts. She decided to start this business in order to improve her economical situation and work in what she most likes.

With the loan of S/. 500.00($167.00) that was recently granted by Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 quotas, she will purchase more meters of fabric, large spools of thread, hanks of lace, accessories, a display case to display her products and a collection of art craft books. These books will help her create new and varied models in order to reach more clients in the community of Saposa and nearby villages.

Mrs. Julia's goal is to make some adjustments to her home so that she can expand her business and have a better presentation of her products. She also wants to have a room in which to give classes to other community women in order to help them achieve independence.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia Rosa tiene 49 años y tres hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la búsqueda de clientes y uno de sus hijos le apoya en la confección de las artesanías. Vive en la localidad de Saposoa, provincia de el Huallaga, departamento de San Martín; pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción”. Se dedica a la costura de bolsas, tapetes, así como la creación de aretes, y otras manualidades. Decidió iniciar el negocio para mejorar la situación económica y trabajar en lo que a ella más le gusta. Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará más telas en metros, hilos en carretes grandes, cintas en madejas de colores variados, accesorios de bijoutería, una vitrina para la exhibición de su producción y una colección de libros de artesanía, que le ayude en la creación de modelos nuevos y variados con la finalidad de llegar más clientes de la comunidad de Saposoa y aledaños. La señora Julia tiene como meta hacer algunos arreglos en su casa para poder ampliar su negocio y tener una mejor presentación de sus productos, además de poder contar con un espacio donde pueda dar clases a otras mujeres de la comunidad y así apoyarlas a que se independicen.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, laces, accessories Purchase one display case

loans.name: Elga Judith

texts.en:
An example of a courageous and regal woman is 39 year old Elga, mother of four small school age children who are all her love and her reason for being. In spite of her husband leaving, she has tried to create a space in her home to offer cosmetics and clothing because of the need for work and the small amount of money available to her. For months everything had gone well, but a home never lacks inconveniences and she was caught by one of the hardest, a sick daughter. The daughter suffered from anemia, a sickness that required treatment in the hospital of the capital city. What is more, the sickness ran up huge expenses and include months of treatment.

Thanks to patience and dedication that Elga maintained she now finds things back to normal, but the economic recovery of the family is not complete. For the purpose of providing for her children’s welfare Elga needs $200 in order to acquire more items and continue with the sale of her products. Let us help Elga to recover, as well as her daughter who has been hit by some of the unfortunate things that life deals to us.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein.

Un ejemplo de mujer valerosa y regia es Elga de 39 años, madre de 4 pequeños aún en etapa escolar, los cuales son su adoración y razón de ser. A pesar del alejamiento de su esposo, por motivos de trabajo y con el poco dinero que dispone ha tratado de acondicionar un espacio en el interior de su hogar para ofrecer cosméticos y prendas de vestir. Hace meses todo marchaba bien pero en un hogar nunca falta la presencia de inconvenientes y a ella le ha tocado uno de los más duros, la enfermedad de su pequeña hija, quien sufrió de anemia hemolítica, enfermedad que tuvo que ser tratada en un nosocomio de la capital y que además le ocasionó grandes gastos y meses de tratamiento.Gracias a la permanencia y paciencia que mantuvo se encuentra totalmente restablecida; sin embargo la recuperación económica de su familia aún no es un hecho total.Y con el propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos ella requiere de 200 dólares para poder adquirir más artículos y seguir con la venta de sus productos. Ayudemos a que Elga pueda recuperarse, al igual que su hija de los malos momentos que la vida tiene para alguno de nosotros.

loans.use: Purchase of items for her small sales stand.

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.en:
Married and mother of one child, Piyalo is an expert in the preparation of fried yams and potatoes, called in local jargon “Koliko.” Koliko is a local food which any child loves to eat . Piyalo makes fried yams and sells them to students at nearby schools. As school is opening in Togo in few weeks, there will be more demand by the children to eat during the break time at school.

Therefore, Piyalo wants to take the opportunity to expand her business by buying more yams and potatoes, but money is a problem. That's why she is requesting this loan so she can buy as many yams as she needs. We estimated her business capability at US$ 200, a loan sum that she can afford to manage and pay back on time and still use some of the profit to take care of her family 's needs.

Piyalo is also a member of the women's group called “ARCB” which is affiliated to HELP Africa.

loans.use: Buy yams and make fried  yams for students at school

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Cornelio Humberto

texts.en:
Cornelio Humberto T. has been selling fresh fish for 8 years. He fishes in the morning, and sells the fresh fish from his home in the afternoon. He sells fish to carnicerias, small markets.

He is requesting a loan of $175 to increase his sales and have a larger business. He is married, and has to support his wife and three children.

loans.use: Fish seller

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Maria del Carmen is a 42 year old single mother with one son who sells flowers and vegetables near her home and three times a week she travels to the city to sell her products. She belongs to the group named Niño de Atocha 1 together with doña Gloria Eloyna Hernández Torres, who manufactures bride gowns and accessories, and doña Rutila Vásquez González who sells chicken. With the loan they will buy products to increase their stock and make sales go up.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA DEL CARMEN ,es madre soltera , tiene 42 años y un hijo , se dedica a la venta de flores y verduras en colonias cercanas a su domicilio y viaja tres veces a la semana a vender sus productos a la ciudad . Pertenece al grupo Niño de Atocha 1 junto con doña Gloria Eloyna Hernández Torres (confecciona vestidos e implementos de novias)y doña Rutila Vásquez González (venta de pollos trozados).Con su préstamo invertirán en comprar productos para incrementar las ventas al tener un mayor stock.

loans.use: Sale of flowers, vegetables, poultry, bride gowns and accessories

loans.name: Adja

texts.en: Adja is married and has six children. She sells  mangos, oranges, and pineapples. She has been in that  business for years. Adja took a loan from HELP Africa in the past and  was able to repay it on time. Now, she wants a loan to  build a stand and buy more  fruits. By doing so, Adja will expand her business  and make her  place more attractive and cleaner  for  her customers. Then, she will be able to sell her fruits more quickly  and not let them spoil. Adja will also be able to make more profit and repay her loan on time  and with part of  her profit, she will take care of her six children.

loans.use: Buy  fruit for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alba Noemi

texts.es:
Doña Alba is a 49 year old mother of 3, her husband works as a construction worker and she has adapted a space in her home where she sells tipical food to the inhabitants of her community. She belongs to the group named Niño de Atocha 1 and the other members of the group are doña Concepción Hernández Gómez, who sells fish and tipical juices, and doña Amparo Penagos Pérez, who owns a grocery store.

They need the loan to buy merchandise to supply each of their businesses and implements to adapt the stands from where they sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

ALBA, tiene en su casa un espacio adaptado para la venta de comidas típicas a las personas que habitan en su comunidad, tiene 49 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como obrero en la construcción. Ella pertenece al grupo Niño de Atocha 1 y las otras integrantes del grupo son: Concepción Hernández Gómez (Vende pescado y jugos típicos) y doña Amparo Penagos Pérez (tienda de abarrotes) Ellas esperan con el préstamo comprar mercaderías relacionadas con el rubro de cada una para surtir sus negocios y también implementos para adaptar de la mejor manera los lugares donde venden sus productos.

loans.use: Sale of tipical food and juice

loans.name: Koreta

texts.en: Koreta joined SPBD in order to receive financial assistance to help her run her sewing business, but it has also given her a chance to meet other ladies of her community. Koreta's husband died while their children were very young, and she has been raising 2 boys and 5 girls alone. She is sad about her loss, but her success has provided inspiration for other women not to be financially too dependent on their husbands. Koreta operates her sewing business 6 days a week and makes US$100-150. She uses the money for her children’s school fees and to otherwise support her family. Koreta is asking for a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase a new sewing machine, scissors, and threads for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine, scissors, and threads for a business

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.en:
Mrs. Pyalo P. is married with two children. She is the owner of a small store where she sells various goods needed by the inhabitants in that area. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to expand her business. She will be able to sell her goods as there is a high demand, make a profit, pay back her loan, and use part of the profit for her family's basic needs.

Mrs. P. is a member of the women's group called “ La Patience” a group that has been affiliated to HELP Africa since 2003.

loans.use: to buy various products needed in the area for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Miriam

texts.es:
Doña Miriam cooks traditional food in her home for her regular customers from the community. She is 56 years old and has one son. She belongs to the the Group Niño de Atocha 2 together with doña Yari Arellano Acuña, who sells cosmetic products from catalogues. With the loan doña Miriam will make adaptations to the places where she sells her meals and doña Yari will expand her business by selling hamburgers as well.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MIRIAM, ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas tradicionales en su casa , tiene 56 años y un hijo ,sus clientes habituales son las personas de su comunidad. Pertenece al Grupo Niño de Atocha 2 junto con doña Yari Arellano Acuña (venta de productos por catálogos de cosmetología). Con el préstamo Miriam adaptará mejor el lugar donde vende sus comidas y doña Yari ampliará su rubro vendiendo hamburguesas

loans.use: Extend sale of traditional food

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita is 47 years old, separated, with three children. She sells clothes, cosmetics and perfumes to the women in her community. She belongs to the group Niño de Atocha 2 and the other member of the group is doña Leydi Domínguez Gra, who sells shoes from catalogue. Both ladies will use the loan to buy more products to increase the sales for each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MARGARITA, se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes a las mujeres de su comunidad, tiene 47 años, separada y tres hijos.
