However, profits are not enough to cover his needs, so in an attempt to get more profit, he has decided to increase the business.

Given a loan of $100, he plans to increase his stock and even introduce new items.  The profit raised will be used to pay school fees for his siblings and buy food and medication for himself.
 
He plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, Toiletries

loans.name: Shafiqllah

texts.en: Shafiqllah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family. He is uneducated and married with 2 daughters. He has a retail shop. He has a lot of experience in his job. He wants to expand his business, so he requested to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, baskets, and crisps to attract more clients. He wants to make a good income to support his family and develop a good business. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, baskets, crisps

loans.name: Neba Eunice

texts.en:
The death of Eunice’s father left her with the responsibility of taking care of her siblings since her mother is unemployed.  In her search for a job she was recruited as a house maid where she earned money to open a hair dressing salon.  This hair dressing salon, athough situated along a very busy street, could not yield the expected profit because of a lack of investment capital.

With a loan of $100, she plans to buy hair products and other cosmetics as well as pay rent.  The profit will be used to pay apprentice fees for her junior sisters.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of hair products for her salon and rent

loans.name: Abong

texts.en:
Abong N. is married to Chubi Peter and is a mother five children, four of whom are below the age of 15.  Her husband’s low salary not being enough to cater for the needs of these children, N. saw the need to start a business. 

With a loan of $100, she plans to start a business selling commonly consumed food stuff like rice, corn, salt, magi, garri etc.  She plans to pay her children’s school fees with the profit.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase garri, rice, salt, magi and beans to start her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
N. Comfort is a mother of 2 children all below the age of 15 years.  She has gone through a lot of challenges since she divorced her husband ranging from emotional stress to lack of money to provide for herself and her family.  To provide for her family, she did an apprentice training in tailoring so she can start to sew and sell dresses.  

With a loan of $100 she plans to buy a sewing machine and some food items that are commonly eaten in the area that she will sell in front of her workshop.  Through this, she will raise money to provide food and other basic needs for her children.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of  a sewing machine, beans, corn, magi cubes and salt

loans.name: Ssekandi

texts.en:
Ssekandi is a 25-year-old married man with three children: two girls aged 4 and 7 and one boy of two and half years. He also supports one sister, aged 17, who is attending secondary school. He is a motorcycle mechanic with experience of over three years. He is renting a small stall in the suburbs of Kampala, where he repairs and sells spare parts.

He would like to borrow $1,200 to expand his business by purchasing spare motorcycle parts. This will increase his revenue base, which will enable him to fulfill his plan of acquiring a workshop with a welding machine, charging machine, grinder, and generator.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Joice Anastacio

texts.pt:
Joice is divorced. Her husband left her for a younger woman. Joice has children, but they live with their father and stepmother. She began the loan program at the end of 2006 to be able to support her children with some of their needs, despite not living with them. Her children study. With the profits of her business, she hopes to build a better home. She doesn't intend to marry; she prefers to live alone and dedicate herself more fully to her children. She tends chickens and her business will likely grow, since after her separation she now lives in an area with great demand for chicken.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Joice e divorciad.O marido lhe deixou porque arranjou outra mais nova que Joice. Ela tem filhos, mas estes vivem com o Pai e com a madrasta. Ela entrou para o Programa em finais de 2006 para poder apoiar os filhos em algumas despesas mesmo que seja a distancia. Os filhos de Joice estudam. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela pretende construir uma casa melhorada. Ela nao pretende casar, prefere viver sozinha para poder assistir melhor os seus filhos.Ela cria frangos e o negocio esta a correr-lhe bem pois que na zona para onde foi viver depoois de se separar ha muita procura de frango.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for poultry.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: For the past seven years, Irina K. has sold men’s clothing in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. A married mother of two, Irina is determined to provide a better living for entire family. Irina is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Irina has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, Irina is seeking a loan of $1200 to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Irina plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: A skilled entrepreneur and married mother, Irina is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past ten years, Irina has sold toys in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. The blend of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Irina’s vending kiosk a point of attraction in the Melitopol market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped Irina to develop a strong client base. With a strong character and eye to smart growth, Irina has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, Nadiya is requesting a loan of $750 to increase her inventory. With the additional income from profits, Irina hopes to continue improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en: A married mother of two, Lubov has worked tirelessly for the past two years to develop her bakery business in the Krasnodontsev market of Uzhgorod, Ukraine. A resident of one of the most impoverished areas of Ukraine, Lubov has determined to provide the best standard of living possible for her family of four. With the spirit of a true entrepreneur, Lubov opened the only bakery kiosk in the Krasnodontsev market. As such, she has been successful in maintaining stable growth in this novel business. Lubov is a woman of character and strength. Her determination and integrity have helped her to develop a strong reputation among clients and fellow entrepreneurs. Currently, Lubov is seeking a loan for $1200 to purchase stable shelf ingredients for baking. With the increased profits, Lubov hopes to help her son with the expenses of his upcoming wedding.

loans.use: To purchase shelf-stable ingredients for baking

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: A married mother of three, Tatyana has sold footwear for the past seven years in the Krasnodontsev market of Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Tatyana’s character and skill in business have helped her to gain an excellent reputation among clients and other entrepreneurs throughout Uzhgorod. A committed wife and mother, Tatyana works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. Her eye to market trends and customer needs have helped her maintain consistent growth in business. In fact, the growth and success of her business have caused both her husband and son to join in her efforts. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, Tatyana plans to continue expanding her business and providing a stable income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 27 years of age, with one son of four months. She is working as a workshop attendant in the Craft Village next to the National Theatre. They sell a variety of art and craft products like beads, African wares, shirts, dresses, children's wear, hats, sandals, woodcrafts, and many more items. She has four years of experience in this business. She owns a tailoring machine that she keeps at home due to lack of space.

Sharifa was persuaded to apply for a loan by a Kiva lender who visited Uganda. She would like to borrow $1,200 to set up her own workshop that will house the tailoring machine. In addition, she hopes to buy crafts from villages, which would make it easier for her to earn bigger profit margins that could support her many dependents.

loans.use: To set up a craft workshop

loans.name: Matias

texts.pt:
Matias is not married, but he lives with the mother of his 3 children. He works for the Provincial Command of the Police of the Republic of Mozambique. He started the loan program with FDM just this year. His first loan was $125. Because his business is running smoothly, he is now requesting a $250 loan to increase and diversify the inventory in his small tobacco shop. His children study and his wife looks after the shop.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Matias e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 3 filhos. Ele e trabalhador do Comando Provincial da Policia da Republica de Mocambique. Ele entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher ainda este ano. inicialmente ele tomou $125 para investir no negocio. Porque o negocio esta a correr bem agora ele tomara $250 para aumentar e diversificar os artigos a meter na sua pequena tabacaria.Os filhos de Matias estudam. Quem toma conta do negocio e a sua esposa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his tobacco shop.

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz B. is a 28 years old. He is married. He is from Sumgayit region, situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic.

He began his business with $300 in 2003. He started selling a small variety of religious things. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty in covering other consumption.

In 2005-2006, he made necessary changes in his small working place. He expanded his business and bought different religious things.

Now, he needs a $700 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other religious things and expand his shop to increase his business and to improve his family’s living condition with this additional income. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his business, buy other religious things and expand the size of his shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years of age and deals in local poultry rearing. She is a widow with four children and five dependents, all attending school. She lives in a three-roomed house. Being an enterprising lady, she decided to use one of the rooms as storage for chicken feed. She keeps over nine hundred local birds (layers). She sells the eggs to restaurant operators in Kampala city. She has been in this business for half a year.

Elizabeth finds it expensive buying chicken feed in town, so she has a plan to maximize profits by purchasing raw material for processing feed (maize brand) in villages where the feed is cheap. The profits earned from this over a period of time will help her fulfill her long-time dream of owning a hatchery. She would like to borrow $1,200 to buy chicken feed and expand the chicken structures.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and expand chicken structures

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana A. is 45 years old and lives in the area of Ouzai, one of the poorest areas of  the Beirut suburbs. She sells detergents to her surrounding neighbors. She needs $900 to build up a large enough inventory of cleaning products. Being divorced from her husband, she strives to provide a good education for her 2 children with the money she earns from her small business.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, aged 35, is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop selling a variety of household commodities. She has two children, aged 17 and 10, both at school, plus two dependents, girls aged 10 and 14, also at school. Betty had an accident and lost one eye. This was a big setback to her businesses, but she currently feels better and is now back at work.

Betty would like to borrow $1,000 to put more stock in her shop. With the approaching festive season in December, she hopes to make big profits, which will enable her to provide school fees for her children and dependents.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for shop

loans.name: Salma Betuel

texts.pt:
Salma is unmarried, but lives with the father of her 2 children. She started in the loan program in 2006. She sells new clothes in the Manjacaze market. Her husband is a miner and works out of the country. Salma is the one who takes care of the house and 2 children the majority of the time. With her profits, she pays for the schooling of her children and the household expenses. This way, the children don't suffer the absence of their father. If her business succeeds, she hopes to help her husband pay for the construction of a house.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Salma e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006.Ela vende roupa nova no Mercado de Manjacaze. o marido de Salma e mineiro e trabalha fora do Pais.Salma e quem cuida da casa e dos filhos a maior parte do tempo.Com os lucros ela paga a escola dos filhos e paga pelas despesas da casa.portanto os filhos nao passam mal devido a ausencia do Pai.Se tudo correr bem ela vai ajudar o marido nas despesas da construcao da residencia.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa is a widow and she works for a private insurance business. She started the loan program after her husband died in 2005. She has 5 children in school. Teresa wants to use the loan money to buy some home electronics/appliances. She has a small business selling vegetables. If all goes well, she hopes to diversify her business to earn more profit and be able to repair her home once she buys some small appliances with this loan.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa e vivuva e trabalha para uma Empresa Privada de Seguranca como Vigilante.Entrou para o Programa desde que o marido morreu em 2005.Ela tem 5 filhos e todos estao a estudar.Teresa quer usar o dinheiro para comprar alguns electrodomesticos para a sua casa.Ela faz um pequenos negocio da venda de verduras. Se tudo correr bem pensa diversificar um pouco o seu negocio para poder ter mais rendimentos para reabilitar a sua residencia uma vez que desta vez vai comprar electrodomesticos.

loans.use: To buy home electronics.

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is 38 years of age, is married, and has four children. She is a businesswoman operating a beauty salon in the Kampala suburb, styling hair for ladies.

In her family of five, the eldest daughter is a university student aged 20; the other three girls are aged 16,14, and 10. There is only one boy in the family, aged 13, going for secondary education. Halimah has been in the salon business for the last eight years, and it has helped her provide school fees for her family.

She is requesting to borrow $1,100 to purchase new salon equipment: a steamer, hair dryers, and cosmetics. With the increase in equipment, Halimah is optimistic that the number of customers will greatly increase, so she will realize bigger profits. That will allow her to continue paying school fees for her children, whose education has become increasingly expensive.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment (hair dryer and steamer) and cosmetics

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania H. is a 33 year old mother living in Roueiss, in the Beirut suburbs. To support her family, Rania sells perfumes. She needs $1200 to buy enough products for her business.
Rania is a previous loan recipient and her past loans have given her the opportunity to sustain and continuously develop her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for her perfumes sales business

loans.name: Sara David

texts.pt:
Sara is a single mother living with her 3 children. She was a member of a solidarity group that organized to obtain a group loan. At that time, she received $25. She started the FDM loan program in 2000. Since then, her business has developed and she has introduced new products such as almonds and beans. She sells these products in bulk and she buys them in another province -- not the province where she lives and runs her business. With her profits she has been able to improve her house. Her children have a balanced diet. She wants to continue investing in her business to grow her profits and guarantee the schooling of her children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara e solteira mas tem 3 filhos.Ela vive apenas com os seus filhos.Sara era membro de um grupo solidario que seorganizou para tomar dinheiro emprestado. O valor que ela recebeu na altura foi de $25. Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento em 2000. de la para ca o negocio dela foi desenvolvendo de tal modo que ela introduziu outros produtos para a venda tais como amendoim feijao. Ela vende estes produtos a grosso e compra-os numa outra Provincia diferente daquela onde ela vive e faz o seu negocio. Ela conseguiu com os rendimentos melhorar a sua casa. Os seus filhos estudam e tem uma dieta equlibrada. Ela quer continuar a investir no negoci dela para poder obter nais rendimentos para poder garantir os estudos dos seus filhos.

loans.use: For the purchase and transport of sacks of corn.

loans.name: Sawssan

texts.en: Sawssan sells cosmetics and gold in Roueiss, located in the suburbs of Beirut. She needs $700 to buy enough products for her business. Sawssan is a 38 year old married woman who is happy to be professionally active.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for her sales business

loans.name: Ines Jose

texts.pt:
Ines is married and lives with her husband and four children. She joined the credit program this year. She is in the business of selling lumber and has recently started raising and selling chickens. She would like to expand her lumber business by increasing inventory (for which she would need help with transportation costs as well). Ines also plans to buy more chicken feed with part of her loan. She helps her husband with their household expenses and with school tuition for her four children.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Ela vive com o marido.Entrou para o Programa ainda este ano. Ela tem um estaleieo onde vende estacas que servem para a construccao de casas.mas actualmente iniciou um novo negocio que e o da criacao e venda de frangos. Assim parte do dinheiro quer comprar racao para os frangos. Os seus filhos estao todos a estudar. Ela ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa e a pagar a escola dos seus filhos.

loans.use: inventory increase/ transportation

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is a 42 year old woman living in Borj Barajneh, in Beirut. She has a retail  clothes shop and needs $1200 to buy clothing. She is a mother of 3 children, who is able to manage her time between her family and her professional activity.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes shop

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine is 35 years of age. She is a trained tailor doing business in the city center of Kampala, in the Craft Village of Uganda next to the National Theatre. With her tailoring machine, she makes hand-crafted products such as quality bed covers, quality aprons, quality bags, and many more items. Rather than being paid a salary or making sales directly to customers, Daphine sells her goods to the workshop owners and to other Craft Village workshops around town.

Daphine was recently visited by a Kiva lender on her visit to Uganda and was persuaded to apply for a loan. She has applied for a loan of $1,000 to enable her to rent her own workshop, where she would be able to make her products and sell them directly to customers. She is hoping to pass on her skills to her children in the future.

loans.use: To rent an art and craft workshop

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Y. Fatma was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

She started her business in 2000. She sells cassettes demonstrating music of local and foreign musicians. With this business, she has earned enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She has had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.

Now, she needs $1,000 for expanding her business to buy different music discs and tapes for her shop and improving her family's living conditions. Her daughter helps her at this work. She wants to increase the number of clients and increase income. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy different things for her shop, expand her business and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Paulina Vasco

texts.pt:
Paulina is married and has no children. She joined the credit program in 2004. She currently sells homemade popsicles at a street stand besides owning a small pharmacy. Her businesses are doing well – she was even able to buy a new freezer recently – and count with a regular clientele. Paulina would like to sell more popsicles but needs a loan in order to buy more plastic bags, which she will use as packaging.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina e casada mas infelizmente ela nao tem filhos. O que lamenta bastante. Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2004.Ela vende gelados na sua banca.Mas por outro lado ela e proprietaria de uma farmacia.Ela tem muita clientela, principalmente por causa dos produtos farmaceuticos que vende.O negocio esta a correr-lhe muito bem. Ela ja comprou mais um congelador com os rendimentos do negocio. Ela pensa em ampliar o negocio.

loans.use: Paulina would like a loan to buy more packaging for her homemade popsicle business.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.en: Marcelle is a hairdresser living in Ain Ata in the region of Rachaya,  in Southeastern  Lebanon. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase beauty creams for her salon business. These new products will increase her customer activity and generate more revenue. She is the mother of two children, and she works hard to be develop her business and help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase of beauty creams

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 48 year old tailor who lives in Dahr el Ahmar. She needs $300 to help her buy a particular sewing machine for her work. Aida is part of a group loan made up of self-chosen women living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending system is based on incremental increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment by its members.The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards women's economic empowerment.

loans.use: To buy a special machine for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a hairdresser. She needs $300 to buy a new hairdryer and some winter clothing that she can sell to her clients. She is a 24 year old woman who lost her mother and has been trying alone to make ends meet ever since.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and winter clothing

loans.name: Gladys Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja and Julio is an older couple who are dedicated to the craft, and the elaboration and sales of thread. With this job, she has been able to proviD. education for her three sons who have all started their new lives with their own families. But not all of their children had the same luck; her 27-year old daughter went through a deceitful relationship that has left her very sad and disappointed, and with a daughter to take care. Maruja and Julio have received much happiness from their granddaughter. In order to pay for expenses to support her daughter, Maruja’s daughter had to go find a job that is located in another city and had to leave her daughter with her parents. Now Maruja and Julio take on the responsibility of raising their granddaughter and began working on artisan crafts in their home city and have opened a small auto repair shop at their house. This new activity demands a lot of time and work, especially with the number of services demanded. Due to the lack of materials, this has limited their production. They are asking for a $200 loan to increase their production and to have a larger capacity to use for their granddaughter’s expenses. With this loan, the couple will be able to dedicate their few remaining years of working to support their adorable granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Maruja y Julio son una pareja D. adultos mayores, que se dedican a la artesanía, elaboración y venta D. hilos, este oficio les ha podido otorgar educación a sus 3 hijos los cuales ya han emprendido una nueva vida junto a sus respectivas familias. Pero no todos sus hijos corrieron con la misma suerte, su cuarta hija D. 27 años sufrió un engaño que la dejó muy triste y decepcionada, con una pequeña hija en brazos. Maruja y Julio han acogido con mucha alegría a su nieta. Sin embargo para solventar los gastos D. su hogar tuvieron que irse a trabajar a otra ciudad y dejaron a su hija bajo los cuidados D. sus abuelos.Viéndose hoy con la responsabilidad D. criar a su pequeña nieta retomaron sus labores artesanales en su bella ciudad natal y aperturaron un pequeño taller en su domicilio, éste nuevo centro D. actividad les demanda mucho tiempo y trabajo debido al sin número D. pedidos que recibe a diario pero la falta D. materia prima ha ido limitando su producción por lo que solicitan un préstamo D. 200 dólares para acrecentar su producción y tener más capacidad adquisitiva para asumir los gastos D. su nietecita.Cuantos D. nosotros no haríamos lo mismo por nuestros seres queridos. Apoye a que este par D. ancianitos puedan ofrecer sus últimos años D. trabajo a su pequeña adoración.

loans.use: Purchase wool for the fabrication of Peruvian artisan.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is young entrepreneur, single, and does not have any children. She started her business to help her parents with expenses and to acquire money for the future so that she can have her own house and to provide her future family with a better quality of living. She began her business more than a year ago; taking advantage of the demand that was neglected in that area to start her business which is close to elementary schools, preparatory schools, and businesses. Thanks to the outlook of the business, she is very content with its achievement so far and hopes that the business will continue to grow.

María Guadalupe is seeking a loan for $475 to purchase accessories that are needed, such as computer mouse, microphones, speakers, webcams, etc., to provide better service to her clients. She will return the loan in 6 months. She is very grateful for the support that she will be given to continue with her business so that she can continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es una mujer joven y emprendedora, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, ella inició su negocio para ayudar en la economía familiar a sus padres y para poder hacerse de un patrimonio para el futuro ella también poder formar su propio hogar y poder brindarle a su futura familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella inició su negocio hace mas de un año aprovechando la demanda desatendida de la zona en donde pudo abrir su negocio ya que esta cerca de escuelas, preparatorias y negocios, y gracias a la visión de negocio que tiene, por ello ella esta muy contenta con lo que ha logrado hasta ahora y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

María Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar accesorios que se acaban con el uso, como mouses, micrófonos, auriculares, bocinas, webcams, etc., para tener un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder así con su trabajo continuar con su crecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase asseccories for her business.

loans.name: Ivan Rafael

texts.es:
Ivan is married and has two children; his wife stays at home. He started this business to be able to bring in a steady income and to have something of his own. His main needs were covering the necessities of his family, offering them a better quality of life, and trying to assure that the future would bring them some economic security. He started his business about two years ago, and decided on this business because he had the ability to grill meat and he enjoyed doing it. He decided to make and sell tacos and grilled steak. Little by little he has increased his sales and his clientèle, and he is very pleased with his gains.

Because of this, Ivan is requesting a loan of $275 USD to invest in the purchase of raw ingredients so he can offer a wider variety of products on his menu. He is offering to pay off the loan in 4 months. He and his family thank you very much for your support in helping his business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ivan esta casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar. Él inició este negocio para poder tener un ingreso fijo y algo propio, su principal necesidad fue poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y trata de lograr de que en el futuro pueda brindarles cierta seguridad económica a ellos. Inició su negocio aproximadamente dos años atrás y se decidió a este negocio por que tenía la habilidad para la preparación de carnes a la parrilla y le gusta hacerlas, así que decidió hacer y vender tacos y carne asada, ahora poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y sus clientes y esta muy contento con sus logros.

Por ello, Ivan está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para invertir en la compra de materia prima y poder brindar una mayor variedad de productos en su menú, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients for his business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María is married and has one child. Her husband is a bricklayer, and as his salary is quite low for keeping a household, she decided to start her own business in order to help with costs of the house and family. She began her business about a year ago, starting her sales out of her home and later, as she grew, selling in various markets around the city. This used-clothing business has helped increase her income, and she wishes to continue with her trade and keep it growing.

Ana María is requesting a loan for $275 to purchase merchandise for her business, especially seasonal clothing, to increase sales. She is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give them to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ana María esta casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como albañil, y el sueldo que percibe es muy bajo para la manutención del hogar, fue por esto que ella decidió poner su propio negocio con la finalidad de ayudar con los gastos de la casa y mantener a su hijo. Ella empezó con su negocio hace un año aproximadamente, iniciando sus ventas en las afueras de su domicilio y luego conforme fue creciendo empezó a vender en diferentes mercados rodantes de su ciudad. Este negocio de venta de ropa usada por pacas la ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y ella desea continuar con su negocio y seguir creciendo con el mismo.

Ana María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio, especialmente ropa de temporada para incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase used seasonal clothing

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto is a married man whose wife stays at home. He is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business three years ago. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well, and which he would like to continue to grow.

Roberto is requesting a loan for $650 for the purchase of cattle to sell; he will reinvest the capital and grow the business as he has been doing. He is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que inició su negocio en paralelo al trabajo que tenía, como un ingreso adicional y para ir juntando algo de capital como reserva por si se quedaba desempleado, conocía muchos contactos que compraban ganado y eso lo motivo a iniciar su negocio. Empezó hace tres años atrás y con el paso del tiempo ha ido creciendo con sus ventas y ahora necesita apoyo para invertir en su negocio, ya que le ha ido bien y desea continuar creciendo con el mismo.

Roberto esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 650 para la compra de ganado para luego venderlo y reinvertir sus utilidades en el mismo negocio y crecer como lo ha ido haciendo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar con su negocio y crecer para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for resale

loans.name: Maribel Maruja

texts.es:
In the few years since Maruja and Daniel got married, they have worked hard in their creative craftsmanship to successfully obtain a sewing machine and improve their resulting blankets and embroidery with which they have increased demand and income. With the savings they have been able to generate thanks to their efforts, they have obtained a small piece of land where they hope to give their seven-year-old daughter a pleasant place to live and play.

The couples' enterprising and optimistic spirit has helped them grow economically, but they still face great difficulties that effectively restrict them. The decoration of blankets for export requires too much time for their one machine. With an additional machine, they could keep up with demand and double their production. Their bold dreams may fall apart if we do not help with their request for a $500 loan that will help them consolidate their tiny enterprise and one day begin the construction of a house on the land that they bought years ago. With your help, they will keep weaving the colorful dreams of their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

A los cortos años después de haberse casado Maruja y Daniel, han luchado duramente en la actividad artesanal para lograr obtener una máquina de telares y mejorar sus trabajos de fabricación de mantas y bordados con el cual han podido aumentar sus pedidos e ingresos económicos.Con los ahorros que pudieron generar gracias a su desempeño han adquirido un terrenito con la añoranza de dar a su pequeña hija de 7 años un lugar apacible donde jugar y vivir placenteramente.El espíritu emprendedor y optimista de esta pareja ha hecho que hasta el momento puedan crecer económicamente pero aún tienen grandes debilidades que limitan este hecho de manera total porque la elaboración de mantas para exportación les demanda demasiado tiempo debido a que cuentan con una sola máquina y por este motivo requieren de una adicional para cumplir con la demanda y doblar su producción. Éste ánimo impetuoso se puede ver frustrado si no accedemos a la petición de prestarles la suma de 500 dólares que le ayudará a consolidar su pequeño centro empresarial y empezar la construcción de su casita en el pequeño terreno que adquirieron años atrás. Con tu ayuda seguirán tejiendo los coloridos sueños de su pequeña.

loans.use: Purchase of a machine for the making of blankets

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.es:
Delia and her husband devote their time and money to arts and crafts as this labor is highly valued and profitable in the area where they live. Nevertheless, it requires large sums of money for investment in raw materials and in machines for fine workmanship, expenses that Delia often cannot assume, given that she must also invest large sums of money in the education and well being of her four children, and she faces these expenses with diligence and responsibility. The need to increase her production to deal with these new demands of her household and creative work has brought her to request a loan of $500. She will use the money to purchase an additional machine that will speed up her work and meet the demand of her foreign customers. With your help, you can make sure Delia and her family ensure a profitable business and a roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Delia y su esposo han dedicado su tiempo y dinero a la actividad artesanal debido a que en la zona en la cual residen esta labor es muy valorada y rentable, sin embargo requiere de cuantiosas sumas de dinero para la inversión en materia prima y máquinas de confección, gasto que Delia no puede asumir en muchos casos, debido a que también invierte importantes sumas de dinero en la educación y bienestar de sus cuatro pequeños niños y afronta estos gastos con diligencia y responsabilidad.La necesidad de acrecentar su producción para hacer frente a los nuevos requerimientos que genere su hogar y su labor de artesanos la ha llevado a solicitar la suma de 500 dólares con el propósito de adquirir una máquina más para agilizar su trabajo y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes foráneos.Con tu colaboración harás que Delia su familia puedan tener un techo propio y un negocio más rentable.

loans.use: Purchase a machine for an artisan's shop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is an unselfish mother who is dedicated to the upkeep of her home. For more than two years she has had a little snack shop located in the school in which her two children attend. It makes her feel good to attend to the teachers and students in a cheerful and warm manner. She maintains this cheerfulness in her daily duties so that she can forget the sadness that she's felt since her husband left to work in Junín (Peru).

This is the reality for many families who don’t have the resources necessary to enable them to live. They end up having to find work far away from their home and families in order to earn a living. In spite of living with this pain, she continues to give her best in her snack shop. She has now also opened a store in her home that sells products made by local artisans. This helps her generate additional income to sustain her family. In order to strengthen the older business (the snack shop) she is asking for a loan of $175. With this amount, she will be able to finish implementing her little school snack shop and will be able to help her husband with expenses when he comes back home. Let’s help this family so that they can be reunited very soon and enjoy once again the love and support that occurs when a family is together.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Betty es una madre abnegada y dedicada a las labores de su hogar y a la pequeña cafetería que aperturó en el centro educativo al que asisten sus dos hijos y donde ya trabaja más de 2 años. Se siente muy a gusto atendiendo a los docentes y alumnos con mucha alegría y cordialidad, ésta alegría que mantiene a diario en su desempeño hace que olvide la tristeza que lleva desde que su esposo se fue a trabajar a Junín.Ésta es la realidad de muchas familias que no tienen recursos para poder subsistir y tienen que buscar un trabajo en el cual desempeñarse lejos de sus familias con tal de generar ingresos económicos para que en su hogar haya un pan diario.A pesar de vivir con esta pena no deja de dar lo mejor de si en su cafetería y ahora también en su nueva tienda de productos artesanales que inauguró en las instalaciones de su pequeña vivienda con el propósito de generar un ingreso adicional para la sostenibilidad de su familia.Para la consolidación del negocio más antiguo solicita una suma de 175 dólares con esta cantidad podrá terminar de implementar su pequeña cafetería escolar y apoyará a su esposo con los gastos a fin de que retorne pronto a su morada.Colaboremos para que esta familia se reúna muy pronto y gocen del amor de sus miembros.

loans.use: Finish setting up school snack shop

loans.name: Edy

texts.en:
Business Description

Edy has had an audio and video workshop since he was 12. He started his business by going from door to door and offering his services in various parts of the city. He focuses on the reparation and maintenance of domestic products. Nowadays, his development is evident as he already has a shop in his home as well as an employee. His potential clients are from the community he lives in as well as offering his services to numerous businesses and institutions in Guayaquil.

Use of the loan

He would like to use part of his loan to buy replacement parts he needs on a daily basis so that he can build up a stock as well as adapt his shop so that he can pay more attention to his clients.

Personal information

He is 34 years old and lives in a cement house with his three kids. His wife helps him deal with the clients. His goal is to grow in the locality so that he can can have a bigger income and thus progress with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Galimberti, Princeton University Language Project

Descripción del Negocio

Don Edy tiene un taller de audio y video desde hace 12 años, el inicio su negocio con el servicio de puerta a puerta por varios sectores de la ciudad, se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de artículos para el hogar, hoy en día su desarrollo ha sido notorio ya que tiene un local en su casa y un empleado, sus clientes potenciales es la comunidad de este sector y también brinda el servicio a varias empresas e instituciones de guayaquil .

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar parte de su crédito para comprar varios repuestos de uso diario y de esta manera poder tener en stock y el resto para readecuar su taller ya que siempre esta empeñado a brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. /p>

Información Personal

Tiene 34 años y tres hijos, su vivienda es de cemento y en la atención a los clientes le ayuda su esposa, su meta es crecer en su local para de esta manera poder tener un mayor ingreso económico y así progresar junto a su familia.

loans.use: Buy replacement audio and video parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a shop window and a tent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Business Description

Mrs. Janeth is dedicated to the sale of items for the home by credit and for cash, she began this business when she arrived in the city five years ago. Her husband and children actually help her with her business.

Loan Use

She needs credit to buy more wholesale merchandise and, in this way, increase her profits.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old and has four children, all of whom study to have a cement house and her goal is to succeed in her business in order to help her husband in educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrew, Princeton university Language project volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

. La Sra Janeth se dedica al venta de articulos para el hogar a credito y al contado, empezo este negocio desde que llego a la ciudad hace cinco años. En el negocio le ayudan actualmente su esposo y sus hijos.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi aumentar sus ganancias.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 39 años y cuatro hijos, todos estudian tiene una casa de cemento y su meta es salir adelante en el negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la educacion de sus hijos

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Having access to liquid capital in order to buy more waste material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more basic ingredients and expand her business locale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es:
Merlita has three children, two of them have their own families, the only one that lives with her is her youngest son and he helps her with the daily expenses thanks to the earning that he gets in his daily work. Because she had to take care of her children on her own, she started her own business, and she never let any problems or obstacles get in her way and that is how she decided to start selling fruits in the patio of her house on an improvised table and slowly she increased her selection by selling first necessity items. Since then she has built her own store, but she always had the problem of preserving her products fresh since she does not have a fridge.

In order to solve this problem, which does not allow her to increase her earnings, she is asking for a $300 loan. This amount (which she would return in a 6 month period) would allow her to buy the fridge that she needs and she would be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Merlita es madre de 3 hijos, dos están fuera de su hogar debido a que cada uno de ellos trabaja y vive con sus respectivas familias, su hijo menor es el único que vive con ella y contribuye con los gastos del hogar gracias al ingreso que percibe por su desempeño diario. Hace muchos años inició su travesía mercantil porque se quedó sola para educar, cuidar y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y por esta razón y la situación en la que se encontraba nunca dejó que los problemas y obstáculos la vencieran y es así como decidió empezar a trabajar en el patio de su casa improvisando una mesa para ofrecer frutas regionales y poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeño centro laboral con artículos de primera necesidad.Con el pasar de los años pudo completar la construcción de su bodeguita y siempre mantuvo el problema de la preservación de sus productos porque no cuenta con una máquina congeladora.

Para resolver este problema que no permite acrecentar las ganancias se encuentra en la necesidad de solicitar la suma de 300 dólares, este monto le permitirá adquirir el congelador que tanta falta le hace, ella desde ya queda eternamente agradecida comprometiéndose a devolverlo en un plazo de seis meses

loans.use: To buy a fridge that will allow her to increase her sales and give a better service.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Hilda C. has a small general store that sells novelty items. Her store has a very good location on a main street. She began her business with her parent’s help.

Use of the Loan

Hilda will use the loan to increase her merchandise and to make improvements at her location.

Personal Information

Hilda is 26 years-old and has a son. Her home is made of cement. Her goals are to buy a home and to save for her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Hilda tiene una bazar donde vende articulos de novedad. Su local esta muy bien ubicado encalle principal y empezo su negocio conla ayuda de sus padres.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el prestamo para incrementar mercaderia y hacer mejoramientos en su local.

Información Personal

Tiene 26 años esta separada y tiene unhijo su vivienda es de cemento. Sus metas es pomprarse una vivienda y ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos

loans.use: Vary Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various more articles

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana is a mother of 5 children, 2 of them are in college and the other 3 attend grade school. Her husband is a mechanic by profession. Because he wanted to work independently, he began to rent a modest location and purchased a few tools to serve his first clients. His good work was recognized and they saw the need to expand their tools to comply with the work required. Juliana, aside from caring to the children, also works in the shop together with her husband. They are both immersed in the world of mechanics in order to meet the expenses of the family and the education of their children. Owing to the work they have, and the demands of their clients, they urgently need to acquire an air compressor to provide better service. They are requesting $350, which they agree to repay in 6 months. Juliana is putting her hopes in us, the lenders, in order to continue to work and secure the wellbeing of her family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Juliana es madre de 5 hijos, dos de ellos estan en el colegio y los otros 3 en la escuela, vive con su esposo que es mecánico de profesión y debido a que quiso trabajar independientemente, empezaron modestamente alquilando un local y con pocas herramientas para atender a sus primeros clientes, debido al reconocimiento del trabajo de su esposo, se vieron en la necesidad de ir aumentando sus herramientas para cumplir con los trabajos requeridos, Juliana aparte de atender a los hijos también se desempeña en el taller en compañía de su esposo de esta manera están inmersos los dos en el mundo mecánico para satisfacer los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos.Debido a los trabajos que tienen y a la demanda de sus clientes asiduos, se encuentran en la necesidad de adquirir una compresora de aire con suma urgencia para brindarles un mejor servicio.La suma que solicita Juliana es de 350 dólares, monto que será devuelto en un plazo de seis meses y le permitirá adquirir ésta herramienta. Ella tiene depositada sus esperanzas en nosotros, para poder seguir trabajando y asegurar el bienestar de su familia

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED TO BUY AN AIR COMPRESSOR FOR THEIR SHOP SO THEY CAN IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR SERVICE.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Business Description

Verónica works washing and drying clothing. She has 6 years of experience and works in her business seven days a week. She serves the members of her community that come to her laundromat in order to meet her own needs, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to sustain her business.

Loan Use

Verónica is asking for a loan to buy more supplies like detergent and fabric softener, and also to decorate her laundromat, which is in her house, so that she can attend to her customers and make them comfortable. With the number of clientèle that she has accumulated, Verónica has to work hard to satisfy their requests and worries. She has been able to do this thanks to her experience in the business.

Personal Information

Verónica is 34 years old and works hard side by side with her husband to make her business a success. Thanks to her hard work they have been able to send their only son to school. Because of her consideration and sacrifice, she has been able to keep her family together and make her business stable. Verónica hopes to make her business successful and expand it much more so that she can increase her capital for the wellbeing of her child and her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Verónica se dedica a lo que es lavada y secada de prendas de vestir. Teniendo como experiencia 6 años, ya que su actividad lo realiza todos los días de las semanas. Sirviéndole a la comunidad del sector que acuden hacia el negocio de ella para librarse de cualquier apuro, y que gracias a su propio esfuerzo ha podido mantenerse en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Verónica solicita el crédito para comprar más insumos como detergentes y suavizantes, además esta decorando su local que se encuentra en su domicilio, para de esa manera atender a sus clientes de una manera cómoda y confortable. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Verónica se ve en la necesidad de complacer a sus clientes con sus peticiones e inquietudes, que gracias a la experiencia que tiene en su actividad ha podido satisfacerlos.

Información Personal

Dona Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, en donde junto a su esposo se esfuerzan día a día para salir adelante en esta actividad, además gracias al esfuerzo que realiza tienen a su único hijo estudiando. Con las atenciones y sacrificios que realizan, ha podido mantener su familia unida y su negocio estable. Los anhelos de Verónica es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de su hijo, en si de la familia.

loans.use: To decorate and buy supplies for her laundromat.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Hello my name is Oscar and my main activity is selling bakery products (bread and donuts) as a street vendor in the city of El Paraíso. I’ve been doing it for a year and it’s the activity that allows me to maintain my family. Thanks to this business I can give an education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Oscar, mi actividad principal es la venta de Ornado (Pan de casa y roquillas, las que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en la ciudad de El Paraíso, cuento con un año de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo dar educación a mis hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, donuts, quesadillas and culin.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
My name is Otilia and I sell bakery products (donuts and bread). I own a micro company in my house and I distribute the merchandise to the grocery stores in the city of El Paraíso. I count on many years of experience in this activity and it provides me the money I need to contribute with the expenses of my family and also to make some improvements to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Otilia, m i actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de hornado ( roquillas y pan), cuento con una micro empresa en mi casa de habitación, mi producto lo distribuyo de manera ambulante en las diferentes pulperias de la ciudad de El Paraíso, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi realizar algunas mejoras en mi casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, flour, cheese, candy, butter and firewood.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a single mother of 6 children. At this time, only the last girl, who is 8 years old, lives with her. She is solely in charge of the care and education of this girl as her other children are now responsible for the well being of their respective families.

She started raising pigs on her own initiative some years back, and started by buying a couple pigs. Little by little with patience and dedication, she has been successful and thanks to her profits, she has been able to improve the area where her pigs resiD. and to repair the corral so they have a suitable place to keep them safe.

Maria Teresa is worried about the daily feeding and upkeep of the pigs, due to the fact that she now has a considerable amount of animals and in addition to the anticipated requests of her clients. To alleviate her concerns, she’s asking for a loan of $350 with a promise to pay it back in 6 months. This amount will allow her to buy food to proviD. her pigs with a balanced diet so that she can fulfill the demand. Let’s do what's possible to fulfill her request so that she can continue to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by, Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Teresa es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales sólo la ultima niña D. 8 años permanece con ella; encargándose enteramente del cuidado y la educación D. la misma, ya que sus otros hijos velan por el bienestar D. sus respectivas familias.Empezó con el negocio D. la crianza D. cerditos por iniciativa propia hace unos años atrás, compró para este fin una pareja D. cerditos, y poco a poco con paciencia y dedicación fue viendo los resultados, gracias a los logros que obtuvo se dedicó D. lleno a esta actividad aprovechando el espacio que tiene en su huerta y acondicionó un corral adecuado para tenerlos a buen recaudo.La preocupación D. Maria Teresa es el D. alimentarlos diariamente, debido a que tiene una cantidad considerable D. animalitos y esto se suman las peticiones anticipadas D. sus clientes.Para contrarrestar esta preocupación solicita 350 dólares con un compromiso D. pago D. seis meses esta cantidad le permitirá comprar los alimentos balanceados para sus cerditos a fin D. cumplir con la demanda que se ha presentado. Hagamos posible su petición para que siga cobijando dentro D. su corazón esperanzas D. superación.

loans.use: To buy food and provide a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Darhwin Dario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Darhwin, I’m a merchant and my main activity is selling bakery products (bread and donuts). I’ve been a street vendor for 2 years and I sell, mainly, to the grocery stores in my city. The money I make allows me to cover the expenses of my family. It’s also important to mention that the idea of this business came to me because I could not count on a steady job due to the lack of oportunitys in my community. Thank god with this job I’ve been able to carry my family through..

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Darhwin, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de hornado (Pan y Roquillas) cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, las ventas la realizo de manera ambulante en todas las pulperías de mi ciudad, gracias a las utilidades que percibo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos mi familia. es importante mencionar que la idea de este negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos en vista que no contaba con trabajo ya que en esta comunidad las oportunidades de trabajo son escasas, pero gracias a Dios con este negocio he sacado adelante a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, donuts, quesadillas and culin.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Business Description

Erika has 2 years of experience with her work. Through a friend she got an incentive to work with these products. She attracted clients, which made her business go on increasing. The quality of the products is very good. Consequently people search for her. Besides she also sells clays from her products in the mornings. She works on a schedule of 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. Currently she rents the premises where she has the business.

Use of the Loan

She will invest the credit in the purchase of natural products. Her wish is to be able to open another location. This will be attended to by a relative. The product that she sells has good success in the market.

Personal Information

Erika is 31 years old. She is married. She has 3 children that study. Her little house is made of cement. Her husband has a small car, which he uses to carry freight. He also is a seller of assorted merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Erika tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su actividad. Por medio de una amiga le incentivo a trabajar con estos productos. Capto clientes lo que hizo que su negocio vaya en aumento. La calidad de los productos es muy buena. Por ende la gente la busca. Además también vende batidos de este producto por las mañanas. Trabaja en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 2pm. Actualmente alquila el local donde tiene el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de productos naturales. Su deseo es poder abrir otro local. El cual lo atenderá un familiar. El producto que ella vende tiene buena aceptación en el mercado.

Información Personal

Erika tiene 31 años. Es casada. Tienen 3 hijos los que estudian. Su casita es de cemento. Su esposo tiene un carrito el cual lo utiliza para realizar fletes. También es comerciante de mercadería variada.

loans.use: To buy more natural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy all his raw material

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Business Description

Edith has 5 years of experience with her work. She used to maintain a store, which she had to close because of the death of her husband 5 years ago. This motivated her to become strong and achieve going forward with her business. She started with the sale of food. She works every day of the week on a schedule of 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. Currently she delivers food in the center of the city and to known areas. Her son helps her with the services of the business.

Loan Use

The credit will be invested in the purchase of chairs and tables for her business in the home, besides the purchase of wholesale supplies, which will give her discounts in her purchases.

Personal Information

Edith is a widow. She has one son, who studies. Her little house is made of cement. Her wish is to return to take up again her store business and hopes that with the investment she will achieve this goal little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Edith tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad. Ella mantenía una tienda la cual tuvo que cerrarla por el fallecimiento de su esposo hace 5 años. Este fue motivo para que ella tome fuerza y logre salir adelante con su negocio. Se inicio con la venta de comida. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Actualmente ella reparte comida en el centro de la ciudad y conocidos del sector. Su hijo le ayuda con el servicio del negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de sillas y mesas para su negocio en el domicilio. Además de compra de víveres al por mayor lo que le dejara descuentos en sus compras.

Información Personal

Edith es viuda. Tiene un solo hijo que estudia. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es volver a retomar su negocio de la tienda y espera con la inversión que realizara poco a poco lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and wholesale products

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Business Description

Franklin has been in business for 10 years. He began selling plastic goods including "laminas educativas" (posters made of plastic that are used as teaching aids). Little by little, he added other products. He works everyday from 7am to 9pm. His wife helps him with the business.

Loan Plans

The loan will be used to supply his business with items like toys, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc. He's also thinking about selling soft drinks, juices, yogurt, vegetables, etc. to meet the demand coming from people in his neighborhood.

Personal Information

Frankin is 61 years old and has 5 children, all adults who also help him. His small house is of mixed construction. He hopes the business will give him security and that he can complete construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Franklin tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su negocio. Se inicio con la venta de láminas educativa y artículos plásticos. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo otra clase de productos para su local. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio. Con artículos como juguetes, bisutería, cosméticos. Piensa además invertir en víveres, colas, jugos, yogurt, legumbres. Y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda que tiene de gente de su sector.

Información Personal

Franklin tiene 61 años y 5 hijos. Los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan en sus necesidades. Su casita es de construcción mixta. A futuro espera darle seguridad a su negocio y terminar de construir su casita.

loans.use: Buy new and broader range of goods for resell.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Business Description

Evelin has 3 years of work experience. Luckily, her mother, whom she met in another country, gave her $200 to start her own business. Together with her grandmother, she has been able to continue her business. Also, she travels to sell brand name cosmetics in one of the most reputable markets in the country. She works everyday of the week from 8AM to 9PM.

Use of Loan

The loan will be used to invest in more inventory since the busy season is coming. In addition, she wishes to stock up for her cosmetics business.

Personal Details

Evelin is single and 20 years old. She lives with her brother and grandmother. She lives in a cement home. She wishes to be able to grow and expand her business to other parts of the city. She hopes to attain her dreams with the investment she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Evelin tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Se inicio gracias a su mama que se encuentra en otro país la cual le ayudo con un capital de 200 dólares para iniciar su negocio. Ha logrado mantenerlo trabajando junto a su abuela. Ha logrado surtir su local con regalos, juguetes. También ella recorre donde conocidos vendiendo cosméticos de una marca conocida en el país. Trabaja todo los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ya que se viene la temporada buena y tiene pedidos de muchos artículos. Además de surtir su negocio de venta de cosméticos.

Información Personal

Evelin es soltera. Tiene 20 años y vive con su hermano y su abuela. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es poder expandirse a otros sectores de la urbe con sus productos. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder lograrlo.

loans.use: to invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a mother of four girls. She lost her husband due to cancer a couple years ago and because of this tragedy she had to take all the family responsabilities on her own. She decided to make typical meals and sell them at the market in her city, in order to be able to get an income that would resolve her family financial problems. Soon after things got better, she had a problem because all the merchants in her area were relocated. As a result she had to move her business to her small house. The demand of her delicious cooking is very high and now she has a lot of people as regular clients in her business. Because of the high number of clients visiting her business her four daughthers are now working with her after they finish classes in their school “Instituto Superior” where they have a high proficiency.

Rosa plans to keep working hard and increase her sales as well to adjust the space to the number of clients and special typical meals that she offers. She is asking for a loan of U$275 to buy kitchen supplies and some ingredients for the meals. Please help her to accomplish her goal, so she can keep pleasing her very demanding clients.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es madre D. cuatro hijas, perdió al esposo que padecía D. cáncer hace un par D. años y con la presencia D. esta tragedia tuvo que afrontar la carga familiar. Decidió preparar platos típicos en casa para ofrecerlos en el mercado D. sus ciudad a fin D. procurarse un ingreso económico que solucionara los problemas económicos D. su hogar poco tiempo después las cosas marchaban bien sin embargo se presentó un inconveniente había que reubicar a todos los comerciantes D. esa zona y debido a este hecho tuvo que desplazar su centro D. labores hasta su pequeña morada. La aceptación por tan delicioso modo D. cocinar no se hizo esperar y ahora tiene a muchas personas como comensales asiduos y para atender a este inmenso número recibe el apoyo D. sus hijas en la preparación D. las comidas y en la atención, turnándose las 4 para no entorpecer su exitoso desempeño en el colegio e instituto superior. Rosa tiene planeado seguir desempeñándose en este trabajo para acrecentar sus ventas y acondicionar un espacio acorD. a tan distinguidos platos regionales que oferta, para eso necesita la compra D. utensilios D. cocina e insumos para su preparación. La suma solicitada para llevar adelante sus proyectos es D. 275 dólares en calidad D. préstamo. Ayudemos a concretar Este anhelo para que siga deleitando los paladares D. sus exigentes comensales.

loans.use: COMPRA DE UTENSILIOS DE COCINA E INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LAS COMIDAS.

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es:
My name is Maura and I have a small convenience store in my home. I thank God that since one year ago, I have been able to make some money to help cover family expenses as well as taking care of them. My children also help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maura, mi acitvidad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, desde hace un año y gracias a Dios con los ingresos de este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y al mismo tiempo atiendo a mi familia, tambien es importante mensionar que mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, rice, grains, dairy products, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith learned the art of sewing when she was only 9 years old. Her aunt taught her how to sew and she began working as a seamstress at this very young age. She is now the mother of 5 children; three of which are in school, and the two oldest of which, already have their own families. She lives with her husband who earns his living as a mechanic in a shop not far from their home. Thanks to their hard work, they both contribute to the maintenance of their home and the education of their children.

She began working with one second-hand sewing machine and now, due to the popularity of her good designs and reasonable prices, she needs to have a mending machine and various materials to fulfill her client’s orders on time.

To fulfill her request, she is asking for a loan of $350. With this amount, she’ll be able to aquire the tools and raw materials that she so badly needs. Let’s help to realize the wishes of Enith as she would like to, with time, grow her business to assure the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Enith aprendió el arte de la costura desde muy niña cuando aún tenia 9 años por un tía, de esa manera empezó a trabajar a muy tierna edad. Ahora es madre de 5 hijos, tres de ellos están en el colegio y los dos mayores ya tienen su propia familia.Vive con su esposo que se desempeña como mecánico en un taller no muy lejos de su casita.Gracias a su desempeño ambos contribuyen con el bienestar de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.Ella empezó con una máquina de coser de segundo uso, ahora debido al reconocimiento de sus buenos diseños y a los precios cómodos de sus ofertas, se encuentra con la necesidad de obtener una máquina remalladora y materiales diversos para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes a tiempo.Para cumplir con este propósito solicita la suma de 350 dólares, este monto le permitirá adquirir la herramienta y materia prima que tanta falta le hace, ayudemos a concretar los deseos de Enith, ya que espera con el tiempo acrecentar sus instalaciones para asegurar el bienestar de su familia .

loans.use: Purchase of mending machine and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is a widow with four children. She loves sales, which is why she started her own beauty supply shop four years ago, relying on her many friendships. Her enjoyment of sales and her need to earn money to support led her to open the business. She also has the ability to get along with all types of people, and she loves what she does; she'd love to continue her business.

Armandina is requesting a loan for $275 to buy seasonal merchandise to cover her orders and increase sales. She is offering to pay the loan in three months. She and her children thank you very much in advance for the support you'll give them to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Armandina es una mujer viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, a ella le encantan las ventas y fue por eso que hace 8 años atrás empezó con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ya que ella cuenta con muchas amistades y combinando su gusto por las ventas más la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, fueron los motivos que la llevaron a emprender su negocio. Ella también tiene capacidad para relacionarse con todo tipo de personas y le gusta mucho lo que hace, por ello desea continuar con su negocio.

Armandina está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar mercadería de temporada ya que ya tiene pedidos por cubrir y desea incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y sus hijos te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal beauty supplies

loans.name: Juana Tarsila

texts.es:
Hi my name is Juana Tarcila, I have had my own small store business at home for some years. Thanks to the income that I make from this business I can help with the family expenses. I am asking for a loan of U$ 400 in order to buy another freezer to store more products, since the demand for them has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer,

Hola mi nombres Juana Tarcila, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, desde hace varios años, gracias a los ingreso que persivo de este negocio puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito comprar un Frizer, ya que la demanda ha crecido y necesito otro congelador para almacenar mas producto.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, frijoles, jabon, pan, arroz, aceite, y Lacteos.

loans.name: Narcedalia

texts.es:
Narcedalia is single and has no children. She started her business because she lives with her parents and wanted to help them out financially. She has plans to get married and wants to have some savings and stability for her future. More than a year ago, she started selling shoes via catalogs amongst her friends and close acquaintances. Little by little, she has already amassed more referrals than customers. She still wishes to keep her business going and increase her customer base, so she can continue to help out her parents.

Narcedalia is seeking a loan of $325 to buy merchandise to be better equipped for her customers. She will pay the loan back in 4 months. She is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Narcedalia es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos, ella inició su negocio por que vive con sus padres y quería colaborar con la economía del hogar, además tenía planes de casarse y deseaba tener ciertos ahorros para poder cubrir sus futuros gastos, así hace más de un año empezó con la venta de zapatos por catálogo, empezando a vender entre sus amistades y familiares y poco a poco ya tiene más clientes por recomendación de sus primeros clientes, ahora ella desea continuar con sus ventas e incrementarlas y poder continuar ayudando a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.

Narcedalia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para la compra de mercadería y así tener un mejor y mayor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles is married without children. She started her business because she needed income that would enable her to improve and expand her home in order to have space for her own home business. She began five years ago, renting an area in which she offered beauty products, make-up, perfume, etc. Little by little her business has grown and she wants to continue growing and increasing her sales and clients.

María de los Ángeles is asking for a $250 loan in order to buy merchandise for her business and in order to take advantage of prices in bulk and increase the usefulness of her products. She is offering to pay back the loan in three months. She thanks you very much for your support in assisting the successful growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

María de los Ángeles esta casada y no tiene hijos, ella empezó su negocio por que necesitaba ingresos que le permitan hacer mejoras a su domicilio y ampliarlo para poder poner un área para su negocio en el mismo. Empezó hace 5 años atrás, rentando un local en donde ofrecía sus productos de belleza, maquillajes, perfumes, etc. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y desea continuar con el mismo y seguir creciendo incrementando sus ventas y clientes.

María de los Ángeles esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y poder aprovechar precios por paquetes e incrementar sus utilidades, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo para el logro del crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Jeidy Victoria

texts.es:
Jeidy es una señora casada D. 27 años edad, actualmente no tiene hijos. Jeidy se dedica a la venta D. juguetes, peluches y ropa en un puesto que tiene en el mercado MUTUALISTA D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, ya trabaja en este rubro alrededor D. 5 años. Si bien este sector es bastante competitivo porque existen otras vendedoras que ofrecen lo mismo que ella, Jeidy se caracteriza por tener siempre novedades en su mercadería. En cuanto a los precios, los mismos varian D. acuerdo a los artículos que demanD. el cliente. Nuestra cliente tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y morales, actualmente también trabaja en FIE, financiera donD. empezo su actividad crediticia.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeidy is a 27 year old married woman, who currently does not have children. She works selling toys, stuffed animals, and clothing in a booth in the Mutualista market in the city of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, and has been working in this role for about five years.
