As this type of business is fairly competitive since there are many other vendors with the same products, Jeidy stands out because she always has a variety of new products. The amount of money she needs to buy products depends on what her customers want to buy. She has a great credit history and is a good person, who currently works also with another organization where she began to borrow money for her business.

loans.use: To pay bills and buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Hello my name is Maria Isabel, I am a retailer, my main activity is the firewood sale. This business is located in my room. This job helps me with the expenses of my family and my other commitments. I have 2 years of experience in this type of activity, with the utilities that this business generates for me I have made some improvements to my room.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Maria Isabel, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña, negocio que tengo ubicado en mi casa de habitación, el que me genera ingreso para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos, cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, con las utilidades que este negocio me genera he hecho algunas mejoras a mi casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase Firewood

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victor Hernan. My main activity is passenger transportation, I owe a taxi with the official number 247, I have been dedicated to this activity for several years in my hometown and my income is enough to cover my family expenses and other obligations.

Currently I need to purchase some spare parts for the vehicle in order to offer better service to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Victor Hernan, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajero, cuento con un taxi operando bajo el No. 247 en mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos.

Actualmente necesito comprar algunos repuestos para el vehiculo y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio al usuario.

loans.use: To purchase tyres, blankets, buffers, water pump, fan, and combustion pump.

loans.name: Wilson Santiago

texts.es:
Wilson, 37, is currently separated from his wife.  He provides child support for his one daughter.  Currently, Wilson lives with his elderly parents.  He works as a police patrol in buildings and previously, was a member of a Battalion of the National Police for 17 years.  Currently, he seeks a loan for his personal expenditures and to buy a refrigerator.  The price varies by region and usage (new/used).  Wilson is an old client of this lending institution.  He has demonstrated good ethics and timely payments.  The total loan amount he seeks is $625. 

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. 


Wilson es una persona de 37 años de edad que actualmente está separado de su primera esposa, tiene una hija a la cual le pasa pensiones para su manutención. 
Actualmente Wilson solo vive junto con sus padres que son personas mayores. Wilson trabaja prestando servicios como policia de seguridad física en instituciones, es miembro del Batallón de Policia Nacional desde hace 17 años atrás. 
La presente solicitud es para consumo personal y para la adquisición de un refrigerador, el precio del mismo varia dependiendo el estado, es decir si es nuevo o a medio uso.
 Wilson es un cliente antiguo de la Institución tiempo en el cuál demostró tener un buen comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos. el monto solicitado asciende a $us. 620.-

loans.use: personal expenditures and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Martha Isabel, my main activity is trade, I owe a small business selling clothing which I distribute as a street vendor and at request. I have been dedicated to this activity for several years and thanks to the profits I can contribute to my family's expenses improving the family income and thus achieving better opportunities for my children and improve our life standards.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Martha Isabel, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a las utilidades que me genera este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, mejorando asi el ingreso familiar logrando mejores oportunidades para mi hijos y un mejore nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, men's shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Maria Asunción

texts.es:
My name is Maria Asunción,. I am a business woman and I've been running a grocery store out of my home for several years now. I have gained a lot of experience in business, and thanks to this store I have been able to generate income and take care of my family. I am very happy with my business because I have improved my home life and and have given my children the opportunity to have an education - right now they are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Asunción, soy comerciante y tengo una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, cuento con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, me siento muy contenta con mi negocio ya que he mejorado mi vivienda y mis hijos tiene la oportunidad de preparase, actualmente ellos estan estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, lard, rice, eggs, soaps, pastas and dairy items to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es una mujer casada de 30 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para ambos sexos y diferentes edades, actúa como disribuidora mayorista ya que abastece de mercadería a los puestos de venta de los principales mercados de las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto. Griselda vive en la casa de su suegro, desde hace siete años atrás, el inmueble se encuentra ubicado en la zona de SENKATA lado sur de la planta de Y.P.F.B. en la avenida Juana Basilia Calahumana Nro. 3134, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposo que se dedica a prestar servicios como estibador eventual en la Cervecería Boliviana Nacional. Griselda trabaja comercializando ropa desde hace siete años atrás, si bien existe bastante competencia en este rubro, ella cuenta con su propia clientela, ya que por la forma que atiende a sus clientes y principalmente por su puntualidad en la entrega es una de las más preferidas. El presente crédito es para la adquisición de más mercadería, no existe un precio fijo en las prendas de vestir ya que los mismos varian de acuerdo a la talla, sexo, modelo y tipod e prenda. No tiene antecedentes crediticios negativos en el sistema financiero.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Griselda is a 30 year old married woman who works in the sale of clothing for both men and women of different ages, and is currently a major distributor that provides merchandise to the different booths that sell clothing in the largest markets in La Paz and El Alto, Bolivia. She has lived with family members for 16 years in the SENKATA area, and has three school age children and her husband works in the local brewery. Griselda has worked with clothing for the last seven years, and has been a great fit to this role, as she has her own clientele. She has gained these customers through serving them with on-time deliveries and has become their favorite supplier. This loan is to buy more merchandise. She needs the funds because her prices can vary based on size, gender, model, type, and brand. She has a great financial history.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia es una señora mayor D. 50 años D. edad, actualmente no tiene dependientes a su cargo, ya que sus tres hijos son mayores y viven D. manera independiente. Bacilia vive en casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Bacilia se dedica al comercio D. ropa nueva en el mercado VILLA VERD. D. Montero donD. tiene dos casetas propias, el negocio consiste en comprar ropa nueva al por mayor en la feria D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, para después comercializar esta mercadería en Montero al por menor. Bacilia tiene experiencia en el rubro D. 18 años, tiempo en el cuál demostró siempre traer mercadería surtida y D. buena calidad. Existe bastante competencia en este tipo D. negocio, sin embargo el éxito se concentra en la consolidación del negocio y la ubicación que tienen las casetas en el mercado. Por otra parte también existe bastante demanda por este tipo D. artículos en especial los fines D. semana. Con la presente solicitud Bacilia adquirirá ropa D. niños, adultos, ropa interior a percios por docena para después comercializar por unidad. La presente solicitud es su quinta secuencia con la Institución con un buen comportamiento D. las cuotas correspondientes, cabe recalcar que estos créditos también fueron otorgados para la compra D. un surtido D. mercadería.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Bacilia is a woman over 50 years of age, who currently does not support any dependents, since her three children are grown and live independently. She lives in her own home that she provides with all her basic needs. She works in the retail business selling clothes in the store Villa VerD., in Montero where she has two booths of her own. The business consists of selling new clothing mostly in the Santa Cruz D. la Sierra market, and later she began also doing some business in Montero. Bacilia has 18 years of experience in this role, and over time has always maintained the quality and amount of the products she sells. There is a big need for this type of business. However, her success is due mostly to the consolidation of her business and the great locations that she has in the markets. There is also a great demand for her products, especially on the weekends. WIth this current loan, Bacilia will buy clothing for children and adults, as well as undergarments, which she will buy at per-dozen prices and sell at single-unit prices. This is her fifth loan with Agrocapital and she has a great history of paying off the loans she used to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.use: Funds to purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un señor de 53 años de edad, su familia está conformada por 4 hijos de 22, 18, 12 y 9 años de edad respectivamente. Los dos hijos mayores actualmente están trabajando al igual que su padre con moto-taxis y los dos menores siguen estudiando en el colegio. Esta familia cuenta con una casa propia y cinco motos, de las cuales tres las utilizan Jose y sus hijos para trabajar y las otras dos las rentan diariamente. Jose aparte de trabajar como moto-taxista durante la semana, se desempeña como albañil los fines de semana, en ambos rubros tiene bastante experiencia ya que trabaja con esto algo más de 20 años. Existe competencia en el transporte de pasajeros (moto-taxi) pero también hay mucha demanda sobre todo en las rutas locales de Montero. Por otra parte algo que ayuda bastante a Jose es su afiliación a una asociación de moto-taxis porque cuenta con paradas y clientela fija, también el ingreso extra que le genera su trabajo como albañil permiten aportar a la economía de la familia. La presente solicitud es para construcción, esta es su tercera solicitud con un excelente cumpimiento de los pagos. Las anteriores solicitudes sirvieron para la adquisición de las motos con las que trabaja ahora.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose is 53 years old, and his family includes four children that are 22,18, 12, and 19 years old, respectively. His two oldest children currently work along with their father with moto-taxis and the two younger children are still in school. This family has a home and five motos, three of which are used by Jose and his sons to work and the other two are rented out daily. While Jose works as a moto-taxi driver during the week, he works as a carpernter on the weekends, and in both roles he has sufficient experience and has worked like this for more than 20 years. There is a lot of business for transporting passengers by moto-taxi, but there is also large demand along the local highways. Jose's business is supported by stopping to pick up clients and also a fixed clientele. The extra income he earns as a carpenter allows him to take care of the family's finances. This current loan is for construction, and this is his third loan with an excellent history. His previous loans allowed him to purchase his motorcycles he works with now.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Mirna Griselda

texts.es:
My name is Mirna Griselda. My main activity is commerce. I have a small clothing business. I distribute new clothes as a street peddler in different neighborhoods and colonies around my community.

I have a good client portfolio and many years of experience. Thanks to this business I have been able to generate income to contribute with my family's expenses and I have been able to take care of my children.

Currently, I need to restock my business because the busiest time of year is about to start and I want to be able to offer my clients enough product variety.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Mirna Griselda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante en los diferentes barios y colonias de mi comunidad, cuento con buena clientela y con varios años de experiencia, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y cuidar de mis hijos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta y asi poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase men's and women's trousers, sport shirts, wome's blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Elena Sebastiana

texts.es:
Elena is from Huari, a town near the city of Huancayo. She is an enterprising woman and works making sweaters and rugs. She learned to knit by hand when she was very young, thanks to the dedicated teachings of her beloved mother, and since then has developed her skills and applied her creativity to every job that she has done. Now she has been doing this noble task for 20 years and is the mother of three children. Her children motivate her day by day to work diligently. Her daily work fills her with pride and makes her feel more independent. Her husband is a mason and his jobs are often sporadic. For this reason his income is minimal, but thanks to his wife, their children have the security of daily support. Elena hopes to continue supporting her family and to further develop as a person. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $175 which she would use to buy more wool for her knitting and with which she would increase her income and ensure her children's wellbeing. Let us support this mother who works hard to take good care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Elena es natural de Huari un centro poblado cerca de la ciudad de Huancayo, como mujer emprendedora que es se dedica a la confección de chompas y tapetes, ella aprendió a tejer a mano desde niña gracias a las enseñanzas de su querida mamá y desde entonces desarrolló este talento poniendo su creatividad en cada trabajo que realizaba. Actualmente lleva ya 20 años dedicándose a esta noble labor y es madre de tres hijos que la motivan día a día a trabajar diligentemente, su desempeño diario la llena de satisfacción y se siente más independiente. Su esposo trabaja de obrero albañil y muchas veces de modo esporádico por esta razón los ingresos que percibe son mínimos pero gracias a su esposa, sus hijos tienen la seguridad de recibir el sustento diario.Elena desea seguir apoyando a su familia y desarrollarse como persona es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 175 dólares que le servirá para poder comprar más lana para sus tejidos e incrementará sus ingresos para brindarles bienestar a sus hijos. Apoyemos a una madre que con talento y esfuerzo vela por su familia.

loans.use: To buy materials for knitting sweaters

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor, nuestro cliente de 51 años de edad vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa que es de su propiedad. Nicanor se dedica a prestar sus servicios como maestro albañil contratista y su esposa atiende el negocio familiar que es un taller de costura, el hijo ayuda a sus padres en ambos negocios. Nicanor tiene experiencia en este rubro más de 20 años y su esposa trabaja en la costura hace más de 5 años atrás. Debido al empeño en ambos trabajos, la familia de Nicanor logró ampliar constantemente su casa y taller de costura, renovando sus máquinas para mejorar la calidad de los productos finales. Con la presente solicitud Nicanor comprará dos o tres máquinas semiindustriales para ampliar el taller y mejorar su producción y la calidad de la misma. Esta es la cuarta solicitud de crédito de Nicanor con la Institución, y en este tiempo demostró tener un excelente comportamiento crediticio en cuanto a puntualidad. Actualmente sólo tiene crédito en AGROCAPITAL.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicanor is 51 years old and lives with his wife and son in a home on his own property. He works by offering his services as a master Mason contractor. His wife takes care of the family business which is a tailor's shop, and their son helps the family with both businesses. Nicanor has had experience in this role for 20 years and his wife has worked in sewing for more than five years. Because of the family's commitment to their work, they have constantly achieved a great deal in their tailor's shop, updating their machines to the highest quality of today's current products. With this loan Nicanor will buy 2 or 3 semi-industrial machines to increase the amount and quality of work they can do. This is the fourth loan Nicanor has taken out, and at this time he has shown great responsibility in making his payments. Right now he is only working with Agrocapital.

loans.use: Expanding his tailor's shop and buying new sewing machines

loans.name: Olvin Tomas

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Olvin Tomas. My main activity is furniture sales. My specialty is hall, kitchen and bedroom furniture. I have been doing this activity for several years. It has allowed me to generate income to contribute with my family's expenses. Due to the rise in demand, I need to invest more and I don't have enough capital in order to meet the existent demand.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Olvin Tomas, mi actividad principal es la vanta de muebles de sala, cocina y dormitorio, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente la demanda es mayor por lo que necesito invertir mas y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Purchase hall furniture, china display furniture and drawer chests

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.es:
Alfreda is a young mother of two children, who are the reason for her existence. Because of her love for them, she works very hard each day at the side of her husband building furniture in a shop that they started in her house four years ago. She and her husband work well together as partners in the shop because while her husband builds the framework for the furniture, she then upholsters the furniture with fabric.

Their business has increased in size, which is very satisfying to her, and she wishes to continue working. She yearns to have her own place, where she would be able to sell the furniture upholstery she has designed thanks to her talent and hard work.

She is asking for a loan of $350 to be able to buy materials with the eventual goal of acquiring her own place in which to work. With your help, let’s make it possible for this family to continue to reach their dreams of building and upholstering furniture with much hard work and love.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Alfreda es una joven madre de dos niños que se han convertido en motivo de su existencia y por amor a ellos se esfuerza cada día al lado de su esposo en su pequeño taller de fabricación de muebles que implementaron en su casita hace ya cuatro años, su labor se complementa porque mientras su esposo fabrica el armazón de los muebles ella los va recubriendo de tela.En la actualidad su pequeño taller ha incrementado su tamaño y esto la llena de satisfacciones y muchos deseos para seguir trabajando, su anhelo es poder tener un local propio donde ella pueda comercializar las fundas de los muebles que ha ido diseñando gracias a su ingenio y diligencia.Solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para poder comprar telas, con el propósito de adquirir un local propio con las ganancias que obtenga gracias a su labor.Con tu colaboración podemos hacer que esta familia pueda seguir armando sus sueños para cubrirlos con mucho amor y trabajo..

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to upholster furniture

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 45-year-old mother who worked as a government teacher for almost ten years. When her mother passed away two years ago, she decided to stay home to care for her sick father. With an unemployed husband, Kalala has had a hard time raising her four children. Her husband worked on their plantation while she stayed home. They sold their crops twice a week, but unfortunately, it was not sufficient to support the entire family as well as cover the cost of medication for her father.

Kalala decided to do something about her situation so decided to earn money to provide her children with an education. She started making ice cake, which quickly rose in demand in the village as well as the village school.

She is a happy mother now - able to put the extra money for her children and have enough left over to make home improvements. She is planning to start another business selling pancakes or popcorn, which will depend on her ability to secure future loans.

loans.use: To buy equipments for her ice cake business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una señora D. 62 años D. edad, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijos que son mayores D. edad. Celia cuenta con una venta D. abarrotes donD. ofrece productos D. la canasta familiar, juguetes, material escolar y paralelamente también negocia con alquileres D. algunos cuartos D. su domicilio. La cliente tiene más D. 30 años D. experiencia en este rubro y cuenta con todos los conocimientos basicos que requieren estos negocios, esta es la razón por la cuál maneja muy bien ambos negocios. Debido a la demanda en la zona por los productos básicos que ofrece en su venta constantemente necesita D. financiamiento para surtir su mercadería, D. acuerdo a la época. Con la presente solicitud del crédito la cliente adquirirá más regalos, juguetes, distintas bebidas y productos D. la canasta familiar y D. bazar. Esta es la cuarta secuencia D. Celia con Agrocapital y ha demostrado tener un excelente comportamiento crediticio, ya que pagó sus cuotas D. maner puntual, actualmente no tiene más deudas en el sistema financiero.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler , Kiva Volunteer.

Celia is a 62 year old woman, who is widowed and lives with her two oldest children. Celia runs a grocery store where she sells common products for families, toys, and school supplies, and also runs a business with which she rents out rooms in her home. She has over 30 years of experience in this role and has all the basic knowledge that these businesses require, which is why she can run her businesses so well. Because of her area's high demand for the basic products she sells, she constantly needs funds to maintain her stock and stay up to date. With this loan Celia will buy more gifts, toys, a variety of drinks, groceries, and other miscellaneous products. This is the fourth time that Celia, with Agrocapital, has demonstrated an excellent credit history since she has always maD. her payments on time and currently has great faith in this financial system.

loans.use: Pay off previous credit and increase working capital

loans.name: Mayra Cinthia

texts.es:
With her desire to improve herself in the face of scarcity, Mayra decided to open a small shop two years ago in her parents' house, hoping to pay her university expenses. She is the oldest of four children, and because of the needs of the little ones, her parents weren't able to make her dreams a reality. Nevertheless, thanks to her diligence, drive, and her tiny store, she is making them happen. This fact fills her with satisfaction and she knows that all efforts require sacrifice; with the help that you offer her and her parents, they have been able to gain economic stability and her little siblings enjoy their well being. Her intended plans are to continue running her small shop with more items, for which she is requesting a loan of $350. Let's make it so this hard-working young lady can continue to harbor her dreams of well-being and prosperity in her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Con sus deseos de superación y ante la escasez económica, Mayra decide abrir una pequeña tienda hace dos años en casa de sus padres con el propósito de poder solventar los gastos económicos que requiere sus estudios universitarios de educación.Ella es la hermana mayor de 4 hermanos y debido a que los pequeños en casa requieren muchas cosas sus padres no han podido hacer realidad su anhelo. Sin embargo gracias a su diligencia y empeño lo está concretando valiéndose de este pequeño centro de ventas. Este hecho la llena de satisfacción y sabe que todo propósito requiere de sacrificio; con la ayuda que les brinda también a sus padres estos han podido obtener una mayor estabilidad económica y ahora sus hermanitos gozan de bienestar.Su propósito futuro es seguir implementando su pequeña bodega con más artículos para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares.Hagamos que esta joven trabajadora siga albergando deseos de bienestar y prosperidad en su corazón.

loans.use: Purchase of highly needed items for a small general store.

loans.name: Nixi Debeldy

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Nixi Debeldy. I work in commerce and I have a small grocery store called " MARELIN ". I have been running this store for one year. It generates an income to help with the family’s expenses. At present, I need to buy more merchandise in order to be able to offer a bigger variety of products to my clients. It is an important to mention that thanks to the income of this business my children are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Nixi Debeldy, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia llamada pulperia "MARELIN", tengo un año de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente nesesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de producto, Es importante mensionar que gracias a los ingresos de este negocio mis hijos estan estudiante.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, flour, grains oil and milk products.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Leonarda, my principle activity is business, and I have a small food and drink store located in the center of my community. I have a good clientele and experience in this type of activity. Thanks to the income that I earn from this business I have succeeded in bettering my home and giving an education to my children. Currently they are professionals. Right now I need to restock my business in order to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Leonarda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en el centro de mi Comunidad, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad, gracias a los ingresos que persibo de este negocio he logrado mejorar mi vivienda y dar educación a mis hijos actualmente ellos ya son profesionales. Actualmente nesecito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, butter, rice, oil, bread, milk products and sausages.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz’ business is located in the Central Market of Tarapoto, in space #1, in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas”. She sells dried pork, smoked pork, sausages, pork giblets, pork rinds, and lard. She prepares her various products every afternoon so that she can begin selling them the next morning at 5:00am.

With the credit of S./ 1,000.00 (approximately $333.00) that she was recently granted by Manuela Ramos, to be paid back in 6 payments, she will by 4 pigs weighing 60 kilos for the production of smoked pork, sausages, pork rind, filling, and other products she makes and sells. She has 3 small children and her husband helps her slaughter the pigs and prepare the products.

She plans to one day buy an empty meat packing facility and also have her own store for selling the meat products. She currently sells them from her mother-in-law’s house; her mother-in-law also has the same type of business. The good treatment she gives her customers and the cleanliness of her products have helped her to achieve a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz tiene su negocio ubicado en el Mercado central de Tarapoto, puesto Nº 1, distrito de Tarapoto, provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Virtuosas". Vende todos los días carne seca de cerdo como son las cecinas, chorizo, menudencia, chicharrones y manteca. Todas las tardes prepara sus variados productos, para que al día siguiente desde la 5.00 a.m., empiece la venta. Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00 (US$ 333.00 aprox.) pagaderos en 6 cuotas, comprará 04 cerdos de 60 kilos para la preparación cecina (carne ahumada) chorizo (embutidos), chicharrones, relleno y demás productos que elabora y vende. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños, su esposo le ayuda en la matanza de los cerdos y la preparación de los productos. En el futuro piensa comprar una empacadora al vacío y también tener su propio local para los preparados, ya que actualmente ocupa parte de la casa de su suegra, que también tiene el mismo negocio. El buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes y la limpieza de sus productos ha logrado tener buenas ganancias.

loans.use: To buy pigs and ingredients

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es:
Bethy is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and two young daughters. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos”. She lives in Tarapoto in the housing association “Las Brisas del Tarapotillo, in the department of San Martín. She sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and chicken, pork, beef, sausage, and giblets. She has a space in her house that she has adapted for this purpose.

She began her business two years ago with a small table and a wooden shelf for the purpose of making extra income for her family. Her husband helps her a lot—it is he who does the daily buying in the market. The business has prospered and she has a variety of products, but she feels that she needs to have a greater variety.

With the credit of S./ 1,700.00 (approximately $567.00), to be paid back in 6 payments, she will buy a glass vitrine for the products that require display, rice and sugar in 50 kilo bags, canned fish in boxes, containers of cooking oil by the dozen, and fruits and vegetables at wholesale price. She will also buy stationary supplies and other items that her customers request. Her dream is to convert her small grocery store into a Minimarket and to tend to her customers, of whom there are more everyday, with enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bethy tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 2 hijas menores, pertene al Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos". Vive en Tarapoto, en la Asociación de vivienda Las Brisas del Tarapotillo en el Departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, frutas y carnes de pollo, cerdo, res, chorizo y menudencias, en su misma casa donde ha acondicionado un espacio para su negocio. Inicia su negocio hace dos años con una pequeña mesa y un estante de madera con la finalidad de generar otros ingresos para el hogar. Su esposo la apoya bastante, pues es él quien hace las compras diarias del mercado. El negocio ha prosperado y tiene variedad de productos, pero siente que todavía le falta surtir más. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,700.00 (US$ 567.00 aprox.) pagaderos en 6 cuotas, comprará una vitrina de vidrio para mostrar sus productos que requieran exhibición, arroz y azúcar en bolsas de 50 kilos, conservas de pescado en cajas, aceite en docenas, verduras y frutas al por mayor como también útiles de escritorio y lo que los clientes le solicitan. Su sueño es que su bodega se convierta en un Minimarket, atiende con esmero a sus clientes que cada vez aumentan más.

loans.use: To buy a vitrine and various grocery products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen lives in the region of San Martín, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in the central market of the town, and she belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras”. She sells stews, juices of fruits from the costal region, and fresh and cooked vegetables for salads. She began the business with the goal of improving her family’s economic situation. Thanks to the support of her family and her constant effort and perseverance, the business has grown considerably. When she first started her business, she was selling a ½ kilo of three different kinds of stew in a day, and now she sells 30 kilos per day of stews and also the other products she has.

Carmen is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and one of her younger daughters; they both help out in the business. The rest of the children are now independent. This business gives Carmen great satisfaction in earnings and in her personal life. She is an example of struggle and perseverance for other women, which encourages them to fight for their dreams and shows them that with effort and perseverance, one can achieve many things. Carmen plans to continue increasing her variety of products and improving service. That way she can assure the satisfaction and loyalty of her customers.

With the credit of S./ 1,500.00 (approximately $500.00) recently granted her by Manuela Ramos, to be paid back in 6 payments, she will buy a variety of stew ingredients, such as Huascar beans, Canary beans, cowpeas, and split peas. She’ll also buy vegetables, fruits, etc., in large quantities (sacks), and also some kitchen utensils, such as large steel cooking pots and large spoons. This is all due to the great demand being generated by her business and the desire to improve the quality of services and products so she can offer the best to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central de la zona, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Trabajadoras". Se dedica a la venta de menestras cocidas, venta de extracto de frutas de la región y de la costa y venta de verduras picadas frescas y cocidas para ensalada, inició el negocio con el fin de mejorar la situación económica de la familia, gracias al apoyo de su familia, a su esfuerzo constante y perseverante, ha logrado que el negocio crezca considerablemente tanto así que en sus inicios comenzó vendiendo ½ kilo de tres variedades de menestras y actualmente vende 30 kilos diarios de menestras variadas y los demás derivados. La señora Carmen tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y con una hija menor quienes son el pilar y el apoyo en el negocio, sus demás hijos son independientes, el negocio que dirige le esta dando grandes satisfacciones en su economía y en su vida personal, ya que es un ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia para otras mujeres a las que las incentiva y alienta a luchar por sus sueños y que con esfuerzo y perseverancia se puede lograr muchas cosas; en sus planes está el seguir incrementando en variedades de productos y mejorar el servicio del negocio y lograr así la satisfacción y fidelidad de sus clientes. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 (US$ 500.00) pagaderos en 6 cuotas, comprará menestras variadas como huascar, canario, chiclayo, alverja partida, verduras, frutas, etc. en cantidades más grandes (sacos), así como también algunos utensilios de cocina como ollas de acero más grandes, cucharones, todo esto por la gran demanda que le esta generando el negocio, así como también para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y productos y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy stew ingredients and fruits at wholesale prices. To buy kitchen implements.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
My name is Mercedes. My main commercial activity is the elaboration and selling of tortillas and coffee. I have many years of experience on this type of activity. It generates enough income to cover my family's needs and other commitments to my suppliers. Presently, I will like to be able to satisfy the demand for my products but I don't count with enough capital to expand. That is the reason, I'm asking for a microloan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Mercedes, mi actividad principal es elaboración y venta de tortillas y cafe, cuento con muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Buying corn, coffee, sugar, and woodfire.

loans.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia is from Huarochiri – Lima. She is 49 years old and is a single mother with 4 children. She currently lives in Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” and sells fabrics.

Julia separated from her husband 27 years ago, when her children were young. She began by selling home-made breads from her home. Since that wasn’t enough, she also sold a variety of other things, such as sweets and clothing during the province’s annual patron saint celebrations. She was also a street vendor in Huaraz.

With this income, she was able to educate her children, acting as both father and mother. Eighteen years ago, she began her business selling fabrics. She has faced many difficulties in this business, but she has been able to overcome them and in this way she has been able to get ahead. Her children are now all professionals and they have their own business selling cellular phones.

With her new loan of S./ 1,500.00 (approximately $500.00) from Manuel Ramos, to be paid back in 4 payments, she will buy more fabrics at wholesale price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia es natural de Huarochiri - Lima, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Actualmente vive en Huaraz, en el Departamento de Ancash, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" y se dedica a la venta de telas. Hace 27 años se separó de su esposo, cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, se inició vendiendo panes de casa en casa, como no era suficiente vendía diferentes cosas como golosinas, ropas en las fiestas patronales de la provincia y en Huaraz fue vendedora ambulante. Con estos ingresos pudo educar a sus hijos como padre y madre a la vez, hace como 18 años inició el negocio de las telas, en este recorrido ha tenido muchas dificultades pero pudo superarlas y de esta manera ha salido adelante, en la actualidad todos sus hijos son profesionales y tienen su propio negocio de venta de celulares. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles (US$ 500.00 aprox. ) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará telas al por mayor.

loans.use: To buy fabrics at wholesale price

loans.name: Juny

texts.es:
Juny has her business located in the Central Market, in space #37, in the center of the city of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín. She is a part of the Community Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas”. She began her business two years ago, with a small amount of capital, selling only women’s and men’s underwear from a small wooden table. She now sells a variety of undergarments, polo shirts, baseball caps, and sandals and she is always looking for new inventory for the business. She also now has a vitrine where she exhibits her products.

With a credit of S/.1000.00 (approx. $333.00) she recently received from Manuela Ramos, to be paid back in 4 payments, she will buy more clothing for women, men, and children at wholesale prices. She will also buy 100 sandals in a variety of colors and sizes, and bras and underwear for women, also at wholesale price.

Juny is 23 years old and she has always liked to work. She first worked as an employee in a store much like the one she now owns, where she learned how to run that type of business. With her savings she was able to start her own small business. She feels that she is prospering. She is very happy and in the future she would like to convert her small market stall into a general goods store. She is getting ahead, along with her husband and her 4 year-old son. The good service she provides to her clients and her friends helps to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juny tiene su negocio ubicado en el Mercado central, en el puesto Nº 37, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Tarapoto, provincia y región San Martín, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Virtuosas". Inició su negocio hace dos años, con un pequeño capital, vendiendo sólo ropa interior de damas y caballeros, en una repisa de madera. Actualmente vende ropa interior variada, polos, gorros y sandalias y cada vez está surtiendo mas el negocio, ya tiene vitrina de vidrio donde exhibe su producto. Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 (US$ 333 aprox.) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará más ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niñospor docenas y que están de moda, un ciento sandalias, en variedad de colores y tallas, como también brasier's y trusas interiores para damas, todo esto por docenas. La señora Juny es joven, tiene 23 años y siempre le ha gustado trabajar, primero trabajó como empleada en una tienda como la que ahora tiene, donde aprendió el manejo del mismo y con sus ahorros pudo poner su propio negocio. Siente que está prosperando, está muy contenta y en el futuro desea convertir ese pequeño puesto en un Bazar. Junto con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años sale adelante, el buen trato a sus clientes y sus amistades hacen mejorar la venta.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's, and children's clothing and undergarments. To buy sandals.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Sra. Melida belongs to the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women) community bank in Ucayali, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She's 43 years old and the mother of 2 children.

Melida earns a living making clothes, e.g., shirts, blouses, lingerie, etc. With an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94), she was able to make a down payment on a sewing machine. She and her husband now jointly operate the business, selling her products for both cash and on credit.

With a recently granted loan of S/.1,700 (about US$575) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 6 installments, Melida will be able to maintain her sewing maching and buy raw materials (20 meters of cotton cloth, a dozen spools of thread, a roll of lace and buttons).

She's very happy with her sewing business and that she'll be able to extend credit to those people who can't immediately pay in cash.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Melida pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Trabajadoras", del Jr. César Calvo de Araujo 898 del sector del arenal del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos.

Melida se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como son: polos, blusas, shor's, lencería, etc. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) pudo dar la inicial de una máquina de coser, ahora conjuntamente con su pareja realizan esta actividad donde venden al contado y al crédito con cuotas de pago de S/. 2.00 diarios.

Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700 (US$ 575.00 aprox.), que cancelará en 6 cuotas, podrá dar mantenimiento a la máquina de coser, además podrá comprar 20 metros de telas de algodón, 1 docena de hilos, 1 cono de blondas y un ciento de cierres.

Ella está muy contenta de trabajar en la costura y con la venta poder dar facilidades a aquellas personas que no cuentan con efectivo en ese momento.

loans.use: Buy materials and supplies at wholesale. Pay for upkeep on sewing machine.

loans.name: Precila Enriqueta

texts.es:
Sra. Precila Enriqueta A. R., 38, is from Ancash, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She has a partner and 5 children. She earns a living selling sweets and making and selling "chompas" (traditional knitted sweaters). She sells her products at home and in Chiquian's Plaza de Armas.

Precila is the founder of the "Senor de los Milagros de Chiquian" (Lord of the Miracles of Chiquian) community bank. She started out selling a few sweets from a cart. With loans from Manuela Ramos, her cart is now fully stocked. Along with the sweets business, she makes chompas by hand. With loans and earnings from her sweets business, she has managed to buy a weaving machine which she uses to make chompas, ponchos, shawls and other clothing. With her earnings, she helps her husband with the education of their children and household expenses.

With a recently-granted loan of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles or about US$500), to be repaid in 6 months, Precila will buy stocks of candy for resale and wool to make chompas, shawls and other clothing for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Precila Enriqueta A. R., es del Distrito de Chiquian, Provincia de Bolognesi-Ancash, tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 5 hijos, y se dedica a la venta de golosinas y su otra actividad es la confección y venta de chompas. Sus productos los vende es su domicilio y las golosinas en la esquina de la plaza de armas de Chiquian.

Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian”, se inició vendiendo golosinas en una carreta con pocas golosinas. Con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos hoy su carreta está surtida. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica al tejido de chompas a mano, también con los prestamos y los ingresos de la venta de golosina ha logrado comprar una máquina de tejer y produce chompas, ponchitos, chalinas y otros. Con sus ingresos apoya a su esposo, la educación de sus hijos y los gastos de su hogar

Su reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles (U$ 500 aprox.) que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y lana de tejer para la confección de chompas, chalinas y otros. .

loans.use: Buy candy and sweets for resale and wool for clothing business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Business Description

Carlos started his business five years ago. He sells breakfast, lunch, and fried foods. He attends clients personally every day from 6 to 3.

Loan Use

Carlos needs the loan in order to buy materials and furniture so that he can fix and improve his business. He will also buy the ingredients that he needs in order to make his delicious dishes. This way he can offer a new image and a more diverse menu to his clients.

Personal Information

Carlos is 58 years old. His wife works with him in the business. They have a 16 year old son that is studying. Carlos started his business with his savings. His business is located in his home. He wishes to improve his business and keep on fighting in order to sustain his family with his own work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Carlos inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que vende son: desayunos, almuerzos y fritadas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6-a -3pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Carlos necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales, muebles para arreglar y acondicionar de mejor manera su local. También adquirir productos básicos para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos. De esta manera ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carlos tiene 58 años. Tiene 1 hijo de 16 años que estudia. Con su esposa trabajan juntos en el negocio. Carlos inicio con un pequeño capital ahorrado .Su negocio ocupa parte de su vivienda. Anhela mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando y mantenerse de su propio trabajo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, furniture and ingredients to improve his business

loans.name: Primitiva Beatriz

texts.es:
Sra. Primitiva, 43, is from Ancash, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She's a single mother with 4 children. She belongs to the "Senor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian" (Lord of the Miracles of Chiquian) community bank and earns a living making and selling "alfajores" (a traditional cookie in Peru and other parts of South America). She sells her products from her house and at stores in Chiquian; she also sends 400 to 500 alfajores a week to Lima because she has customers there too. She got started making "manjar blanco" (a caramel-like product that is usually an ingredient of alfajores) and she has 10 years experience at this business.

The business requires a lot of work. She preps until midnight and gets up at 5am to bake the alfajores. It's her daily routine.

The loans that she's received from Manuela Ramos have served to grow her business and, in turn, educate her children. Three are professionals. Thanks to the business, too, she's been able to help one of her daughters, a single mother.

With the recently-granted loan of S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles or about US$267), to be repaid over 6 months, she will buy flour, milk and sugar at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Primitiva, es del Distrito D. Chiquian, Provincia D. Bolognesi -Ancash, tiene 43 años D. edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal "Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian", se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. alfajores, venD. en su domicilio, reparte a las tiendas en Chiquian y envía a Lima una vez por semana D. 400 a 500 alfajores porque tiene clientes. Se inició elaborando Manjar Blanco, tiene 10 años trabajando en su negocio.

Este negocio es bastante sacrificado, amasa hasta las 12 a.m. y a las 5 a.m. se levanta para llevar el producto al horno, es su rutina diaria.

Los préstamos recibidos D. Manuela Ramos le han servido para hacer crecer su negocio y ello le ha permitido educar a sus hijos, 3 son profesionales y una D. sus hijas es madre soltera a la que ayuda gracias a su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/ 800.00 soles (US$ 267.00 aprox.) pagadero en 6 meses, comprará harina, leche y azúcar al por mayor.

loans.use: Buy ingredients (flour, milk and sugar) for baking business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more produce for resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more display cases for breads and sweetbreads.

loans.name: Nodenca

texts.en:
Business Description:

Nodenca started her business 2 years ago. She sells home and kitchen items (pans, knives, plates etc…). She takes order from catalog every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Loan Use:

Nodenca needs the loan to invest in the sale of new products. Her client network is satisfied with her delivery system. She wants to offer a new variety of products and improve the image of her business.

Personal Information:

Nodenca is 34 years old, she has 4 children in school. Her husband is employed as a construction worker. She started her business with a small loaned capital. She works and lives in a wood and cane house. Her goal is to buy a cement house to increase the security of her business and family.

Translated from Spanish by Marc Lanthemann, Princeton University Language Project Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Nodenca inicio su negocio hace 2 años. Los productos que vende son: Artículos para el hogar como: Juegos de Ollas, Juegos de Cuchillos, Ollas Arroceras, Vajillas y otros. Sobre pedido estos los hace a través de cartillas todos los días de la semana desde las 6: AM a 5: PM .

Uso del Préstamo

Nodenca necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más productos nuevos y novedosos. Su clientela esta satisfecha por el cumplimiento de entrega. Por esta razón Nodenca necesita invertir en más mercadería para ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Nodenca tiene 34años. Tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando. Su esposo trabaja como obrero. Nodenca inicio con un pequeño capital prestado .Para su negocio ocupa parte de su casa que es de madera y caña. Su aspiración es llegar construir su casa de cemento para mayor seguridad de su familia y negocio.

loans.use: Investing in newer and more attractive products for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Regina and I'm a business owner. I rely on my income from a small pastry and sweets business located in the center of the city where I live. I have several years experience doing this and it allows me to earn income so that I can contribute to family expenses. I don't have enough credit now to [buy the goods that I need] to meet existing [customer] demand so I'm asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Regina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de reposteria y venta de Golosinas, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me permite generar ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente por lo que solicito el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: Buy flour, eggs, margarine, sugar, soft drinks and instant soups for resell.

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Santos Daniel. I’m a merchant and I have a food and drink shop located in my home called “Pulpería DAYLI.” I have been dedicating myself to this type of activity for several years, and it generates income to cover family expenses. Currently I need to restock the business since the clientele grows each day, but I don’t have sufficient capital for that investment. It is important to mention that this is a family business in view that my wife and my children collaborate with me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Santos Daniel, soy comerciante, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia DAYLI, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir mas el negocio ya que la clientela cada día es mayor y no se cuenta con el capital suficiente para dicha inversión. Es importante mensionar que este es un negocio familiar en vista que mi esposa y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: To buy sugar, butter, oil, flower, eggs, toilet paper and soft drinks

loans.name: Arguello

texts.es:
V. is married and her husband is retired. They have three children - two are married and the third, who is single, helps her in her business. She started her business to help supplement her husband's income, to provide an education for her children and to make house payments. Eleven years ago, she decided to start her business and since then, it has been doing well. As a result, V. has been able to move ahead with her family. She started by selling snacks and refreshments and little by little, she started to increase the number of products she was selling in her store. V. is originally from Tampico, so she also sells seafood, and that has been going well, too. She wishes to continue her business and grow like an entrepreneur.

Virgina is seeking a loan of $1000 to purchase more goods for her store's inventory and to enlarge and make changes to her store's setup, so customers can feel more comfortable. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She is grateful for the support that will help her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

V. esta casada y su esposo es jubilado, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están casados y el último esta soltero, que le ayuda a ella en el negocio. Ella empezó con su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, de la educación de sus hijos y el pago de su casa, fue hace 11 años que ella se decidió a poner su negocio y le ha ido bien con el mismo y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, inició vendiendo botanas y refrescos y poco a poco fue surtiéndose de más cosas y ahora ya tiene surtido su negocio, además de la tienda de abarrotes como ella es originaria de Tampico, también vende mariscos y le va bien también y desea continuar con su negocio y crecimiento como emprendedora.

V. esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,000 para comprar mercadería y a la vez acondicionar su local para poder tener una mejor atención a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su crecimiento en su negocio.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her inventory and to enlarge her store

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.es:
Martha is married and her husband works in the US. She has two sons and dedicates herself mainly to cosmetic sales. She is currently making an incursion in the catalog business to sell shoes. She decided to start her principal business to pay monthly rent and to support her children's education. Eight years ago, another sales person introduced her to the business and since then, she has been selling cosmetics amongst friends and close acquaintances. She has increased her client base and wishes to continue growing.

Martha seeks a loan of $325 for her inventory so she can be ready to satisfy her customers, who are always looking for the newest item in the market. She will repay the loan in 4 months. She is grateful for your support, which will help her to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha esta casada y su esposo trabaja en Los Estados Unidos, tiene dos hijos y ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como su principal negocio incursionando también en la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Decidió poner su negocio para pagar las mensualidades de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos, fue hace 8 años vendiendo a sus amistades, por invitación de una promotora de estos productos y poco a poco se ha incrementado su cartera y esta creciendo con su negocio y desea continuar con ese crecimiento.

Martha esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para surtirse de mercadería de temporada y ofrecer sus productos con éxito a sus clientes que siempre quieren tener novedades, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella te agradece el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda is a Young mother with three children for whom she strives every day to give the best. They have become the motor that drives her life. That is why three years ago she decided to make crochet weavings. She began this work thanks to the push of her best friend and in little time her diligence had granted her quality and excellent finished works. This has permitted her community to recognize her as a great worker and they have called her to weave hats for exportation. Orlanda covers the orders that they make to her to weave which ever article of clothing. Aside from that she weaves jackets made of wool in her free time in order to offer them for sale inside her community in the hopes of generating additional income that would allow an increase in her family’s wellbeing.

She hopes very much to be able to open her own export company of woven hats and to become partners with other women in her community that do the same thing. Like a good mother she wants to offer her children a comfortable life and a suitable education so that they can forge a prosperous future.

As a first step to achieve this goal she has dedicated herself to increase even more the variety of weavings she makes and needs more capital to invest. She is soliciting $100 USD. With your support we can make it so that Orlanda increases the amount of jobs she has and so that she can realize her children’s dreams at home.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Orlanda es una joven madre de 3 hijos por quienes se esfuerza cada día para darles lo mejor de si, ellos se han convertido en el motor que impulsa su vida, por esa razón hace tres años se dedica a realizar tejidos a crochet; se incorporó a esta labor gracias al impulso de su mejor amiga y en poco tiempo su diligencia le ha otorgado calidad y excelentes acabados a sus trabajos. Esto le ha permitido el reconocimiento de su comunidad como una buena tejedora y la han llamado para tejer chullos de exportación. Orlanda cubre los pedidos que le hacen para tejer cualquier prenda de vestir, a parte de ello se dedica a tejer chompas de lana en sus momentos libres para ofrecerlos dentro de su comunidad con el fin de generar un ingreso adicional que le permita incrementar el bienestar de su familia.

Desea con todas sus fuerzas poder abrir su propia empresa de exportación de gorros tejidos y asociarse con otras señoras de su comunidad que se dediquen también a esta labor con el propósito de conseguir un espacio directo de exportación. Como buena madre quiere ofrecerles una vida cómoda y una adecuada educación a sus hijos a fin de que puedan forjarse un próspero futuro.

Como primer paso para conseguir este propósito ha decidido incrementar aún más la variedad de los tejidos que realiza y necesita un capital de inversión, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares. Con tu apoyo podremos hacer que Orlanda incremente sus trabajos y fabrique en su hogar los sueños de sus pequeños

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to increase her production.

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Mirna Yolanda and I have a small business selling new clothing. I work as a street vendor, selling my clothes in the neighborhood. I've been working at this business for several years. The great thing is that I can both earn an income and look after my family because this business allows me to arrange my schedule around the family. Because the approaching months are the best for my sales, I need to stock a little extra so that I can offer my clients a range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Mirna Yolanda, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa l nueva la que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad, lo mas importante es que puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, ya este negocio me permite programar las diferentes actividades familiares. Tomando en cuena que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta, necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy underwear, sandals, blouses, men's pants and other goods for resell.

loans.name: Marlon Francisco

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Marlon and I'm a micro-business owner. I rely on my income from a small pastry shop in the center of the city where I live. I have several years of experience at this and the business generates income for my family and other commitments. Thanks to this business, our children can go to school and, in their spare time, do other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Marlon, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una micro empresa de reposteria, ubicada en el Centro de mi Ciudad, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. Gracias a este negocio nuestros hijos pueden estudiar y tambien colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Buy sugar, flour, eggs, margarine, butter and packing materials for pastry business.

loans.name: Doris Milagros

texts.es:
Ten years ago, Doris realized that she needed to open her own business. Working out of her small home she started a small store offering various basic necessities. Her client base and sales increase daily thanks to her dedication and friendly service. The income generated is a source of great personal satisfaction and helps to fully meet the basic necessities of her home.

Dora´s wish is to make the store a more comfortable place to shop with a greater variety of products. This will help her increase sales and improve her family´s quality of life.

Let´s support the initiative of this hard working housewife.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Doris vio la necesidad de forjar su propio espacio productivo, hace 10 años y es así que apertura su pequeña bodega en las instalaciones de su casita y le puso “La Confianza”. Cada día adquiere nuevos clientes gracias a la dedicación que pone en la atención y a la calidez del trato que ofrece le garantiza su pronto retorno para adquirir sus productos, los ingresos que recibe con su pequeño negocio la llenan de satisfacción y gracias al ingreso que percibe puede satisfacer plenamente las necesidades de su hogar.Su anhelo es hacer de este pequeño espacio un lugar más cómodo y acogedor para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas diarias y la calidad de vida de su familia.Apoyemos la iniciativa de esta diligente reina del hogar..

loans.use: Store refurbishment

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Reyna Cristina, I’m a merchant, and my principle activity is the sale of new clothes. I have a business located in the city center named “Cristy” Varieties. I have a lot of experience in the business. I am a single mother and thanks to the income I receive from the business I have succeeded in helping my family get ahead. Taking into account that the heavy sales season is approaching, I need to supply my business and right now I do not have the capital to make such an investment. Therefore, I am asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Reyna Cristina, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva, tengo un negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad llamado Variedades "CRISTY", cuento con mucha experiencia en este negocio. soy madre soltera y gracias a los ingresos que persivo de este negocio he logrado sacar adelante a mi familia. Tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la temporada de mayor venta necesito surtir un poco mi negocio y en estos momentos no cuento con el capital para tal inversión por lo que solicito el apoyo de ustedes

loans.use: To purchase pants, tennis shoes, women's sandals, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ramona and I make and sell hamburgers. I have a small business named "Paradise Burger" in one of the busiest areas of my town. I have a good customer base and experience in this sort of activity which allows me to generate profits to help support my family. Currently, demand has gone up and I do not have enough capital to cover it, and that is the reason why I am asking for you support.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombres es Ramona, mi actividad principal es la elaboracíón y venta de Amburguesas, cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en uno de los lugares mas transitados de mi ciudad. llamado "PARADISE "BURGER", cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad. El que me permite generar ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia. actualmente la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela existente, razon por la cual solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy meat, sodas, oil, and disposable items

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is an active member of Life in Africa Foundation. She is a widow who is raising six children on her own. Originally she lived in the north but she was forced to flee her home because of the war in 1998. She settled in Kampala in the IDP camp known as the Acholi Quarters and she is still there after all this time.

Juliana works very hard to provide for her children She labors in the rock quarry and she also participates in the Life in Africa Foundation bead-making program. Becoming a member of LiA has made life much easier for her and her orphan children. Three are in school and their school fees are always a big challenge to meet. Her income is just never enough to provide all that they need.

Juliana has a lot of experience in the rock quarry and if she starts her own small business instead of working for someone else, her income will increase. She could easily show a profit each month of 150,000 Uganda Shillings (symbol: /=) or about US$ 87 which would allow her children to continue in school.

To accomplish this Juliana is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) to cover the expenses and labor involved in starting up this business. Juliana feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget:

Extraction..3 trips.................90,000/=

Breaking............................20, 000/=

Carrying out from the pit...........30,000/=

Cracking into smaller pieces........96, 000/=

Emergency ..........................14,000/=

Total..................................250,000/= (US$ 150)

loans.use: paying labour

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a responsible and committed widow. She came to Kampala in 1996 when she was forced to flee the rebels in the north. She settled in an IDP camp called the Acholi Quarters and she is still there.

Hellen is a hard worker and she does not just sit and wait for help but she is constantly moving and working to make ends meet. She mostly labors in the stone quarry but she has also become a member of Life in Africa Foundation and is active in the bead-making program. This has really improved her life but things like rent, school fees, and food are still a challenge each month.

Hellen would like to increase her monthly income by running her own stone quarry business. She has experience in this work and she is confident she can earn 150,000/= (about US$ 87; symbol means Uganda Shillings here) each month. To accomplish this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) and she feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget:

Extraction, 3 trips……………………………………………….. 90,000/=

Breaking………………………………………………………….........20, 000/=

Carrying out from the pit…………………………. ……………30,000/=

Cracking into smaller pieces …………………………………….96, 000/=

Emergency ………………………………………………………..........14,000/=

Total ...................................250,000/= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Paying labour

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is a married woman with two children. She is Acholi by tribe and is aged 38 years. She left Northern Uganda ten years back due to rebel activities that claimed many lives and left thousands homeless. Alice believes that if she did not flee and take refugee in Acholi quarters Kampala, she would have fallen prey to the Joseph Kony war!

After arriving in Kampala, life was not easy. Alice had no money for food or other needs so she turned to the stone quarry to eke out a living. Then she joined Life in Africa Foundation and that softened her life. When she joined the LiA community, there were many handicraft activities such as paper bead bracelets, banana fireballs, and baskets among others. These helped her so much to earn a better living than ever before.

Life in Africa’s partnership with Kiva to give loans became very significant to Alice. She is a good business woman and works very hard. With her own small savings, three years ago Alice opened a local bar in Acholi quarters that she started with one crate of beer and one crate of soda. The bar has gained popularity with enough customers and there is a need for an increase in stock and expansion of the bar.

To achieve this expansion of her business, Alice is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150; the symbol /= means Uganda shillings here). She feels certain she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her breakdown:

Extending a shade ……………………………….50, 000/=

Buying 15 crates of empty beer bottles @ 5000/= each………75.000/=

Buying 4 crates of beer ……………..115200/=

Drinking straws ………………………………….8000/=

Diverse ……………………………………………1800/=

Total………………………………250,000/= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Restocking a bar

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine L. is a Ugandan by nationality, an Acholi by tribe, and is 38 years of age. She is a married woman with four children. L. and her family left Gulu because of the war that was in the north. It was so terrible to the extent that it took so many people's lives. In 1998, L. and her family fled to Kampala and settled on the land (the Acholi Quarters) which was offered to them by the King of Buganda to settle on since he had sympathy for the people of northern Uganda.

When Christine settled in the camp, she began to work in the stone quarry to earn some income. From the stone quarry, she was earning 1000 /= (about 60 cents; the symbol /= here stands for Uganda shillings) per day. As time went on, she worked even harder and was able to earn 2000 Uganda shillings (about US$ 1.20) per day. This is how much she is still earning now, which makes her earn 60,000 shillings (about US$ 35) per month.

In 2005, Christine joined Life in Africa Foundation where she learned how to make paper beads and started to earn 60,000 to 100,000 shillings most months. L. used her earnings to start a small business that she runs by herself where she sells things like tomatoes, cabbages, green vegetables, and onions. She does well but with a large family she needs to increase her income to provide for their needs.

Christine's plan is to add capital to expand her business. Demand is high but she needs to add stock to meet this demand. She also wants to add sim sim (sesame seeds, a Ugandan staple food) and charcoal to her inventory which will further increase her profits. To do this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 150). She will earn a good profit on this investment, around 110,000 to 130,000/= each month and feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 4 months.

Below is how Christine is going to use the 250,000 shillings: -

Buying cabbages…………………..40,000/=

Onions……………………..10,000/=

Tomatoes…………………..30,000/=

Green vegetables…………………30,000/=

Transport for the month……30,000/=

Sim-sim for………………...110,000/=

Total…………………………….250,000/= (US$ 150)

loans.use: expanding her little grocery store

loans.name: Filda

texts.en:
Filda A. is an active member of Life in Africa Foundation. She is originally from Northern Uganda but was forced to leave her home due to Kony's insurgency. She is a married woman aged 45 with seven children, and they all live in the IDP camp in Kampala known as the Acholi Quarters.

Filda is working in a stone quarry where she earns just enough money to sustain her family but this is not really enough to support seven children. Filda has a good plan to start a business buying and selling groundnuts (peanuts). They are a favorite of Acholis and are always in high demand. She plans to grind some and sell some whole to those who may need them. She expects a profit of 50,000/= (the symbol /= means Uganda shillings here; about US $ 28) per month.

To start up this business Filda is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150). Once given this loan, she feels sure she will be able to repay it in 6 months.

Below is her breakdown:

200 kilograms of groundnuts ……………….200, 000/=

Transport……………………………………….20, 000/=

Grinding…………………………………………30,000/=

Total……………………………………………..250,000/=

loans.use: Buying and selling groundnuts (peanuts)

loans.name: Talele

texts.en:
Talele is a hard-worker who owns one acre of freehold property, which she has invested in by growing taro and banana. This is her only source of income to support her three-member family, and must work full-time at her plantation.

She is able to sell two sacks of taro and 32 bunches of bananas every Monday at the Fugalei market, which earns her a total profit of $140 USD.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, tools , knives, cement, and timber.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex O. is Ugandan by nationality, an Acholi by tribe, and 34 years old. He is married and with his wife, he has five children. Three of them go to school and two are still at home.

In1998, Alex left his village in Acholibur division located in the Pader district because of the danger of the war. He settled at the IDP camp called the Acholi Quarters where he is still staying up to now. While in the quarters, Alex worked in the stone quarry from which he earned some money for himself and his family. Though he was earning some money from the quarry, life was not easy at all. There were a lot of demands in his family and life became nothing but a struggle to earn money so that he can help the family survive.

In 2007, Alex joined Life in Africa Foundation and worked as a guard/watch man. He was immediately put on the salary scale and began earning 90,000/= (90,000 Uganda shillings is about US$ 50) as his salary at every end of the month. Just like a thirsty man in the desert who finds an oasis, Alex’s life became better than it had been in years.

Alex has a good plan for beginning a business selling second-hand clothes in his village. The clothes are in high demand and he is confident that the business will be a success but he lacks the capital to start it up. He heard about Kiva at Life in Africa Foundation and is so excited that his dream may come true. With the money he earns from this business he will be able to send his other two children to school.

Alex is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (about US$ 150). He feels sure he will be able to repay this loan in 5 months.

Below is his budget for the 250,000/=

-Buy a bale of second-hand clothes at 150,000/=

-Transporting of this bale to the place of sale…..60,000/=

-Paying tax in the market place to allow him to sell….20,000/=

-Emergency …………………………………………20,000/=

-Total……………………………………………………250/000/=

loans.use: Buying a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
