Nelly esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado y el sueldo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue por ello que Nelly se decidió a ayudar a su esposo con los gastos poniendo su negocio de venta de cosméticos, empezando haciendo demostraciones de sus productos en mercados y en su casa, luego paso casa por casa demostrando sus productos y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes que ahora ya son muchos de ellos fijos y tiene varios pedidos seguros todos los meses, ella desea continuar con su negocio.

Nelly está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para surtir los pedidos que tiene pendiente y comprar mercadería para continuar haciendo demostraciones y obtener mayores ingresos para su hogar, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Le agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchanidise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia is married and has two children. Her husband works in a shop as a solder. She worked selling food to help her husband with the household expenses, and so she started in her house, selling hamburgers at night, and now she also sells tacos in the morning and home-style meals. With this, her clients have increased and she has a very good group of regular clients, since she is highly recommended because her food is very tasty. She wants to continue her business and expand it to offer a better service to her clients.

Leticia is requesting a loan for USD $650 to invest in remodeling her food stand and expand it, because in the rainy season it is uncomfortable for her clients go to her food stand. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She thanks you for the support you give her to grow with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Leticia es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en un taller como soldador, ella se dedico a la venta de comida para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar , así ella empezó en su casa vendiendo hamburguesas por las noches y ahora en las mañanas vende tacos de harina y comidas caseras, y ya con esto sus clientes se han incrementado y tiene una buena cartera de clientes fijos ya que es recomendada por que hace muy ricas sus comidas y desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Leticia esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 650 para invertirlo en la remodelación de su local y ampliación por que en épocas de lluvia es muy incomodo para sus clientes ir a su puesto de comidas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Business remodel and expansion.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is a single mother. She lives with her two children, who are students in a small education center in their city. She decided to begin her business work outside her own home. Noticing the business opportunity offered by the location in front of the health clinic, she did not hesitate in moving her food sales to that space. In little time she was sought by a large number of people who daily go to the health clinic to receive medical attention to alleviate their problems. The delicious dishes she prepares and sells since very early in the day have become a favorite of many of the people who visit that place until the afternoon. This drove her to buy a tent to protect herself from the hot sun and also to offer comfort to her clients. In addition, she can count with the support of her children in giving attention to her clients in the busiest times. She requests US$ 350 to buy a new tent, kitchen utensils and products to prepare her dishes, which will allow her to increase the quantity and variety of dishes she offers daily. Let's make it possible for this hardworking mother to continue cooking her excellent dishes and decorating each one of them with her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Mónica es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales están cursando estudios en un pequeño centro educativo de su ciudad.Decidió empezar su labor comercializadora en las afueras de su hogar y observando la oportunidad de negocio que se presentaba en el frontis de la posta de salud no dudó en trasladar su espacio de ventas hasta este espacio.En poco tiempo tuvo acogida del inmenso número de personas que acude a diario para recibir distintas atenciones con el propósito de contrarrestar sus males. Las exquisitas viandas que prepara y vende desde muy temprano se han convertido en las favoritas de muchas personas que transitan a diario por ahí hasta pasado el medio día, hecho que la condujo a comprar una carpa para poder protegerse del fuerte sol y también para brindar comodidad a sus clientes, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la atención al público, en los momentos de mayor afluencia de comensales. Solicita la suma de 350 dólares para adquirir una nueva carpa, utensilios de cocina y productos para la elaboración de viandas esto le permitirá incrementar la cantidad y variedad de platos que ofrece a diario.Hagamos que esta diligente madre siga cocinando excelentes platos y adorne cada uno de los mismos con los sueños de su familia.

loans.use: Buying a tent, cooking utensils and materials.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus lives with her partner and have two children. She has a 9 year girl and a 3 year old boy. Her husband works as a truck driver but his income is not enough so she decided to help him with the family expenses. With her work they have been able to pay for a small house. She wishes to continue working to have some income because her kids are growing as well as the expenses. Maria wants her kids to have a good education. She started her business 15 years ago and her first customers were her neighbors, family and friends.

Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for $475.00 to buy raw material and fullfill her customers tailoring orders. This money will help her increase her customer base while at the same time she will be able to deliver her work on time. She will be repaying the loan in six months. Maria and her family appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

María de Jesús vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen dos pequeños hijos una mujercita de 9 años de edad y un niño de 3 años de edad, su pareja trabaja como chofer de camión, y sus ingresos no son muy elevados por lo que ella decidió ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, con su trabajo y el de su pareja han podido salir adelante poco a poco y ahora están pagando una pequeña casa que adquirieron, pero desea continuar trabajando para poder tener ingresos ya que sus niños están creciendo y los gastos también para poder darles una buena educación. Ella empezó hace 15 años atrás y sus primeros clientes son sus vecinos, amistades y familiares.

María de Jesús esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 475 para comprar materia prima y poder cubrir los pedidos de confección de ropa que le hacen sus clientes y así poder incrementar su cartera por hacer buenos trabajos y a tiempo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que les das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Raw material Purchase

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna is loving father and mother to her three minor children. She is a very hardworking woman who has been able to succeed in spite of the many difficulties she has gone through. She currently works selling special bread products (made with milk and eggs), offering them while walking through the busiest streets of her city. In her free time, she works washing clothes in her small home, which allows her to earn an additional income to support her family. She lives in a rental room, and her greatest wish is to have her own bakery. She is aware that achieving that goal requires a large investment, and with this goal she has decided to save money and work even harder. For now, she wants to increase the amount of raw material she uses to make her products with the objective of generating larger income so that in little time her dreams can come true. Her request is for US $275, money she will invest entirely in her business and which she commits herself to repay within six months. Let’s make it possible for this noble mother to, through her work, make the dreams of her beloved children special.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteers.

Giovanna es padre y madre amorosa de sus tres hijos menores, es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha sabido sobresalir pese a las dificultades que tuvo que pasar; actualmente se dedica a vender panes especiales (con leche y huevo) en forma ambulatoria en las calles más concurridas de su ciudad y en sus horas libres se dedica a lavar ropa en su pequeña morada, este último oficio le genera un ingreso económico adicional para el sustento de su familia. Vive en una habitación alquilada y el anhelo más grande que tiene es poseer su propia panadería. Así mismo es consciente que para cumplir su objetivo requiere de una gran inversión, para lograr este propósito se ha propuesto ahorrar y esforzarse mucho más; por el momento desea aumentar la cantidad de materia prima que utiliza para la elaboración de sus productos a fin de generar mayores ingresos para que en poco tiempo haga realidad sus sueños. Su solicitud es por un monto de 275 dólares dinero que invertirá totalmente en su negocio, y se compromete hacer la devolución en un lapso de seis meses.Hagamos posibles que esta noble madre a través de su ocupación también pueda hacer especiales los sueños de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Buying materials to make bread

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
A few years ago, Irma suffered the loss of her life partner, her husband, which caused her much pain and grief. Since then her only goal was to succeed and secure the wellbeing her four minor children. Currently she owns a small general store in her humble home, in which she offers basic products. Additionally, she sells breakfast in her home's patio. This last activity is very satisfactory because it provides more money to enhance her family's quality of life. Her nearest wish is to expand her small sales stand and to increase the variety of products she carries, with the goal of offering a better service and satisfying the needs of her regular clients. With the money she will obtain after her investment she will be able to improve her beloved children's quality of life even more.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Hace algunos años Irma sufrió la pérdida de su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo, hecho que le causó mucho dolor y aflicción, desde entonces tuvo un único objetivo salir adelante y procurarles bienestar a sus cuatro hijos menores.Actualmente tiene una bodeguita ubicada en su humilde domicilio en el que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de desayunos en el patio de su casa, ésta última labor le genera mucha satisfacción debido a que le genera sumas adicionales de dinero para incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.El deseo más próximo es ampliar su pequeño espacio de ventas e incrementar mucho más la variedad de sus productos, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus asiduos clientes. Con el dinero que obtenga luego de su inversión podrá acrecentar aún más el nivel de vida de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
The relentless pursuit of a way to improve her family´s quality of life made Estela dedicate herself to the purchase and sale of second hand goods. At first this business was very profitable but after an economic crisis she lost all her inventory.

Now with even greater perseverance, self-sacrifice and very long walks though the village, Estela is sellling Omnilife products door to door. In a very short time she has generated very good sales which have allowed her to have greater economic stability to be able to take care of her two young children.

Estela currently has many orders but is unable to purchase stock as she does not have enough working capital. This is why she is requesting a business loan of $400 which will help her purchase stock and improve her business. Your generosity and support can help Estela accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

La constancia y perseverancia por buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, hicieron que Estela se dedicara a la compra y venta de artefactos usados, este negocio en un principio era muy rentable, pero desafortunadamente sufrió una crisis económica y perdió toda su mercadería.Ahora con mucho más empeño, sacrificio y horas interminables de caminata se dedicada a vender productos nutrientes de la prestigiosa marca Omnilife en forma ambulatoria, en poco tiempo esta actividad le ha generado muy buenos ingresos económicos con el que le ha permitido brindar estabilidad económica a sus dos hijos menores.Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para cumplir y satisfacer a sus clientes, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares, dinero que utilizará para acrecentar su capital y mejorar su negocio.“Tú generosidad y desinteresado apoyo puede ayudar a Estela a hacer realidad sus sueños”

loans.use: Purchase of high nutrient procucts to increase sales.

loans.name: Pupu

texts.en:
Pupu is a 47 year-old lady, married, and has four kids. She is very talented in sewing different types of patterns and clothes. She takes orders from shops in town, flea markets, and other people who frequent her business.

Her first loan of $300 USD was used to buy the materials, threads and needles for her business. She works six days per week and takes Sundays off, however, if she is busy then she will work nights as well.

She hopes that her next loan will be used to improve her business so that she can maintain a good flow of customers. She is very thankful for the financial support she has received from SPBD through its loans, because without them, she could not continue her business. She wishes be a part of the program for a long time and receive further loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools needed for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Marlene

texts.es:
Miss Claudia is a diligent and noble mother even though she has faced adversity and has suffered a lot. She learned to overcome those adversities thanks to her integrity and the strength that she has for the well being of her little children. Unfortunately, four years ago she lost her husband and since then she started her own business selling second hand clothes to the towns near by Juliaca, the city she lives in. This business is allowing her to offer her familily with fianancial security and education. Claudia wants to buy more used clothes to increase her stock of clothing and to be able to do this she needs a $400 dollar loan to make her wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Claudia, es una diligente y noble madre de familia que pese a las adversidades y sufrimientos que tuvo que pasar en su vida, aprendió a sobrellevarlas gracias a la entereza y fuerza que la caracteriza para bienestar de sus pequeños niños. Hace cuatro años desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo y desde entonces decidió incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropas de segundo uso en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad en la que vive, Juliaca, este negocio le está permitiendo brindar educación y estabilidad económica a su familia.Anhela comprar más fardos de ropa usada, para aumentar el stock de sus prendas de vestir y para esto esta solicitando un préstamo de 400 dólares, dinero con el que podrá hacer realidad sus deseos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Until recently, Lidia´s family lived in harmony, peace and tranquility. Her husband´s death was a tragic blow to her family and a void which has left her alone to raise two young children. Her children have become her life driving force.

Since she started her family, Lidia has dedicated herself to selling snacks from a vendor cart that her ill-fated husband lovingly built to help them generate greater income for the family. After the loss of her husband she has been increasing the variety of her product range but has been unable to increase the space on her cart as the money she generated was quickly spent on basic necessities.

Lidia is seeking a business loan of $350 to refurbish her vendor cart to display more stock and generate greater ecomomic benefits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

En la familia de doña Lidia hasta hace poco se vivía un ambiente de paz, tranquilidad y unión familiar, pero desafortunadamente esa felicidad y unión se frustró con la muerte de su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo, quién se fue dejando un gran vacío en la familia de Lidia, desde entonces quedó sola al cuidado de sus 2 hijos menores los cuales se han convertido en el motor que impulsa su vida.Desde que formó su familia, se dedicó a la venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, en una carretita que su esposo cuidadosamente acondicionó para que pueda ofrecer sus productos y así generar ingresos económicos para su hogar. Durante mucho tiempo después de la pérdida de su compañero ha ido incrementando sus productos poco a poco sin embargo no ha podido implementar sus espacio debido a que las ganancias han estado destinadas a la compra de artículos de primera necesidad.Solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para adecuar su espacio de ventas y generar mayores beneficios económicos en pro de su familia.

loans.use: Refurbishment of sales cart

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en:
Koleti loves planting and eating vegetables, which is why she is interested in running a vegetable garden business. She is 36-years-old, a mother of three kids, and is separated from her husband.

She started off with a loan of $300 USD, which was spent on buying chemicals for garden maintenance, as well as vegetable seeds for planting her crops. She works really hard, because this is her only source of income for her family needs, especially her children's school fees. Even though she feels exhausted sometimes, she remains strong. She knows that her family needs her. She is very happy for the financial support from SPBD’s loan program.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and chemicals needed for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nin chose fishing as her business because her husband is highly skilled at fishing. Her $700 USD loan was used to replace all of their fishing gears, such as the spears, goggles, fishing nets, and canoe. Her husband does the fishing and she sells the catch at the village and sometimes at the fish market.

She makes close to $160 USD every week from this business, but it falls to $80 per week if the weather is bad. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair their house and to help their kids who are currently living overseas.

loans.use: To buy fishing gears and a new canoe.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 33-years-old, married, and has two children. She received her first loan of $300 USD which was used to buy the necessary ingredients for her ice-cake business. These ingredients include sugar and plastic bags. She sells her products at the nearby school, in her village, and at the local bingo games.

She is hoping to receive another loan to buy a bigger freezer than the one she has now. The earnings from her business is very helpful in helping her family meet its daily needs. She plans to continue her business and keep working hard at it.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake selling business

loans.name: Simealai

texts.en:
Simealai is a 43-year-old, married woman with four kids. She believes that her plantation business is fairly easy to run, and is also interesting to her and the family. None of her family members has received a good education or been able to get jobs. Thus, this is their only source of income.

She started with her first loan of $300 USD and used it to buy the chemicals and tools needed to start her plantation. She hopes that her next loan will help out in improving her plantation but will also go towards her kids’ school fees. She is very glad for the financial support from the loans.

loans.use: To buy tools necessary to run her plantation

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai is a lady of 42 years old, married with three children. She is a very active and a reliable mother who works hard to support her family. Her first loan was for $300 USD and it was used to buy the tools needed for starting her plantation.

She is very happy with her business because the earnings help greatly with the family’s daily needs, and especially her children's schooling costs. She will be very happy to receive more loans in the future, which will allow her to continue to support her family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools necessary for the maintenance of her plantation

loans.name: Lavaniu

texts.en:
Lavaniu is a young, single mother from the village of Elise Fou. She runs her own small elei printing business that provides her with a source of income for her family.

This will be her third loan from SPBD, which will further assist her with her business as she needs the income to support her two children and to help with family commitments. Lavaniu supplies her products to a few outlets in town and also has a market stall at her village. She is grateful for the assistance from SPBD for bringing her thus far.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business and for her home improvement.

loans.name: Achmad Nur Khotib

texts.id:
Achmad lives with his wife. They reside in a lease home at a monthly rent of Rp 120.000 (about USD13). He sells fruits in the surrounding area. Everyday he requires working capital of Rp 500.000 (USD55), which can only fund the purchase of 2 types of fruits. His daily profit from this is Rp 50.000 (USD6). He sells the fruits using a modified motorcycle. From this loan, he will be able to increase his business by adding more varieties of fruits. Hopefully, his daily profit will increase to Rp 75.000 (USD8). He purchases the fruits at wholesale thus requiring more capital.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Achmad tinggal bersama isterinya. Mereka tinggal di rumah kontrakkan dengan nilai sewa Rp 120.000,00/bulan. Achmad memiliki usaha jual buah keliling. Setiap hari dia membutuhkan modal Rp 500.000,00/hari. Modal sejumlah itu hanya dapat dia gunakan untuk membeli 2 macam buah. Keuntungan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 50.000,00/hari. Sarana yang digunakan berupa sepeda motor yang sedikit dimodifikasi. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan digunakan untuk menambah jumlah dagangan dengan buah yang lebih beraneka macam. Harapannya, keuntungan yang dia peroleh menjadi Rp 75.000,00/hari. Buah yang dia beli di pasar dalam bentuk grosir. Hal ini untuk menekan jumlah modal yang dia keluarkan.

loans.use: Increase business by adding more varieties of fruits (Menambah jumlah dagangan dengan buah yang lebih beraneka macam)

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.ru:
Alfiya, 43, is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband earns enough to provide for the family, but Alfiya does not want to sit home, so she sells women’s clothing and underwear on the market. In 2003, she received her first MicroInvest loan. The money helped Alfiya expand and develop her business. Recently, she occupied a small store. Alfiya plans to use this loan to purchase warm dressing gowns.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Альфие 43 года, она замужем, у нее дочь и сын. Ее муж зарабатывает достаточно для проживания семьи, но Альфия не хочет сидеть дома без дела и поэтому выходит на базар торговать. В ассортименте ее товаров женские халаты и нижнее белье. В Микроинвест первый займ получила в 2003 году. Займы помогли ей расшириться и внесли изменения в ее бизнес. Недавно она совместно с администрацией базара оборудовала маленький магазинчик. С новым займ она собирается обновить ассортимент теплых халатов.

loans.use: To purchase warm dressing gowns

loans.name: Hairiniso

texts.ru:
Hairiniso, 55, has been in business for a few years. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works for the state. Hairiniso’s older son and daughter help her in business. Hairiniso buys her inventory from a wholesaler in Istaravshan. Hairiniso increased the sales volume a few times over the 3 years that she has been a MicroInvest client. She plans to invest this loan into ongoing expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайринисо 55 лет, но, несмотря на свой возраст, она уже несколько лет занимается бизнесом. Хайринисо замужем и у нее 4 детей. Муж тоже работает на государственной службе. В бизнесе ей помогают старшие сын и дочь. За товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок г. Истаравшан. Клиентом Микроинвест является 3 года. за этот период обороты ее бизнеса возросли в несколько раз. Хайринисо планирует получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru:
Dildora, 30, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. Over the last few years, Dildora has been engaged in business. She sells clothing and shoes for women. Dildora established a stable business with many regular clients. Dildora’s earnings provide a stable supplement to her family income. In 2003, Dildora received her first MicroInvest loan. Since then, she has been an active MicroInvest client. Dildora plans to use this loan to refresh her store inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Дилдоре 30 лет, она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. В последние несколько лет Дилдора занимается бизнесом – продает женскую одежду и обувь. Несмотря на возраст она уже имеет стабильный бизнес с постоянными клиентами. К тому же он приносит стабильную прибавку к семейному бюджету. В Микроинвест первый займ получила в 2003 г. С тех пор является активной его клиенткой. С новым займом она планирует обновить свой ассортимент.

loans.use: To refresh inventory

loans.name: Muhaie

texts.ru:
Muhaie is 35 years old, she is married and has 3 sons. Muhaie is one of the first clients of MicroInvest. Back then she sold children’s clothing and footwear. The profits from that business were not large enough and she decided to go to Russia to earn money. She returned after one year and again started a business, this time selling food. She also returned to borrowing from MicroInvest. Muhaie’s eldest son helps her in her trade. The newly restored business brings her normal profits for supporting her family.

Muhaie will use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мухайе 35 лет, она замужем, имеет 3 сыновей. Мухайе является одной из первых клиенток Микроинвест. Тогда она продавала детскую одежду и обувь. Прибыли от бизнеса было недостаточно и она решила выехать на заработки в Россию. Через год она вернулась и опять занялась бизнесом и перешла на торговлю продуктами питания. Также она возобновила получение займов в Микроинвест. В торговле ей помогает ее старший сын. Вновь налаженный бизнес приносит ей нормальную прибыль для содержания семьи. Новый займ она потратит на дальнейшее его расширение.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru:
Maruf I. is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. Maruf’s wife helps him in the business and the children are in school. Maruf has been selling food for 15 years now. From a young age he helped his mother in her business and gained experience. When he found out about MicroInvest, Maruf decided to take out a loan and increased his inventory. After getting and fully using a loan he expanded his product offering and expanded his place of business.

Maruf plans to use the new loan to open an additional business location, where his wife will handle the sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Исмоилов Маъруфчон 35лет, женат, имеет троих детей. Жена помогает мужу в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Маъруфчон занимается продажей продуктов питания, вот уже 15лет. С малых лет он помогал, матери в торговле и этим набрал опыт. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» он решил получить займ и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. После получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил ассортимент товара, расширил место деятельности. В дальнейшем планирует открыть ещё одно место для торговли, где будет торговать его жена.

loans.use: to open a new business location for his wife

loans.name: Halimboy

texts.ru:
Halimboy makes products from tin and iron. His products have a steady demand and bring good profits. His business is divided into several parts. In addition to selling in Spitamen, he also sells in Mastchoh’s market. In addition, Halimboy’s daughter sells clothing at the clothing market.

Halimboy is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children. He is asking for a new loan. He plans on using a large part of the loan for purchasing raw materials for the production of tin pipes, and the rest to expand his daughter’s business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимбой занимается производством изделий из жести и железа. Его продукция пользуется стабильным спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль. Его бизнес разделен на несколько частей. Кроме Спитамена он торгует и на рынке Мастчох. Также дополнительно к этому его дочь торгует на вещевом рынке одеждой. Халимбою 46 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Халимбой планирует получить новый займ. Большую часть он потратит на приобретение сырья для производства жестяных труб, а остальное на расширение бизнеса дочери.

loans.use: Raw materials for tin pipes and funding for expansion of clothing business

loans.name: Mehrijon

texts.ru:
Mehrijon sells traditional Tajik bread at the central market of Kanibadam. She purchases the bread wholesale at the same market and then sells it individually. This helps Mehrijon to support her family budget. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. With the help of loans from MicroInvest she has increased the productivity of her business.

Mehrijon plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мехричон занимается продажей таджикского национального хлеба на центральном рынке г. Канибадам. Покупает она его оптом здесь же и потом продает в розницу. Это помогает ей поддержать свой семейный бюджет. Мехричон 45 лет, она замужем и имеет 5 детей. С помощью займов Микроинвест увеличила оборот своего бизнеса. Мехричон и дальше собирается получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat is 42 years old. She is married, has 3 children, and has a college education. She has been selling women’s coats for 6 years. Her husband is also a trader and their eldest son helps them in trading. Latofat started her business by selling women’s jackets. After several loans she transitioned to selling women’s coats. Her assets have doubled. Latofat plans on using this loan to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Атохочаева Латофат-42лет. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование высшее. Занимается торговлей женскими пальто, вот уже 6лет. Муж занимается торговлей, старший сын помогает в торговли. Начала свою деятельность с продажи женских пиджаков. После неоднократного получения займа она перешла на продажу женских пальто. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза, в дальнейшем она планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to transition to wholesale sales

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru:
Abdusattor has been selling fresh, tasty fruits for 4 years now. He is married, has 5 children and a college education. He started this particular business because he likes fruits very much.

In 2005, Abdusattor decided to get a loan from MicroInvest, which amounted to $100, and thereby to increase his product selection. After getting the loan and using it fully he increased his inventory and acquired many customers. His assets have doubled. In the future, Abdusattor plans to import products from neighboring countries.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Чалилов Абдусаттор занимается торговлей свежими вкусными фруктами, вот уже 4года. Женат, имеет пятерых детей, образование высшее. Начал заниматься этим видом торговли, поскольку сам очень любит фрукты. В 2005 году решил получить займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда он получил займ в размере 100$, и тем самым увеличить ассортимент товара. После получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил наименования товара, приобрел много клиентов. Сейчас его активы возросли в два раза больше. На будущее он планирует привозить товар с соседних стран.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Elisa is single. She lives in the city of Inhambe, capital of the province. Elisa joined the program in 2006. She doesn't have children but lives with her nephews. She sells baskets, hats, wood spoons made of straw in the central market. Her business is growing. With the income from the business she pays for her nephews' school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa e solteira e nao tem filhos.Ela vive na cidade de Inhambane,capital da Provincia com o mesmo nome.Elisa entrou para o Programa de crediro em 2006. Embora nao tenha filhos ela vive com os seus sobrinhos. Ela vende cestos, chapeus, carteiras, colheres de pau, tudo feito de palha e outros materiais no mercado Central. O seu negocio esta a desenvolver. Com os rendimentos ela paga a escola dos sobrinhos. Ela nao tem marido.

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Onamey

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, this very persistent and dynamic woman has sold fried foods and mabí (a refreshing brevage made of extract of lemon). Mother of four children, Onamey is separated from her husband, and since that time was obliged to work hard to earn a living for her family.

Onamey, 59 years old, is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like flour, vegetable oil, and other goods so as to continue preparing the fried foods. She also plans to remodel the locale where she runs her business, since it´s in a very unpleasant condition. An additional income from profits will help the entrepreneur improve her family´s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare the food she sells and remodel the locale where she runs her business

loans.name: Ni Putu Yeni Kiswant

texts.id:
Ni Putu Yeni Kiswanti, a lady aged 22 live in a village named Manistutu with her husband and child of 5 and a half. Her husband, Komang Adiasa, is a farmer. To subsidise their daily expenses, Yeni rears a mother pig. Daily she spends Rp 10.000 (USD1) for pig feed, a mixture of rice and bran. Apart from rice and bran, she also feed banana and taro leaves or banana stalk, commonly referred to by the Baliness as ‘gedebong.’ Before feeding, the pig is washed clean. She feed the pig twice a day, in the morning and late afternoon. The mother pig had already bore 6 piglets. From this effort, Yeni earned a profit of Rp 1.500.000 (USD170), over a period of 5 months. The profit is use pay for her son’s education, who recently commenced pre-school, while the loan from DINARI will be used to purchase pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Yeni Kiswanti, wanita berumur 22 tahun ini tinggal di sebuah desa bernama Manistutu bersama suami dan satu orang anaknya yang baru berumur 5 setengah tahun. Suaminya, Komang Adiasa, adalah seorang petani. Untuk mencukupi biaya hidup sehari – hari, Yeni memelihara 1 ekor induk babi. Setiap hari Yeni mengeluarkan biaya untuk pakan ternaknya sebesar Rp.10.000.- Makanan yang diberikan berupa dedak. Namun selain dedak, Yeni juga memberikan makanan selingan seperti daun pisang, daun talas, atau batang pisang dimana orang Bali biasa menyebutnya ”gedebong”. Sebelum diberi makan babi-babinya dimandikan dulu sampai bersih. Yeni memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Penginduk babi yang di pelihara Yeni sudah mempunyai anak 6 ekor. Dari usaha ini, Yeni mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp.1.500.000,- untuk jangka waktu 5 bulan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dipakai untuk pendidikan anaknya yang baru bersekolah di Taman Kanak - Kanak, sedangkan pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternaknya.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed (Membeli pakan ternak)

loans.name: Rossy Iraida

texts.en:
In spite of the very difficult life circumstances she has faced, Rossy remains a very positive and diligent person. Offspring of a poor family, she was obliged to drop out of school for many years because of financial issues. To cope with that situation, she started her small business, selling fried food, empanadas, crullers, and other goods. She operates her little fried food shop in the evening, since she goes to the school in the morning. She´s presently finishing the last grade of secondary school.

Rossy is requesting a loan to increase her inventory so that she can attract new customers. With the additional income from profits, Rossy, 31 years old, will set aside savings so as to begin her nursing studies at the university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

loans.use: To increase her inventory, purchasing flour, vegetable oil, and sugar to prepare the food she sells

loans.name: Ni Wayan Joli

texts.id:
Although Ni Wayan Joli is a teacher’s wife, she doesn’t want to depend solely on her husband’s salary. Now she has a pig farming business. With initial capital of Rp. 800,000 (about $87), she bought 1 female pig, and she spends Rp. 10,000 (about $1) per day for the pig’s food. From this pig farming, she gains Rp. 400,000 (about $43.5) profit per 6 month from selling 4 piglets. This profit is used for her daily expenses. The loan from Dinari will be used for the pig’s food. She feeds the pigs twice a day every day in the morning and in the evening. Her house is built by hand on the ground with a quite permanent structure. She hopes after she gets the loan from Dinari, her business will gain more profit so her family will have better quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang guru, Ni Wayan Joli tidak mau hanya mengandalkan gaji dari suaminya saja. Terbukti saat ini Wayan Joli mempunyai usaha beternak babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000,- Wayan Joli dapat membeli 1 ekor induk babi, dan setiap hari Wayan Joli mengeluarkan biaya pakan Rp.10.000,- untuk babinya. Dari hasil beternak babi ini Wayan Joli setiap 6 bulan sekali memperoleh keuntungan Rp.400.000,- dari penjualan 4 ekor anak babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya. Setiap hari Wayan Joli memberi makan ternaknya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya cukup permanen. Wayan Joli berharap dengan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari usahanya lebih meningkat dan kehidupan keluarganya juga lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To purchase pig's food

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz and her husband Leonce Guzman have a successful colmado, a little neighborhood grocery store. The couple started the business five years ago in order to provide a good education and food for their two children. Emperatriz also owns a small cafeteria in the public school of the township.

In her colmado, Emperatriz sells basic necessities like bread, milk, rice, salt, drinking water, and so forth. With the loan requested, the entrepreneur plans to purchase new inventory as to handily satisfy her customers´ needs. That way, the couple will better support their family financially.

loans.use: To purchase bread, milk, chocolate, rice, sugar and new inventory for her little grocery store

loans.name: Ynés

texts.en:
Ynés, 45, is a very persistent, dynamic and succesful businesswoman. She owns a beauty salon which she started 15 years ago. She has developed a very well established clientele. On the week-ends, she hires a young girl, because of the influx of customers on these days.

Ynés has requested a loan to renovate the locale, making it more attractive to the customers. She also wants to purchase some hair treatment and cosmetics products which are the most demanded by the women of her community. Given this loan, the entrepreneur will be able to help her husband provide their only son with a good education.

loans.use: To renovate the locale where she runs her beauty salon and purchase hair and cosmetic products for re-sale

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sibu

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sibu is already 50 years old, but she is still working diligently to help her husband who works as a farmer. With Rp. 800,000 (about $87) of capital, Sibu bought a female pig. Sibu spends Rp. 10,000 (about $1) for the pigs’ food every day. She gains Rp. 400,000 (about $43.5) profit per 6 months from selling the 5 piglets. She uses the profit to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fee. She has 2 children. The first child is already graduated. The other one is studying in high school. The loan from Dinari will be used to purchase the pig’s food. She hopes that the business goes well and her family has better quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Sibu meskipun sudah berumur 50 tahun, namun tetap rajin bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Dengan modal Rp.800.000,- Sibu membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Setiap harinya Sibu mengeluarkan biaya pakan Rp. 10.000,- untuk babinya. Dari hasil beternak babinya ini setiap 6 bulan sekali Sibu memperoleh keuntungan Rp.400.000,- dari hasil penjualan 5 ekor anak babinya. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan biaya sekolah anaknya. Sibu mempunyai 2 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah tamat sekolah. Sedangkan yang kedua masih bersekolah SMA. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternaknya. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya cukup sederhana. Harapan Sibu usahanya lebih meningkat dan kesejahteraan keluarganya menjadi lebih baik.

loans.use: To purchase pig's food

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela, 29 years old, is married, with three children (a girl and two boys). The two elder children go to the primary school. The youngest one is just two years old. Carmela's husband works in a construction company in Santo Domingo, the capital.

Carmela started her business eight years ago. She sells women's and children´s shoes, skin care and hair treatment products, women´s handbags, wigs, belts, and so forth. With the loan requested, she will increase her inventory in order to satisfy her customers´ needs. She will also introduce gold-filled jewelery so as to diversify her inventory and carry a wider range of products for her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase skin care and hair repair products and wigs for her business  Also introduce gold-filled jewelry to diversify inventory

loans.name: Ni Made Suarti

texts.id:
Ni Made Suarti is a hard-working woman and a good example for other working people. With Rp. 800,000 (about $87) as the initial capital, Suarti breeds 2 pigs. The expense for the pig’s food is Rp. 20,000 (about $2.7) per day. Suarti breeds the pigs using traditional ways. She gains Rp. 400,000 (about $43.5) profit per 6 months. This profit is useful to cover the expenses of her family with a 4-and-a-half-year-old child. Suarti also likes to save the money for her child’s future education. Her house is built by hand on the ground with quite a firm structure. Suarti will use the loan for the pigs’ food.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Suarti memang wanita yang sangat ulet bekerja dan perlu dipakai teladan dalam bekerja. Dengan modal awal Rp.800.000 Suarti memlihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Biaya sehari-hari untuk pakan Rp.20.000,- perhari. Dalam memelihara babinya, Suarti menggunakan cara tradisional. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari penjualan babinya setiap ± 6 bulan sekali Rp.400.000,-. Keuntungan yang diperoleh disamping untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari keluarganya yang baru dikaruniai 1 orang anak yang baru berumur 4 setengah tahun. Suarti juga rajin menabung untuk pendidikan anaknya kelak. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk biaya pakan ternaknya.

loans.use: To purchase pig's food

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 37 years old, married with no children, is a very persistent and diligent woman. Her husband works in a construction firm in Santo Domingo. Ana owns a drinks store. She operates the business from 6 pm to midnight, and during the week-ends, she closes the store after 2 am. She sells different kinds of drinks, beers being the most sold beverages in the store. The atmosphere is very pleasant. Customers can dance while they drink.

Ana has a refrigerator to keep the drinks cold and a generator for the frequent power cuts in her area. The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and introduce new kinds of drinks so that she can attract new customers. Given this loan, Ana will continue improving her family´s standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, purchasing wine, energy drinks, and beer for her drinks store

loans.name: Laito Facela

texts.pt:
Iaito is single but lives with a woman with whom he has 4 children. He works for the Police Authority of the Republic of Mozambique. His children attend school. He has not been able to purchase electric appliances for his home on his salary, as he is the only one who works outside the home. His wife is a homemaker.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

laito e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 4 filhos. Ele e trabalhador do Comando da Policia da Republica de Mocambique. Os seus filhos estao a estudar.Todavia, so com o salario que ele ganha nao consegue comprar electrodomesticos para a sua casa, pois que ele e o unico a trabalhr fora de casa. A sua esposa e apenas domestica.

loans.use: Iaito would like to use the funds to purchase electric appliances for this home

loans.name: Imam Basori

texts.id:
Imam is a diligent and hard-working husband. This newcomer from Bayuwangi is selling gift candies. He markets the merchandise to outside Denpasar city. He commutes about 50 – 100 km everyday by motorcycle. His transportation fee is Rp. 25,000 (about $2.7) per day. He brings 10 packs of candies daily. If he can sell all of them, he will get Rp. 50,000 (about $5.45) net profit per day. He needs Rp. 25,000 ($2.7) per day for his and his family’s daily expenses. His future business plan is to hire more workers. He will use the loan for this purpose. Adding more workers will increase the expenses; however, he will be able to cover a wider market. This will give him the chance to expand the business to other places.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Imam seorang suami yang rajin dan ulet bekerja. Pendatang dari Banyuwangi ini memiliki usaha jual permen berhadiah. Dia memasarkan barang dagangannya sampai di luar Kota Denpasar. Jarak tempuhnya setiap hari ± 50 km - 100 km. Sarana yang dia gunakan adalah sepeda motor Dengan biaya transportasi Rp 25.000,00/hari, dia membawa 10 pak permen berhadiah. Apabila habis terjual – 10 pak permen berhadiah tersebut - dia akan mendapatkan keuntungan bersih Rp 50.000,00/hari. Dia membutuhkan Rp 25.000,00/hari untuk biaya hidup mereka. Rencana usahanya ke depan, dia akan menambah jumlah tenaga kerja. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan membantunya mewujudkan hal tersebut. Bertambahnya tenaga kerja memang akan menambah biaya yang dikeluarkan, akan tetapi wilayah yang dapat dijangkau semakin luas. Hal ini akan membuka peluang baginya untuk mengembangkan usahanya ke tempat lain.

loans.use: To hire more workers

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a single 32-year old woman caring for her three children and her grandmother. She has a small vegetable and fruit stand at the roadside market in the Mutundwe Village outside of Kampala. She has had the stand for four years and has been a member of her lending group for four years.

Her stand is located in a busy location where the “matatoo” stops, so her setup is convenient for passers-by and people getting in and out of the matatoo. Most matatoo's are converted Toyota Vans that can seat 14 passengers.

She sells a variety of items, including bananas, sugar cane, ground nuts, and carrots. She also sells ebumba, clay that is baked and sold for nausea, (it tastes like baked clay with tiny stones), bitter berries for hypertension, and dried minnow-sized fish which is mixed with ground nut paste to make a sauce eaten with fruit. She will use her loan to buy more variety for her fruit stand and to help pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Safina will use her loan to buy more bananas, sugar cane, and ground nuts for her stand and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jorgete

texts.pt:
Jorgete is a married mother of 2. She entered the loan program in 2006. Before she began borrowing money, she sold tomatoes retail. Once she entered the program, she started selling on the wholesale level. As such, she provides boxes of tomatoes to resellers of Market 2000 in the town of Maxixe. She plans to use the profits to improve her home and save money for her children's future, for she has no one to help her support them.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorgete e mae solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006.Antes de tomar dinheiro emprestado ela vendia tomate a retalho. mas assim que ela entrou para o programa ja vende o tomate a grosso. Portanto ela fornece tomate em caixas aos revendedores do mercado 2000 no Municipio da Maxixe.Com os rendimentos ela pretende melhorar a sua residencia e guardar dinheiro para garantir o futuro dos seus filhos, pois que ela nao tem quem a ajude a sustentar os filhos.

loans.use: Jorgete would like to use the loan funds to purchase more cases of tomatoes from producers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a dynamo. She is 47 and the chairperson and founding member of the Alinyikira Lending Group in her village of Mutundwe. Alinyikira means “continue hard work”. She has raised seven children, two are still in secondary school. Five of her children have degrees from the university. In addition, she cares for four of her sister’s children. She is very busy, knows everyone and smiles and laughs with ease. She travels around Mutundwe with a swift, confident gait and cordial face for everyone.
Mutundwe is a village just outside of Kampala and it is known for its catering, bakeries and poultry. Janet has two businesses: a bakery and a poultry business. Behind her house, she raises hens, 350 of them. She used to raise boilers, but the price dropped so she now has layers.
Her loan will enable her to increase her bakery supplies and follow her dream of continuing to expand her hen farm and egg business. (If you would like to learn more about this amazing women and the other members of the Alinyikiri Lending Group please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: Alinyikira: “Continue Hard Work”).

loans.use: Janet will increase her bakery supplies for the upcoming holidays and expand her hen farm

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
How can I tell you about Samuel in such a short space? This wonderful, hard-working petite, 58-year old man who raises over 600 hens in a two story hen house in his backyard just glows with a sense of caring and compassion gained from a lifetime of hard work. He has raised six children and cares for two dependents.

He only has layers (egg-laying hens) now, because the price of broilers went down about five months ago. He buys the chicks when they are one day old and keeps them warm with charcoal heat. After four and a half months the chicks are grown, and they start laying eggs.

His hens are just starting to lay eggs. When in full production, he hopes his 600 hens will lay about 450 eggs per day. He will use his loan to buy more chicken feed to keep his hens healthy and laying. Samuel dreams of adding another building and expanding the number of hens in his hen farm. (If you would like to learn more about this lending group, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: Alinyikira: “Continue Hard Work”)

loans.use: Samuel will buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Virginia Nitico

texts.pt:
Virginia is single but lives with a man with whom she has a son. Virginia entered the program in 2006. The business is running well due to her self-sacrificing nature. Her husband also helps run the business. When she has to travel to acquire more articles of clothing, he stays behind to take care of the business and the child, since he is not working. With the profits from the business, she would like to build a tank to store water during the rainy season. She lives in a rural area with poor access to potable water. She has already built a house. Although it's not very large, it's big enough for her, her husband and her child. Her son attends school in a different area because where she lives there are no schools nearby.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 1 filho. Virginia entrou para o programa em 2006. O negocio esta a correr bem porque ela e uma mulher abnegada. O marido tambem lhe ajuda no trabalho, uma vez que quando ela viaja para a aquisicao de mais pecas de vestuario, ele e quem fica a cuidar do negocio e do filho, pois que ele nao trabalha. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela quer construir uma cisterna para armazenar agua na epoca chuvosa, uma vez que na zona onde ela vive e uma zona rural com problemas de acesso a agua potavel. Ela ja construiu uma casa embora nao muito grande.mas da para ele o marido e seu unico filho.O filho esta a estudar numa outra zona porque ali onde ela vive nao ha escola perto.

loans.use: Virginia would like to use the funds to purchase more articles of clothing in South Africa for resale

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
As you can see, it’s hard to get a picture of Resty that’s shows her at rest. She is all smiles and a bundle of energy. 
Resty is 40-years old, married with five children of her own and one dependent. She has a rental and catering business which she named Alinyikira after the name of her lending group in her village of Mutundwe. She also has a nut-grinding business. Her catering business supplies table cloths, ribbons, balloons, and decorations. Pictures of the events she has catered show how professional her operation is. She will use her loan to purchase a disco light and other items that will increase the type of events she can cater.
Her dream is continue growing her business. She would like to buy stackable chairs and a small tent, which requires a sizable outlay of capital, but this always smiling woman has the business sense to make it happen. (If you would like to learn more about this lending group, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: “Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work”)

loans.use: Resty will purchase a disco light and other items to expand her rental and catering business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet's nut-grinding business begins in an 8’ x 8’ cinder block shed next to her house used to store feed for her husband’s chickens: cinder block with a steel door, so the rodents don’t get in. Inside with the feed are the peanuts and her grinder.  Janet is a 50-year old mother of six children and two dependents. She has two businesses: a retail shop and a nut grinding business. It is not uncommon for people in her village of Mutundwe to have several businesses. Her retail business makes cakes and muffins. This is a woman is a very hard worker with great energy. She will use her loan to buy larger bags of nuts, and flour, sugar and salt for her retail shop. (If you would like to learn more, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: "Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work")

loans.use: Janet will use her loan to buy larger bags of nuts in addition to more flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
When you walk up to Cissy’s door you can hear the sound of her sewing machine. She is hard at work most days making Busuuti’s--a traditional, hand-made garment that is never found in retail stores--or other items. Her tailoring business has enabled her to care for three children of her own and two orphan children. This delightful 43-year old woman has been sewing for 20 years. This is a very busy time, because the holidays are approaching. 
She will use her loan to stock up on cloth, embroidery, colorful threads so her clients will have a better choice of material from which to choose.  Cissy dreams that her children will go to the university. These hard-working women of the Mutundwe Village all instill in their children the importance of education. (If you would like to learn more, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: “Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work”)

loans.use: Cissy will buy more cloth, embroidery, thread for her tailoring business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is 34 years old and has three children and one dependent. For the past four years, she has operating her own food catering business.  She makes typical Ugandan food for catered events: chapatas, matooke (fried or steamed plantains, cassava (fried or steamed tubers), sweet potatoes, posho (maize flour), g-nuts: (ground nuts), rice, yams and pumpkin. Bridget has been receiving loans for four years and has always repaid them on time.
The women of the Mutundwe Village are known for their cooking and catering businesses. Many of the villages near Kampala specialize in a certain trade. If people are looking for a certain things, they know which village offers which services and products. In addition, the villagers share experiences and improve their businesses by learning from each other. This village specialization makes distribution of raw goods easier.
Bridget dreams of earning enough income to have a home of her own and to help her children get a good education. She will use her loan to buy a second and third warmer, which will enable her to service more customers. ( If you would like to learn more about the women of Mutundwe, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: "Alinyikira: Continue Hard Work")

loans.use: Bridget will use her loan to buy two more warmers and other serving dishes

loans.name: Cezaltina Artur

texts.pt:
Cezaltina is a married mother of 7. The 4 older children attend school; the other 3 are not old enough yet. Cezaltina’s husband also works in the shop. She entered the loan program in 2006. Since then, the business has grown, such that she is now able to offer a variety of products in her store. With the profits, she is able to pay for her children’s schooling and provide food for the whole family.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Cezaltina e casada e mae de 7 filhos. Os 4 mais velhos estao a estudar os outros 3 ainda nao tem idade para ir a escola. O marido de Cezaltina trabalha tambem na loja .Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. de la paraq ca o negocio dele cresceu pois que ja consegue oferecer um leque de artigos variados na sua loja.E com os lucros consegue pagar a escola dos seus filhos e prover alimentos para toda a familia.

loans.use: Cezaltina would like to use the funds to purchase products for her store

loans.name: Nicandro Agostinho

texts.pt:
Nicandro is not officially married but lives with a woman with whom he has 4 children. He works for the City Council of Inhambane, capital of one of the southern provinces of the country. His children are all currently attending school. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the home. With his salary, it is not possible to support the family and buy electric appliances. He therefore entered the FDM loan program to acquire certain appliances that he would otherwise not be able to afford.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicandro nao e casado oficialmente mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 4 filhos.Ele etrabalhador do Concelho Municipal da Cidade de Inhambane.,capital de uma das provincias a Sul do Pais. Os seus filhos todos estao a estudar. A sua esposa nao esta empregada e apenas domestica. Com o seu salario nao e possivel sustentar a familia e comprar electrodomesticos.Dai o facto de ter entrado para o programa de credito do FDM para poder adquirir ccertos electrodomesticos que de contrario nunca teria condicoes de adquirir.

loans.use: Nicandro would like to use the funds to purchase electric appliances for his home

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
8 years ago when she went to the first group meeting of TYM fund, Ms Nguyễn Thị Tuyết was a shy woman. She did not have a chance to go to school so she is illiterate, for this reason she was afraid of meetings. With the love and support from her group, she applied for and received a loan. She invested the money into raising pigs and poultry. It was a success, the business grew and grew so she was successful in securing bigger loans in later rounds. She had overcome her shyness and became an active member of TYM branch 3 in the village of Nam Viêm, Phúc Yên where she lives with her husband and 3 children. Ms Tuyết requests a loan of 575 USD to buy food and more ducks for her paddling of 60 + ducks. At 46 years old and in good health, she feels that she would be able to continue working and hopes that she would be able to qualify for more loans to expand her poultry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Cách đây 8 năm khi lần đầu tiên đi sinh hoạt cụm tại Quỹ Tình thương, chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết còn là một phụ nữ nhút nhát. Không có điều kiện học hành nên chị Tuyết không biết chữ, do đó chị rất ngại có mặt tại các cuộc họp đông người. Được cán bộ Quỹ Tình thương cùng chị em vận động chị đã tham gia vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, vịt. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng mang lại hiệu quả cao, mức vốn vay qua các vòng càng lớn, chị Tuyết dần làm quen với việc đi sinh hoạt cộng đồng và trở thành một cụm trưởng nhiệt tình của chi nhánh 3 Quỹ Tình thương. Hiện tại chị Tuyết đang sống cùng chồng và 3 người con tại xã Nam Viêm, Phúc Yên. Chị vừa làm dự án xin vay 575 USD để mua thức ăn và phát triển đàn vịt hơn 60 con của mình. Ở độ tuổi 46, chị cảm thấy mình vẫn còn nhiều sức lực để lao động sản xuất và mong muốn trong tương lai sẽ được vay mức vốn tối đa từ Quỹ để phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi của mình.

loans.use: Buy chicken-feed and more ducks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Active and hard working by nature, Ms Nguyễn Thị D., 45 years old, is always on the look for ways to improve her family financial. In 1999, she participated in the TYM fund, branch Phúc Yên. She raised ducks and swan geese. The revenue from this helped her raise her children and put them through school. Her children are now 22 and 21, both graduated and working. Not only does she participate in the fund, she also encourages other women who want to improve their life conditions to do the same. She helps them to get qualified for loans and gives them advice on how to get the best return on their investment. Now Khả Do is one of the places in Phúc Yên that has the highest number of women who had been able to escape poverty. According to Ms D., this is due to the help and support of TYM fund. She wishes to remain a TYM fund member forever. She is requesting a loan of 825 USD to buy more chicks and food for her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Là một phụ nữ chịu khó và năng động, chị Nguyễn Thị D., 45 tuổi, luôn tìm kiếm những cơ hội để phát triển kinh tế nâng cao thu nhập cho gia đình. Năm 1999, chị tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương, chi nhánh Phúc Yên về chăn nuôi ngan, vịt. Nguồn lãi thu được giúp chị D. có điều kiện cải thiện cuộc sống và cho các con ăn học đầy đủ. Hai con chị D., một người 22, một người 21 tuổi hiện đều đã ra trường và có công ăn việc làm ổn định. Không những tham gia vay vốn chị D. còn tích cực vận động những chị em mong muốn thay đổi cuộc sống nhưng không có vốn làm ăn tham gia vào Quỹ. Vừa vận động chị em tham gia vay vốn, vừa bày cho chị em cách sử dụng đồng vốn sao cho có hiệu quả nhất, cho đến nay thôn Khả Do đã là một trong những nơi có nhiều phụ nữ thoát khỏi đói nghèo trên địa bàn thị xã Phúc Yên. Chị D. nói để gia đình chị và những chị em trong thôn được như ngày hôm nay là nhờ vào những đồng vốn vay được từ Quỹ. Nguyện vọng của chị là sẽ mãi mãi là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương. Hiện chị đang xin vay 825 USD để mua thêm ngan con, cùng thức ăn cho đàn lợn, ngan của mình.

loans.use: Buy mash for pigs, buy swan and chicken-feed for them

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
To any woman, having children going to college is a pride, especially in a remote province like Phuc Yen. Ms Le Thi V. puts a lot of efforts to raise all four children. When V. was 43 years old and her first child attended college, her family was in a great need. With the encouragement of her husband, a retired officer, Ms. V. applied for a 125USD loan from TYM Fund to open a shop selling tea, sundry goods and clothes. Her monthly income has increased constantly in the past 11 years. Although all her children are now grown up, and her family has become pretty stable, she has never thought of leaving TYM Fund. After more than 10 years, V. has considered TYM Fund her second family. Now she would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more clothes for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Có 4 con đỗ đại học là một thành tích đáng tự hào của bất kỳ người phụ nữ nào, nhất là ở một địa phương không phải là trung tâm như Phúc Yên. Để nuôi được các con học hành, ra trường và có việc làm ổn định như ngày hôm nay là một sự nỗ lực của chị Lê Thị Vỵ, thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương. Năm 43 tuổi, khi người con đầu vào đại học, hoàn cảnh kinh tế gia đình lúc đó rất khó khăn. Được sự khích lệ của chồng, một cán bộ về hưu, chị Vỵ xin vay 125 USD để bán hàng nước. Các con nối nhau vào đại học, chị Vỵ đã chuyển qua nhiều loại hình kinh doanh: bán hàng nước, hàng tạp hóa, hàng vải. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của chị tăng đều trong 11 năm qua. Đến nay tuy các con đã trưởng thành nhưng ra Quỹ là điều mà chị Vỵ không khi nào nghĩ đến. Sau hơn 10 năm gắn bó, Quỹ Tình thương đã trở thành mái nhà thứ 2 của chị. Hiện chị đang xin vay mức vốn 1200 USD cho công việc kinh doanh mặt hàng vải may quần áo.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Everyone is impressed by Ms. Ngo Thi T.’s clothes and toy shop at Phu Cuong market. We cannot believe such a young woman can be the owner of this big shop. Ms. T.’s business has been really good because of its ideal location, and her natural talent in sales. All goods are often sold out really quickly. Her monthly income is about 250USD. At the age of 26, Ms. T. became a member of TYM Fund. It is also the year when she had her first child. Although the baby kept her busy, she never misses any group’s activity. Also, she is always willing to help other needy members of TYM Fund. Ms. T. thinks that winter is coming, there will be an increasing demand for warm clothes such as sweaters or leather jackets. She would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more clothes for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Thật ngạc nhiên khi đứng trước cửa hàng kinh doanh hàng may mặc sẵn và đồ chơi trẻ em của chị Ngô Thị Tình tại cổng chợ Phú Cường. Chúng tôi không nghĩ rằng người phụ nữ còn khá trẻ và nhỏ nhắn này lại là chủ một cửa hàng lớn như vậy. Việc kinh doanh của chị Tình đang tiến triển rất thuận lợi vì cửa hàng của chị nằm ở một vị trí khá lý tưởng, một phần nữa là do duyên bán hàng của chị nên hàng nhập về luôn được bán hết. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ cửa hàng khoảng 250 USD. Chị Tình tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002 khi 26 tuổi, đó cũng là năm chị sinh đứa con đầu lòng. Mặc dù có con nhỏ nhưng mọi hoạt động của nhóm, cụm chị đều tham gia rất nhiệt tình, sôi nổi, không những thế chị còn rất sẵn lòng giúp đỡ các chị em khác khi gặp khó khăn. Chị tâm sự rằng sắp đến mùa đông, có thể có những đợt rét đậm kéo dài nên đồ chống rét như len, dạ, áo jacket sẽ rất chạy hàng. Chị rất muốn được vay thêm 1200 USD để tích luỹ hàng cho thời gian tới.

loans.use: Buy winter garment

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H., 44 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 1994. Before joining TYM Fund, her life was really difficult because she could not get any fund to start her business. Her family income comes from only a 5-acre corn-field. H.’s first loan from TYM Fund was 50USD. She used this money to buy soya to make soya curd and sell it to the villagers. She uses the profit from this small stall and her husband’s wage to pay the weekly repayment. She also uses the soya waste to feed the pigs. After 6 years, her loan now is 575USD. From this loan and the savings, she has expanded her business. Her customers now include not only the villagers but also the other soya curd sellers and restaurant owners near Noi Bai Airport. She sells up to 50 kg soya curd per day. At the same time, she buys material for fitting up electrical equipment services. Her family’s total income now increases to 225USD a month. This time she plans to borrow 1200USD to buy more soya to make soya curd and buy mash for her 10 pigs. She also wants to use this loan for fitting up electrical equipment services of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiên, 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 1994. Cuộc sống gia đình chị những năm trước khi tham gia Quỹ khá vất vả vì không có vốn để tăng gia sản xuất, mọi chi tiêu chỉ trông vào 5 sào ruộng. Năm đầu tiên tham gia được vay 50 USD, chị đầu tư vào làm đậu phụ bán cho người dân trong thôn. Tiền lãi thu được cộng với tiền công làm thuê của chồng được dùng trả gốc lãi hàng tuần, ngoài ra bã đậu chị dùng để chăn nuôi lợn. Sau 6 năm liên tục vay vốn với mức vốn lên tới 575 USD, cộng với số tiền tích lũy được, chị đã mở rộng phạm vi bán hàng, không chỉ bán cho những hộ gia đình quanh đó mà còn bán buôn cho những người bán lẻ và các nhà hàng trong sân bay Nội Bài, lượng tiêu thụ lên tới 50 kg đậu/ngày. Đồng thời, chồng chị mua thêm vật tư, nhận lắp đặt các công trình điện nước, nâng tổng thu nhập bình quân cả gia đình lên 225 USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Hiên dự định vay 1200 USD để mua đậu tương làm đậu và chăn nuôi 10 con lợn hiện có trong chuồng. Phần vốn còn lại dành cho việc phát triển nghề lắp đặt điện nước của chồng.

loans.use: buy soya to make soya curd, buy mash for 10 pigs, for fitting up electrical equipment services of her husband

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyen Thi H., 44 years old, has a happy family with a supporting husband and two well-behaved children. She became a TYM Fund member since 1996. She has a shop at a very good location, and the selection of goods sold are really varied. Her shop is divided into three rooms. In one room she sells sundry goods, in one room her husband fixes bicycles and sells parts of bicycles, in the last room they sell cattle foods. Although very busy, she still spends time with TYM Fund activities. She has been an excellent officer of her cluster. Ms. H. is now the team leader of TYM Fund’s Soc Son. Her group is ranked as “Good” every month. Her business is doing well. Her family’s monthly income is 200USD. She wants to borrow 1200USD to upgrade her shop and sell more variety of goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 44 tuổi, đang có một gia đình êm ấm, hạnh phúc với người chồng luôn ủng hộ chị trong công việc và hai đứa con ngoan ngoãn. Chị bắt đầu tham gia từ khi Quỹ triển khai hoạt động tại xã Phú Cường năm 1996. Chị có một cửa hàng với vị trí khá thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán, chẳng thế mà gian hàng của chị thật phong phú và đa dạng. Một gian hàng tạp hóa với rất nhiều mặt hàng tiêu dùng hàng ngày, một gian để anh sửa chữa, bán phụ tùng xe đạp, gian còn lại anh chị để bán thức ăn gia súc. Công việc bộn bề là vậy nhưng chị vẫn luôn sắp xếp được để có thời gian dành cho Quỹ Tình thương. Nhiều năm liền chị luôn là cán bộ cụm xuất sắc, hiện tại chị là nhóm trưởng của Quỹ Tình thương Sóc Sơn và nhóm của chị luôn được xếp loại Tốt hàng tháng. Công việc kinh doanh hiện tại của anh chị đang tiến triển rất tốt, thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 200 USD. Chị tâm sự rằng nếu được vay thêm 1200 USD thì nhất định chị sẽ nâng cấp cho cửa hàng rộng rãi, khang trang hơn và đầu tư thêm nhiều mặt hàng nữa.

loans.use: Upgrade her shop and sell more goods

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị T. is 34, she is a member of TYM fund since 1996. She is married and has 3 daughters. They live in the village of Phú Cường, Sóc Sơn district. In our visit to her home, she talked about TYM fund with a lot of appreciation. She said that since she became a member of TYM fund, it had helped her escape the poverty. With each loan that she received, it was divided into 2 parts: one for buying livestock to breed, one for buying poultry to resell at the market. The monthly revenue for her family is about 150 USD. Part of it goes to payment toward the fund and part is re-invested in the business. With their savings and loans from their family, they had built a 2 storey house in 2005. Ms T. is applying for a new loan of 600 USD to build new breeding facilities, buy more pigs and cows to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 34 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1996. Gia đình chị gồm 5 người, 2 vợ chồng và 3 cô con gái, hiện đang sinh sống tại xã Phú Cường, huyện Sóc Sơn. Đến thăm nhà chị, chúng tôi được nghe chị nói về Quỹ Tình thương với một thái độ rất trân trọng. Chị kể từ khi tham gia Quỹ được vay vốn hoàn trả theo tuần, gia đình chị đã có cơ hội thoát nghèo và phát triển kinh tế. Vốn vay về được chị chia làm 2 phần, một phần để mua con giống như bò, lợn, một phần để làm vốn đi chợ buôn bán thực phẩm tươi sống như gà, vịt. Lãi T. được dùng hoàn trả vốn vay và tích luỹ. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 150 USD/tháng. Từ số tiền tích luỹ được, cộng với tiền vay từ anh em họ, năm 2005 chị đã xây được ngôi nhà 2 tầng khang trang, đẹp đẽ. Chị đang dự định vay mức vốn 600 USD để xây dựng thêm chuồng trại chăn nuôi gia súc, mở rộng việc chăn nuôi lợn, bò.

loans.use: Upgrade the cage, buy more pigs

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Yungain Women for Progress." Her business is selling ice cream, which she does in the Plaza de Armas in Yungay-Ancash.

She began this business by buying manufactured ice cream and reselling it. She has belonged to the Communal Bank for two years and thanks to the loans she has received she was able to buy a small machine to make ice cream, so now she makes and sells her own ice cream, thereby enabling her to increase her income.

With her loan from Manuela Ramos for 1700 soles (approximately $567US), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy ice cream making supplies such as milk, sugar, flavorings, and cones.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa Maria tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso”. Su actividad económica es la venta de helados, dicha venta la hace en la Plaza de Armas de Yungay - Ancash.

Comenzó este negocio comprando helados preparados y solamente se dedicaba a venderlos, hace dos años que pertenece a su Banco Comunal y gracias a los préstamos recibidos ella ha podido comprar una pequeña maquina para elaborar helados, en la actualidad elabora y vende los helados lo cual ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles (U$ 567 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará insumos (Leche, azucar, saborizantes y barquillos) para la elaboración de helados.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream making supplies

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Phạm Thị Nhuận, 40 years old, is living a happy life with her husband and 2 children in the village of Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district. When they got married, they were empty handed. Ms Nhuận knew about TYM fund when it opened a branch in her village in 1994 but she did not have a chance to participate because her children were still too young. In 2000, she applied for a loan of 50 USD to buy a pig and chickens. 3 years later in 2003, she built a nice cozy house with the money that she made from raising pigs and chickens. Since the day she became a member of the fund, she got a lot of support from her husband. He's in charge of the weekly payment and frees up her time for her to participate in the group activities organized by TYM fund: cultural, letters & arts. She is respected and trusted by her peers. She is the group representative for TYM branch 1 in Sóc Sơn. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to renovate the facilities, buy 3 pigs and 500 chicks to take advantage of the Tết (new year) rush. Right now, the monthly revenue for her family is about 125 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Nhuận, 40 tuổi, đang có một cuộc sống hạnh phúc với chồng và hai con tại xã Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Khi mới xây dựng gia đình, do đông anh em, hoàn cảnh gia đình khó khăn nên anh chị ra ở riêng chỉ với 2 bàn tay trắng. Mặc dù biết Quỹ TYM hoạt động tại địa phương từ năm 1994, nhưng vì con còn nhỏ nên chị chưa có cơ hội tham gia. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và xin vay 50 USD dùng vào đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Năm 2003 chị đã xây được ngôi nhà cấp 4 khang trang, rộng rãi bằng số lãi thu được từ việc kinh doanh nói trên. Kể từ khi tham gia Quỹ, chị Nhuận luôn được chồng hỗ trợ trong việc trả tiền tuần, đặc biệt anh luôn tạo điều kiện về thời gian để chị tham gia các hoạt động của Quỹ như sinh hoạt cụm, giao lưu văn hóa văn nghệ … Chị luôn được chị em tín nhiệm bầu vào ban quản lý cụm. Hiện nay chị đang là cụm trưởng của chi nhánh 1 Sóc Sơn. Dự định của chị là vay 950 USD để sửa sang lại chuồng trại nuôi bò, mua 3 con lợn và 500 con gà thịt để phục vụ cho dịp Tết Nguyên Đán 2008. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình là 125 USD/tháng.

loans.use: Repair the cage, buy 3 pigs and 500 chicks

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima, a 47 year old married woman, has a family that consists of her 23 year old son and husband. The family works in agriculture, marketing fruit and heavy cargo transportation.

Maxima sells fruit wholesale in a permanent stall in the Central Minero market in Santa Cruz de la Sierra city. She has approximately 20 years experience in this field. There are many stalls around her that sell fruit, but because of her experience and age of her clientele, she has stable and steady customers.

With the present loan she will buy a stock of fruit to sell, the prices of these products vary according to the type of fruit, the season and other factors. Maxima has a small debt with FFP Prodem with a debit balance of $285US.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.
