Maxima, una señora casada de 47 años de edad, tiene una familia que está conformada por un hijo de 23 años de edad y su esposo, la familia se dedican a la actividad agrícola, comercialización de frutas y al transporte pesado de carga.

El negocio de Máxima es vender frutas al por menor, en un puesto fijo, en el mercado CENTRAL de Minero de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Tiene bastante experiencia en este rubro aproximadamente 20 años. existen bastantes puestos alrededor de ella que venden fruta, pero por la experiencia y antiguedad de nuestra cliente, cuenta con clientela fija y estable.

Con la presente solicitud comprará mercadería variada de frutas par su respectiva comercialización, los precios de estos productos varian de acuerdo al tipo de fruta, la temporada y otros aspectos. Actualmente tiene una deuda pequeña en FFP Prodem con un saldo deudor de $us. 285.-.

loans.use: Buy fruit to stock fruit stall in the market

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
"I need to enlarge the space in one of the rooms in my home, since space is very tight. There are five people altogether in my family. I seek $800 to enlarge the space in one of the rooms in my home."

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un cuarto en mi vivienda ya que es muy reducido el espacio que tenemos y somos 5 de familia” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para ampliar un cuarto de mi vivienda.

loans.use: to build a room for more space

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepción has a goal to start a business selling chickens that are prepared and quartered. She is 40 years old, with three chidren, and is part of the Nueva Palestina 8 support group, together with Lucila Pérez Huacash (who has a grocery store) and Cristina Aguilar López (who has a grocery store). Maria Concepción will invest her loan in the purchase of a table to display her chickens, a scale, and plastic bags; Lucila and Cristina will invest in purchasing merchandise to start a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CONCEPCION tiene como objetivo iniciar un negocio de venta de pollos destazados,. Ella tiene 40 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Nueva Palestina 8 junto con doña Lucila Pérez Huacash (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Cristina Aguilar López (tienda de abarrotes). Ma. Concepción invertirá su préstamo en la compra de una mesa para exhibir sus pollos, una bascula y bolsas de plástico y Lucila y Cristina invertirán en la compra de mercadería para iniciar el negocio de una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Dpsplay table, scale and plastic bags to sell chickens

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria and her husband have a business selling car radiators. They started this business seven years ago, and currently rent a location. With the loand they will increase the purchase of radiators and therefore increase sales. She is 35 years old, has three children, and is part of the group called Santo Tomas 4.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

GLORIA junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de radiadores para automóviles, este negocio lo inicio hace siete años y hasta el momento rentan un local. La fotografia en la que aparece fue tomada en su casa y ahi podemos visualizar como secan la ropa en dias de lluvia .Con el préstamo aumentaran la compra de radiadores y de esta forma aumentar las ventas. Ella tiene 35 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo llamado Santo Tomas 4.

loans.use: Purchase car radiators

loans.name: Eustoquia

texts.es:
Eustoquia is 57 years ols, she had five children and is a widow. In her house she has a grocery store where she also sells typical vegetables from her region. With her loan she will invest in air conditioning in the area where she displays her products. She is part of the group called Santo Tomas 4, together with Marcela Pérez Hernández (who sells fruits and vegetables), Blanca Reza Millán (who sells tacos), and Micaela Heredia Hernández (who sells silver jewelry). They will invest their loan buying kitchen utensils for one of them and the other to acquire more jewelry in order to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

EUSTOQUIA tiene 57 años, tuvo cinco hijos y es viuda. Ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en donde también vende verduras típicas de la región, con su préstamo invertirá en el acondicionamiento del lugar para exhibir sus productos. Forma parte del grupo llamado santo Tomas 4 junto con doña Marcela Pérez Hernández (venta de frutas y verduras), Blanca Reza Millán (venta de tacos) y doña Micaela Heredia Hernández (venta de joyería de plata).Ellas invertirán su préstamo comprando implementos de cocina una de ellas y la otra adquiriendo mas joyerías para así aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Air conditioning, kitchen utensils, and jewelry

loans.name: Ofeliz

texts.es:
Ofelia sells fruits and vegetables from her home. She began this business four years ago. She is 42 years old, has five children, and with her earnings she helps her husband with the household expenses. She is part of the group called Sonora 5 together with Dominga Patishtan Díaz (who sells shoes by catalogue), Gloria Virginia Martínez Pérez (who sells fruits and vegetables), and Josefina Leticia Pérez Pérez (an artisan). With their part of the loan, Ofelia and Gloria will increase their purchase of fruit and vegetables, Dominga shoes, and Josefina will buy cloth and thread in a variety of colors.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

OFELIA se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa, comenzó con este negocio hace cuatro años. Ella tiene 42 años, cinco hijos y con sus ganancias le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Forma parte del grupo llamado Sonora 5 junto con doña Dominga Patishtan Díaz (venta de zapatos por catalogo), Gloria Virginia Martínez Pérez (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Josefina Leticia Pérez Pérez (artesana). Con la parte de sus préstamos Ofelia y Gloria aumentaran la compra de frutas y verduras, Dominga en zapatos y Josefina comprara tela de manta e hilos en su variedad de colores.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, shoes, choth and thread

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 25 years old and has four children. She has installed a grocery store in her house where she sells salt, sugar, pasta, oil, soap, etc. She belongs to the group called Stars 4 together with Estela Vázquez Paciencia (who has a grocery store) and Maria Cristina Gómez Espinosa (who sells vegetables). Estela and Maria will buy a supply of merchandise to supply their businesses and Maria Cristina will buy mayonaise, salsas, corn, vegetable pears, and with this they hope to increase their sales and increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA tiene 25 años, cuatro hijos. Ella tiene instalada en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en donde vende: sal, azúcar, pastas, aceite, jabón, etc., pertenece al grupo llamado Stars 4 junto con doña Estela Vázquez Paciencia (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Maria Cristina Gómez Espinosa (venta de verduras). Estela y Maria compraran un surtido de mercancía para abastecer sus negocios y Maria cristina comprara mayonesa, salsas, elotes y chayotes, con eso esperan incrementar sus ventas y obtener mas ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela is an artisan who embroiders cloth blouses and sells them in the city's artisan market. She is 32 years old, has three children, and belogs to the group called Alvaro Obregón 2 together with Veda Esperanza Hernández Felipe (who sells footwear). Manuela will envest her loan in the purchase of fabric and thread in a variety of colors, and Veda Esperanza will buy a large variety of shoes in many sizes in order to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MANUELA es artesana, borda blusas hechas de tela de manta y los vende en el mercado de las artesanías de la ciudad. Ella tiene 32 años, tres hijos, pertenece al grupo llamado Álvaro Obregón 2 junto con doña Veda Esperanza Hernández Felipe (venta de calzado). Manuela invertirá su préstamo en la compra de tela e hilos en su variedad de colores, y Veda Esperanza comprará gran variedad de números de zapatos para tener más clientes.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread and shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Wilder

texts.es:
Carlos, 35, works daily in a small eatery that he set up in his mother's home. Everyday, he passes many happy moments with his adoring mother. He has worked to support his family's needs and provide for his young daughter's medical costs, for she suffered a terrible illness a little while ago. Now, she is fully recovered. In spite of struggling against difficult circumstances at home, he does not let hardships prevent him from continuing his work. Instead, he keeps on going, so he can eventually buy his own home and provide a decent education for his daughters, who are his inspiration for life. Without a doubt, his aspirations are possible with your help. Carlos' ray of hope is to enlarge his business. His wish is at your disposal, for he seeks a loan of $200 to buy more merchandise and invest in enlarging the space of his small modest eatery. Let us grant his wish so he can realize his hope as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un hombre de 35 años y día a día trabaja en la pequeña fuente de soda que acondicionó en casa de su adorada madre, con la que comparte a diario momentos de mucha felicidad. Su desempeño en este espacio de ventas le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia y también a aliviar el dolor de su pequeña niña que hace poco sufrió una terrible enfermedad y de la cual ahora viene recuperándose satisfactoriamente. A pesar de lidiar con muchas circunstancias difíciles en su hogar, no deja de mantener ese ímpetu de seguir trabajando y luchar para que dentro de poco pueda ofrecer a su familia una casa propia y una educación adecuada a sus reinas quienes se han convertido en su adoración y motor de su vida. Sin duda estos sueños pueden ser factibles con tu ayuda y ese rayito de esperanza que posee Carlos para acrecentar su negocio. Sus anhelos están depositados en usted y pide le ayude con la suma de 200 dólares para poder comprar más artículos e invertir en la implementación de los espacios y en las cosas que le hacen falta en su pequeña y humilde fuente de soda. Hagamos posible que este anhelo se haga realidad en corto tiempo.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to enlarge his business for more space and comfort

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is 47 years old and has seven children. She has a grocery store that she put in her house 4 years ago. With her loan she wants to supply the business with a variety of products such as sugar, soap, pasta, oil, candy, drinks, etc. She is part of the group called Alvaro Obregón 2 together with Cristina Elizabeth Guillen Hernández (who sells clothing). Cristina, with her part of the loan, will buy a supply of clothing to display for the women of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

FORTUNATA tiene 47 años, siete hijos. Ella cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes que instalo en su casa hace cuatro años, con su préstamo quiere surtir el negocio con una variedad de productos tales: azúcar, jabón, pastas, aceite, dulces, bebidas, etc. Forma parte del grupo llamado Álvaro Obregón 2 junto con doña Cristina Elizabeth Guillen Hernández (venta de ropa). Cristina con la parte que le corresponde del préstamo comprara un surtido de ropa para exhibir con las señoras de la comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase grocery store inventory and clothing

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is an artisan who embroiders cloth blouses and sells them in a nearby town. She is 32 years old, has three children and belongs to the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 1," together with Carmen López Román (an artisan). With their loan they will invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, scissors, and needles.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

JULIA es artesana, borda blusas de manta y los vende en el pueblo más cercano a su localidad. Ella tiene 32 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 1, junto con doña Carmen López Román (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras y agujas.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, scissors and needles for creating embroidered blouses.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is 43 years old and has three children. She is an artisan as is Elena Pérez López y Maria Luz Hernández Pérez. They make cloth blouses and then embroider them with flowers around the collar. They take the blouses to a nearby town to sell them, and in this way they contribute to the family expenses. They belong to the group called Mujeres para Progresar 1.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DELFINA tiene 43 años, tres hijos. Ella es artesana al igual que doña Elena Pérez López y doña Maria Luz Hernández Pérez. Ambas confeccionan las blusas con tela de manta y posteriormente las bordan con flores alrededor del cuello, lo llevan a vender al pueblo más cercano, de esta forma ellas contribuyen al gasto familiar. Pertenecen al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 1.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is an artisan, is 34 years old, and has three children. She makes cloth blouses and then embroiders them. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 2," together with two other artisans, Alejandra Hernández Hernández and Flor de Maria Jiménez Hernández. With their loan they will buy wholesale fabric and thread and share it between their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

GLORIA es artesana, tiene 34 años, tres hijos. Ella hace blusas con tela de manta y después las borda. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 2, junto con doña Alejandra Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Flor de Maria Jiménez Hernández (artesana). Con sus prestamos compraran tela e hilo al por mayor y se repartirán entre ellas para sus respectivos negocios .

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is 29 years old and has two children. She embroiders cloth blouses with colored flowers. In order to sell and buy her material she travels two hours from her home to the nearest town. She belongs to the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 3," together with another artisan Blanca Flor Jiménez Pérez. The women will invest in purchasing cloth, thread, needles, and scissors with their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

CARMELA tiene 29 años, dos hijos. Ella borda blusas de manta con flores de diversos colores, para vender y adquirir su material viaja dos horas de su localidad hacia el pueblo mas cercano . Pertenece al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 3, junto con doña Blanca Flor Jiménez Pérez (artesana). Ambas con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de tela, hilo, agujas y tijeras.

loans.use: Purchase cloth, thread, needles and scissors to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is an artisan who is 18 years old and single. She embroiders cloth blouses and takes them to sell in a nearby village. With her earnings she helps her parents with the household expenses as her father is a farmer and her mother is also an artisan. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 3," together with another artisan, Reynalda Hernández Hernández. With their loan they will buy fabric and threads at wholesale prices in order to continue their production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

ESPERANZA es artesana, tiene 18 años, soltera. Ella borda blusas de manta y los lleva a vender al pueblo mas cercano, con sus ganancias le ayuda a sus papas con los gastos del hogar ya que su papa es campesino y su mama también es artesana. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 3, junto con doña Reynalda Hernández Hernández (artesana). Con la parte de sus prestamos compraran telas e hilos al por mayor para continuar con la producción.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread in order to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda makes cloth blouses and also embroiders them. She is 27 years old, has three children and belonds to the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 4," together with two other artisans, Catalina Hernández Hernández and Carmela Hernández Pérez. With their loan they will invest in the purchase of thread and fabric at wholesale prices, as now they have to travel two hours from their home in order to acquire their supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

FERNANDA hace blusas de manta y también las borda. Ella tiene 27 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 4, junto con doña Catalina Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Carmela Hernández Pérez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilo y tela al por mayor, ya que para adquirirlos tienen que viajar dos horas de donde viven.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabric to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 29 years old and has four children. Her husband is a farmer and she makes cloth blouses and then embroiders them with colorful flowers. She belongs to a group called "Mujeres para Progresar 4," together with another artesan, Margarita Pérez López. With the loan they will invest in the purchase of basic materials (fabric, thread, needles, scissors) to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARGARITA tiene 29 años, cuatro hijos, su esposo es campesino y ella se dedica a confeccionar blusas de manta para que posteriormente las borde con flores de diversos colores. Pertenece al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 4, junto con doña Margarita Pérez López (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de su materia prima (telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras) para aumentar la producción.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, needles and scissors in order to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga is 55 years old and has seven independent children. She is an artisan who makes cloth blouses and then embroiders them with colorful flowers around the neckline. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar," together with another artisan, Antonia Pérez López. With the loan they will acquire fabric and thread at wholesale prices to reduce their purchase costs and therefore achieve greater earnings with their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DOMINGA tiene 55 años, siete hijos ya independientes. Ella es artesana, confecciona blusas con tela de manta y posteriormente las adorna con flores de diversos colores en el cuello. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar, junto con doña Antonia Pérez López (artesana). Con sus prestamos adquirirán tela e hilos al por mayor para rebajar los gastos de compra y así lograr mas ganancias en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread in order to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Queta María

texts.es:
Queta is a lady who, up until now, together with her husband, has been able to spend time in many activities to educate her three daughters and take care of them in their home. However, her second daughter needs a lot of attention and care because she suffers a grave disease which she has suffered since she was six years old. This is why both parents continue working very hard, tirelessly, with the only purpose of improving her treatment and buying the medicines she requires every day. To increase their income, Queta and her husband opened a soda fountain in their house. The positive response received by their business in only a short time has made them very happy and they have decided to expand their site with the goal of offering greater comfort to each of their clients. This great need is essentially because of the expenses generated by the illness of their little girl, so they can continue to live without fear of the disease. I hope you can help this family, requiring US $175, to make each of their wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Queta es una dama que hasta ahora junto a su esposo a podido ocuparse en muchas actividades para educar a sus tres hijas y brindarles bienestar dentro de su hogar. Sin embargo su segunda hijita es quién necesita de mayor atención y cuidado debido a que sufre una penosa enfermedad la cual ha padecido desde que tenía seis años de edad. Por esta razón ambos siguen trabajando muy duro e incansablemente con el único propósito de mejorar su tratamiento y adquirir las medicinas que ingiere diariamente.Para incrementar sus ingresos Queta y su esposo abrieron una fuente de soda en casa con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos. La acogida que han obtenido en poco tiempo los tiene muy contentos y han decidido ampliar sus instalaciones con el objetivo de brindarles mayor comodidad a cada uno de sus clientes, esta gran necesidad es básicamente por los gastos que genera la enfermedad de su pequeña para poder seguir viviendo sin temores en relación a su enfermedad.Espero que usted pueda ayudar a esta familia que requiere de 175 dólares para cristalizar cada uno de sus anhelos.

loans.use: Expanding a soda fountain locale.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a noble and hardworking mother who devotes herself to various activities with the only wish to ensure the wellbeing of each of her children. Her time is divided between her job as a seamstress and the sale of firewood among other small activities, which she can do in the comfort of her own home. None of this would be possible if she didn't count with the moral support of her children, who are her best motivation and who have become her main partners. Her husband is a painter and works that job even though he does not proviD. a substantial income to their home; however Maria still considers him a great man. Today she wants to help her children become professionals and to achieve this goal she requires US $200 to invest in her two activities. With your collaboration, Maria will be able to make a success of her business and her home, and help her children become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Luisa es una noble y trabajadora madre que se dedica a diversas labores con el único deseo D. procurarles bienestar a cada uno D. sus hijos.El tiempo del que dispone lo diviD. entre su labor D. modista y el D. L. venta D. leña entre otras pequeñas actividades que desempeña en L. comodidad D. su hogar. Nada D. esto podría tener buen término si no tuviera el apoyo moral y efectivo D. sus hijos que son sus mejores motivadores y se han convertido en sus mayores socios. Su esposo es pintor y se dedica a esta labor aunque no encuentre un ingreso sustancial para su hogar; sin embargo Maria no deja D. considerarlo como un gran hombre. Hoy tiene que dedicarse a hacer D. sus hijos unos grandes profesionales y para hacer realidad este propósito requiere D. 200 dólares para invertirlos en sus dos actividades.Con tu colaboración Maria podrá hacer D. su negocio y su hogar un lugar próspero y D. sus hijos unos buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Buying materials for seamstress business.

loans.name: Faasega

texts.en:
Faasega is a 21-year-old woman, married with zero kids. She is very talented in making elei and printing materials, which she learned through courses in school.

Even without a regular job, she is very hopeful. Her first loan of $300 USD from SPBD was used to buy all the tools needed to start her business. Her business has been going well thus far, and she hopes that her next loans can be used to improve and expand it. She really appreciates the help she has received from SPBD through its loans, because without them, her business would not have been possible.

loans.use: To buy paintings, brushes, materials and elei woods for her business

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en:
Leotele is a 27-year-old mother of one daughter. When she was young, she learned the retail shop business from her parents who also ran a shop. Now, she is trying to build a bigger and better shop for herself by working very hard.

She started off with a $300 USD loan, which was used to stock her shop, which at that point was just laying out products on tables outside. Then, she applied for her second loan of $440 USD, which was used to build a small room to sell her products. This has allowed her to sell more products.

Her business is growing well and she is developing more and more business skills through her hard work and devotion. She hopes to remain with SPBD’s loan program for a long time and plans to receive more loans in the future.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Lupepe

texts.en:
Lupepe is a 42-year-old mother of four kids and lives with her extended family of more than ten people. She works very hard at her small business of selling chips. She knows it’s a very tough business, but she commits all her time in it because it is her only source of income.

Her first $300 USD loan was used to buy ingredients and expensive tools for making the chips. She goes around to the hospital, schools and the town area for delivering her chips. This is the hardest part of her work and also takes the most time. The business is important for supporting her children’s schooling fees, as well as for her family’s daily needs. Her next loan will be used to buy a gas oven for frying her chips more easily and for repairing the house.

loans.use: To buy  ingredients to make chips.

loans.name: María Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar is a woman who has provided along with her husband a situation of well being for her two young children. Through a lot of hard work Pilar has become an excellent pastry maker and her community appreciates the delicious cakes that she sells in the streets of Tarma, her beautiful village.

She wishes to purchase a small shop to create and sell her pastries in a more comfortable environment. This objective motivates Pilar to continue marketing her pastries with great enthusiasm. Her aspirations become greater since she knows that through you she will obtain the financing to increase her production in benefit of her family.

Let´s help this young mother continue to create delicious pastries so that she can continue to sweeten the lives of her little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Pilar es una señora que hasta hoy ha procurado bienestar a su familia junto a su esposo para alegría y comodidad de sus dos pequeños hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar.Con mucho esfuerzo Pilar dentro de su ciudad se ha convertido en una excelente repostera y deleita a su comunidad con sus deliciosos pastelitos tarde a tarde en las inmediaciones de las calles más concurridas de su bella ciudad, Tarma. Su actual labor la lleva a desear adquirir una casita para poder abrir una pastelería y ofrecer tranquila y cómodamente sus apetitosos productos. Este sueño hace que día a día ofrezca sus productos con mayores ganas y entusiasmo. Sus esperanzas se incrementan aún más cuando sabe que a través de usted podrá obtener el ansiado financiamiento para acrecentar su producción en beneficio y bienestar de su familia.Hagamos que esta joven madre siga elaborando apetitosos pastelitos y continúe agregando dulzura a las vidas de sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the production of pastries and cakes

loans.name: Vaalotu

texts.en:
Vaalotu is a 22-year-old woman with two kids. She became very interested in cooking barbecue foods when she worked at a restaurant last year. Now, she plans to start her own personal barbecue business.

When she received her first loan of $300 USD, she used it to buy all the ingredients needed for making different meats. She sells the food in front of her house, close to the main road where many people pass by. She hopes to use her next loan to buy a gas oven so that it is much easier to cook her food, and in turn, bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her barbecue business

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en:
Faavale is a 59-year old widow with nine children. Despite her age, she is very keen on making full use of her barbecuing talents. She is a very good cook of all kinds of cuisines, but she chose to pursue a barbeque business.

She spent her first loan of $300 USD to start up this barbecue business. She lives in the town where many night clubs and entertainment joints are located. She carries out her business mostly during the night, so she can satisfy the after-hour cravings of the townspeople. She hopes that her next loan will allow her to build a small house and to buy a new oven for her business. She also hopes to stay in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy different meats needed for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Vaselisa

texts.en:
Vaselisa is a 31-year-old woman with three children. She lives with her immediate and extended family of more than ten people, only one of whom is employed. Money is a very big concern for her family so that is why she applied for her initial loan amount of $300 USD.

With this loan, she hopes to buy all the ingredients needed for her chips business. This business includes sales of bananas, drippings, salt and plastic bags. She sells her chips at the nearby schools and also at the national hospital where most of her buyers are concentrated.

She can now provide for her family by buying food every day, as well as supporting her kids’ schooling. She believes that the loan program has provided a very big help to her and her family, and she appreciates it very much.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her chips business

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en:
Faalaniga is a 28-year-old lady with two kids. Her loan is for buying all the ingredients, such as bread, ham, eggs, onions and vegetables - all required for her sandwich business.

She sells the sandwiches at the nearby school, village shops and sometimes also gets orders from shops in town. This simple business helps her meet her personal and family needs as well as her kids' schooling fees. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair her family's damaged house and towards school fees. She is very happy and appreciative to stay with SPBD’s loan program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her sandwich business.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is very happy with her plantation business of planting taro, yams and bananas. She also recently added vegetables, such as cucumbers and pumpkins, to supplement her income.

Her requested $800 USD loan is for buying weed-killing chemicals and fertilizers, which are much needed in maintaining the good growth of her plantation. She hopes for another loan to help buy a second-hand pick-up truck for delivering her produce to the market. She is very thankful for the financial support she looks forward to receiving and paying back within the loan term.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals and fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Nasareta

texts.en: Nasareta, 42 is a married mother of six. She runs a retail store in front of her house, serving people of her village.  She works from dawn unti dusk every day.  Her husband is one of the government’s school teachers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is the mother of two small children who are enrolled in basic courses at the school in their city. She enjoys the support and company of her husband, who makes a living through the extraction of wood. It is for this reason that Nelly decided to begin selling the wood to increase their profits and to avoid the loss of money that happens when they use third party sellers. With the intention of starting her work soon, Nelly set up a small space in her home to keep the wood her loving husband obtains through his sacrifices safe for its later marketing. Before summer starts (along with the scarcity of wood extraction), they have to increase the quantity that they have in their small warehouse, and to be able to carry out their goal, they need the help of each one of you. With the profits that they receive from the sales of their products, they hope to open a small bakery so they can consolidate their income and increase the quality of life of their children. Let's help this family make their dreams a reality and remove the obstacles so they can have peace and happiness in their hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly es madre de dos pequeños niños que se encuentran aún cursando estudios básicos en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, goza del apoyo y compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la extracción de madera; es por esta razón que ella decidió incursionar en la venta de estos productos para incrementar sus ganancias y evitar la pérdida de dinero cuando recurre a las personas intermediarias.Con el propósito de iniciar pronto con su labor acondicionó un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio con el objetivo de mantener a buen recaudo el sacrificio de su querido esposo para su posterior comercialización Antes de que se inicie la temporada de verano en la que escasea la extracción de madera, requiere acrecentar la cantidad que posee en su pequeño almacén y para llevar a cabo su propósito requiere de la ayuda de cada uno de ustedes.Así mismo con las ganancias que reciban por la venta de sus productos desean aperturar una pequeña panadería para que puedan consolidar sus ingresos e incrementar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.Hagamos que esta familia convierta sus sueños en realidad y extraiga los obstáculos para sembrar paz y alegría en sus corazones.

loans.use: Purchase and supply of wood to increase their sales

loans.name: Fiso

texts.en: Fiso is a mother of six .  She is 40 years old and is married to a farmer from Salesatele. Her business is running a taro plantation; she is requesting a loan of $300 to buy some weed killer, fertilizers and kniver for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy gramoxone (a weed-killer), fertilizer, and knives for her plantation

loans.name: Tilomai

texts.en: Tilomai is a 43-year-old married mother of two. She runs a bingo business which she runs twice a week at night.  She earns $300-$400 a week.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bingo business

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada is a hard working entrepeneur from Huancayo. Her shingle business was started a generation ago by her parents. Fourteen years ago she married and now she has two young children. The children are a great source of joy for the blessed couple.

Thanks to their business, Ada and her husband have been able to provide an education to their offspring. She is very happy with the scholastic aptitudes of her children and one of her greatest wishes is for them to become succesful in life.

Ada would like to improve her family´s quality of life which she will accomplish through self-sacrifice and hard work. To this end, she addresses herself to your generous hearts to obtain the $850 in financing to start her projects as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Ada es una mujer emprendedora que día a día trabaja diligentemente para generar el sustento diario de su querida familia, ella es natural de Huancayo y de sus padres heredó el oficio de fabricar tejas (láminas fabricadas de arcilla) que sirven para techar las casas construidas de material rústico.Su labor se acentúo hace 14 años cuando contrajo matrimonio con su querido compañero y fruto del gran amor que se tienen actualmente cobijan en su hogar con mucho cariño a sus dos pequeños niños quienes les dan mucha alegría y sentido a sus vidas.Gracias a este oficio en poco tiempo ha fortalecido la educación de sus hijos y contempla con mucha satisfacción su desempeño escolar. Ada tiene grandes anhelos y uno de ellos es poder observarlos convertidos en unos exitosos profesionales. Así mismo desea incrementar la comodidad y calidad de vida de su familia, entiende que este propósito sólo puede alcanzarse con sacrificio y mucho trabajo y por ello recurre a cada uno de vuestros generosos corazones para obtener el financiamiento solicitado a fin de iniciar sus proyectos pronto.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the fabrication of roof shingles.

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is 31 year old married woman with children. Her business is making and selling banana chips at her own village and shops in town and she earns $150.00-$200.00 a day.  Her first loan used to help out with her business and her family expenditures.  She is also applying for another loan to fix the floor of her house that she uses for the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her banana chips shop and to fix the floor of her house

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en: F. is a mother of 5.  She is 34 years of age and runs a business selling handicrafts in flea markets at Fugalei. She was previously employed at one of the companies in town but she resigned because the pay she got from the company is lower than the money she earns from her business every week.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market stall

loans.name: Tuugafala

texts.en: Tuugafala is 45 years of age and has 7 children.  Her business is a retail shop just in front of her house.  Her husband's pay and the income from her shop is how she supports her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is one of the new members at Malie P centre.  She is 46 years old and has one child.  She joined the Program last week when she needed help for her small business.  She sells handicrafts to people of her village and also delivers to them to shops in town.  She earns $100.00-200.00 a week and uses that money for her family expenditures.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market stall

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana S. is 35 years old and a mother of five.  She has a vegetable garden and she sells the vegetables that she grows.  She hardly needs any help from her husband  and she does the gardening by herself.  Her  two sons eleven and thirteen year old help her out.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia was born and grew up in town but married to a farmer from Leloto Leauvaa. She is 45 years of age and has one son.  She runs a vegetable garden and is requesting a loan to buy supplies for it.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden
